original: des kyang bzlog nas /
analyzed: des kyang bzlog nas /
translated: If that does not work,

original: ting nge 'dzin dag la sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dag la sbyor bar byed de /
translated: they will apply themselves to the meditative concentrations.

original: de dag gi ting nge 'dzin de dag kyang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ting nge 'dzin de dag kyang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And those meditative concentrations will lead to rebirth in the world of Brahmā.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po las bzlog nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po las bzlog nas /
translated: In the same way, having turned away from the first concentration,

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la rab tu 'god par byed do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la rab tu 'god par byed do //
translated: they will be established in the second concentration.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa las bzlog nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa las bzlog nas /
translated: Having turned away from the second concentration,

original: bsam gtan gsum pa la rab tu 'god par byed do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la rab tu 'god par byed do //
translated: they will be established in the third concentration.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa las bzlog nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa las bzlog nas /
translated: Having turned away from the third concentration,

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la rab tu 'god par byed do //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la rab tu 'god par byed do //
translated: they will be established in the fourth concentration.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa las bzlog nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa las bzlog nas /
translated: Having turned away from the fourth concentration,

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la rab tu 'god par byed do //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la rab tu 'god par byed do //
translated: they will be established in the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on up to

original: ci rigs par 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la rab tu 'god par byed do //
analyzed: ci rigs par 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la rab tu 'god par byed do //
translated: they will be established in the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de las kyang bzlog nas /
analyzed: de las kyang bzlog nas /
translated: Having turned away from that,

original: theg pa gsum po dag la rab tu 'god par byed do //
analyzed: theg pa gsum po dag la rab tu 'god par byed do //
translated: He establishes them in the three vehicles.

original: de nas sems can kha cig sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i 'bras bu de las bzlog nas /
analyzed: de nas sems can kha cig sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i 'bras bu de las bzlog nas /
translated: Then, some beings, having been turned away from generosity and the results of generosity,

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'dzud par byed /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'dzud par byed /
translated: he causes to enter into the realm of nirvāṇa without remainder of aggregates.

original: rab tu 'god par byed do //
analyzed: rab tu 'god par byed do //
translated: He establishes them.

original: sems can kha cig ni tshul @347b khrims kyi phung po de las bzlog nas /
analyzed: sems can kha cig ni tshul @347b khrims kyi phung po de las bzlog nas /
translated: Some beings, having been turned away from the aggregate of morality and the results of morality,

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'dzud par byed /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'dzud par byed /
translated: he causes to enter into the realm of nirvāṇa without remainder of aggregates.

original: rab tu 'god par byed do //
analyzed: rab tu 'god par byed do //
translated: He establishes them.

original: sems can kha cig ni bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu de dag las rnam grangs du mas bzlog cing /
analyzed: sems can kha cig ni bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu de dag las rnam grangs du mas bzlog cing /
translated: Some beings, having been turned away from the results of meditative stabilization through many enumerations,

original: 'dun pa bzlog nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'dzud par byed /
analyzed: 'dun pa bzlog nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'dzud par byed /
translated: having turned away from aspiration, he causes to enter into the realm of nirvāṇa.

original: rab tu 'god par byed do //
analyzed: rab tu 'god par byed do //
translated: He establishes them.

original: sems can kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu de dag las rnam grangs du mas bzlog cing /🔽'dun pa bzlog nas /
analyzed: sems can kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu de dag las rnam grangs du mas bzlog cing / 'dun pa bzlog nas /
translated: Some beings he turns away from meditative absorption, meditative equipoise, the results of meditative absorption, and the results of meditative equipoise, and he turns them away from their inclinations.

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'dzud par byed /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'dzud par byed /
translated: He causes them to enter into the realm of nirvāṇa that is without the remainder of the skandhas.

original: rab tu 'god par byed do //
analyzed: rab tu 'god par byed do //
translated: He causes them to be established in that.

original: sems can kha cig ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: sems can kha cig ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: Some beings he causes to enter into and be established in the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu po dag la 'dzud par byed /🔽rab tu 'god par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu po dag la 'dzud par byed /🔽rab tu 'god par byed do //
translated: the three gateways to liberation, the eight aspects of liberation, and the nine serial steps of meditative absorption.

original: sems can kha cig ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la 'dzud @348a *//
analyzed: sems can kha cig ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la 'dzud @348a *//
translated: Some beings he introduces to the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great loving kindness, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽

original: par byed / rab tu 'god par byed do //🔽de zag pa med pa'i chos bstan du med pa /
analyzed: par byed / rab tu 'god par byed do // de zag pa med pa'i chos bstan du med pa /
translated: Some beings he introduces to and establishes in the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great loving kindness, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽Those uncontaminated dharmas are not taught and are unimpeded.

original: thogs pa med pa de dag dang ldan pas /🔽sems can kha cig ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god par byed do //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa de dag dang ldan pas / sems can kha cig ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god par byed do //
translated: Endowed with those,🔽he introduces some beings to and establishes them in the result of Stream-Winner.

original: sems can kha cig ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god par byed do //
analyzed: sems can kha cig ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god par byed do //
translated: He introduces some beings to and establishes them in the result of Once-Returner.

original: kha cig ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la /🔽kha cig ni dgra bcom pa nyid la /
analyzed: kha cig ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la / kha cig ni dgra bcom pa nyid la /
translated: Some in the result of Non-Returner.🔽Some in the state of a Worthy One.

original: kha cig ni rang byang chub la rab tu 'god par byed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni rang byang chub la rab tu 'god par byed do //
translated: Some in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: gang dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer ba de dag la rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam rjod par byed /
analyzed: gang dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer ba de dag la rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam rjod par byed /
translated: They explain the path to complete enlightenment to those who are intent on unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: ston par byed /
analyzed: ston par byed /
translated: They teach it.

original: sems can de dag la yang dag par gzengs bstod par byed /
analyzed: sems can de dag la yang dag par gzengs bstod par byed /
translated: They encourage those beings.

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed de /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed de /
translated: They delight them.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: Subhūti, in that way bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: rmi lam lta bu'i chos rnams dang / sprul pa'i bar lta bu'i chos rnams dang / dngos po med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin no //🔽de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i chos rnams dang / sprul pa'i bar lta bu'i chos rnams dang / dngos po med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin no // de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: establish those dharmas that are like a dream, up to those dharmas that are like a magical creation, those dharmas that are not a thing, those dharmas that are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, and those dharmas that are empty of their own marks.”🔽The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: kye ma byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi @348b pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: kye ma byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi @348b pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid la spyod pa ni /
translated: “Ah! The bodhisattva great beings who practice this profound perfection of wisdom

original: rmi lam lta bu'i chos rnams dang / dngos po ma mchis pa dang / dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi chos rnams la /
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i chos rnams dang / dngos po ma mchis pa dang / dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi chos rnams la /
translated: are those who, with respect to phenomena that are like a dream, that are non-existent, that are the nature of non-existence, that are the emptiness of what transcends limits, and that are the emptiness of what is beginningless and endless,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: are as follows:

original: 'di dag ni dge ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni dge ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: ‘These are virtuous phenomena.

original: 'di dag ni mi dge ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mi dge ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: These are non-virtuous phenomena.

original: 'di dag ni lung du bstan pa dag go; 'di dag ni lung du ma bstan pa dag go /🔽'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa dag go /
analyzed: 'di dag ni lung du bstan pa dag go; 'di dag ni lung du ma bstan pa dag go / 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa dag go /
translated: These are determinate. These are indeterminate.

original: 'di dag ni zag pa med pa dag go /🔽'di dag ni 'jig rten pa dag go /
analyzed: 'di dag ni zag pa med pa dag go / 'di dag ni 'jig rten pa dag go /
translated: These are contaminated. These are uncontaminated.

original: 'di dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa dag go /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa dag go /
translated: These are mundane. These are supramundane.

original: 'di dag ni 'dus byas so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dus byas so //
translated: These are conditioned.

original: 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams so zhes rnam par 'jog par bgyid pa 'di ni ngo mtshar lags so //🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams so zhes rnam par 'jog par bgyid pa 'di ni ngo mtshar lags so // de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: These are unconditioned phenomena.”

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him, “Lord, it is amazing how much the bodhisattva great beings have gained, how much the bodhisattva great beings have obtained, how much the bodhisattva great beings have achieved, how much the bodhisattva great beings have accomplished, that they have been able to set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and that they will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽Lord, it is amazing how much the bodhisattva great beings have gained, how much the bodhisattva great beings have obtained, how much the bodhisattva great beings have achieved, how much the bodhisattva great beings have accomplished, that they have been able to set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and that they will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽Lord, it is amazing how much the bodhisattva great beings have gained, how much the bodhisattva great beings have obtained, how much the bodhisattva great beings have achieved, how much the bodhisattva great beings have accomplished, that they have been able to set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and that they will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽Lord, it is amazing how much the bodhisattva great beings have gained, how much the bodhisattva great beings have obtained, how much the bodhisattva great beings have achieved, how much the bodhisattva great beings have accomplished, that they have been able to set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and that they will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽Lord, it is amazing how much the bodhisattva great beings have gained, how much the bodhisattva great beings have obtained, how much the bodhisattva great beings have achieved, how much the bodhisattva great beings have accomplished, that they have been able to set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and that they will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa gang chos rnams kyi rnam par 'jog par byed pa de ni /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin no //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa gang chos rnams kyi rnam par 'jog par byed pa de ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin no //
translated: Subhūti having said that, the Lord said to him, “Subhūti, it is so; it is just as you have said.

original: rab 'byor / gal te khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos gang dag yin @349a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos gang dag yin @349a *//
translated: Subhūti, it is amazing how much the bodhisattva great beings have gained, how much the bodhisattva great beings have obtained, how much the bodhisattva great beings have achieved, how much the bodhisattva great beings have accomplished, that they have been able to set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and that they will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete

original: pa ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos gang dag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la med pa dag shes na ni de'i phyir nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la lan du phan gdags par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: pa ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos gang dag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la med pa dag shes na ni de'i phyir nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la lan du phan gdags par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: If he knows the teachings that are wondrous and marvelous, which are not present in the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, then it is not easy for all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas to repay the bodhisattva great being for his kindness.

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos gang dag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la ma mchis pa de dag gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos gang dag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la ma mchis pa de dag gang lags /
translated: “Lord, what are the wondrous and marvelous teachings that are not present in all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, which the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom have?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Śāriputra, the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom have the wondrous and marvelous teachings that are not present in all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas. What are those wondrous and marvelous teachings?

original: yid la zung zhig dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos gang dag yin pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la zung zhig dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos gang dag yin pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: Listen well and I will explain to you the qualities that are the marvels and wonders of bodhisattva great beings practicing this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la gnas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la gnas shing /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom, standing in the six perfections arisen from maturation,

original: mngon par shes pa lnga dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: the five clairvoyances, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres @349b pa bco brgyad la gnas nas /
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres @349b pa bco brgyad la gnas nas /
translated: the great love, the great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag tu song ste /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag tu song ste /
translated: Having gone to the world systems in the ten directions,

original: de dag tu sems can gang dag sbyin pas bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni sbyin pas yongs su sdud do //
analyzed: de dag tu sems can gang dag sbyin pas bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni sbyin pas yongs su sdud do //
translated: he gathers in those sentient beings who are to be gathered in by generosity, he gathers them in by means of generosity.

original: gang dag tshul khrims kyis bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag bzod pas bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag brtson 'grus kyis bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag bsam gtan gyis bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag shes rab kyis bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni shes rab kyis yongs su sdud do //
analyzed: gang dag tshul khrims kyis bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag bzod pas bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag brtson 'grus kyis bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag bsam gtan gyis bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag shes rab kyis bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni shes rab kyis yongs su sdud do //
translated: He gathers in those who are to be gathered in by morality, by means of morality. He gathers in those who are to be gathered in by patience, by means of patience. He gathers in those who are to be gathered in by effort, by means of effort. He gathers in those who are to be gathered in by meditation, by means of meditation. He gathers in those who are to be gathered in by wisdom, by means of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du sems can gang dag tshad med pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhis bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can gang dag tshad med pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhis bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang /
translated: Similarly, he gathers in those sentient beings who are to be gathered in by the four immeasurables, the four meditations, the four formless absorptions, the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar gyis yongs su sdud do //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar gyis yongs su sdud do //
translated: those that are included in the four applications of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven limbs of awakening, and the eightfold noble path, are included in the eightfold noble path.

original: de bzhin du gang dag stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dag stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni /
translated: Similarly, those that are included in the emptiness meditative stabilization, those that are included in the signless meditative stabilization, and those that are included in the wishless meditative stabilization,

original: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis yongs su sdud do //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis yongs su sdud do //
translated: are included in the wishless meditative stabilization.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @350a *//🔽pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @350a *// pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas /
translated: standing in the six perfections that have arisen from maturation,

original: de bzhin du mngon par shes pa lnga dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la gnas nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon par shes pa lnga dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la gnas nas /
translated: unhindered knowledges,

original: sems can gang dag sbyin pas bsdu bar bya ba de dag ji ltar sbyin pas yongs su sdud ce na /
analyzed: sems can gang dag sbyin pas bsdu bar bya ba de dag ji ltar sbyin pas yongs su sdud ce na /
translated: how does he, with giving, gather those beings who should be gathered with giving?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sems can rnams la sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: sems can rnams la sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
translated: give gifts to beings.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽zas 'dod pa rnams la ni zas /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / zas 'dod pa rnams la ni zas /
translated: They are as follows:🔽to those who want food, they give food;

original: skom 'dod pa rnams la ni skom /🔽bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la ni bzhon pa /
analyzed: skom 'dod pa rnams la ni skom / bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la ni bzhon pa /
translated: to those who want drink, they give drink;🔽to those who want vehicles, they give vehicles;

original: gos 'dod pa rnams la ni gos /🔽me tog 'dod pa rnams la ni me tog /
analyzed: gos 'dod pa rnams la ni gos / me tog 'dod pa rnams la ni me tog /
translated: to those who want clothes, they give clothes;🔽to those who want flowers, they give flowers;

original: phreng ba 'dod pa rnams la ni phreng ba /🔽spos 'dod pa rnams la ni spos /🔽byug pa 'dod pa rnams la ni byug pa /
analyzed: phreng ba 'dod pa rnams la ni phreng ba / spos 'dod pa rnams la ni spos / byug pa 'dod pa rnams la ni byug pa /
translated: to those who want garlands, they give garlands;🔽to those who want incense, they give incense;🔽to those who want ointments, they give ointments;

original: mal cha 'dod pa rnams la ni mal cha /
analyzed: mal cha 'dod pa rnams la ni mal cha /
translated: to those who want bedding, they give bedding;

original: stan 'dod pa rnams la ni stan /
analyzed: stan 'dod pa rnams la ni stan /
translated: to those who want seats, they give seats;

original: mar me 'dod pa rnams la ni mar me /
analyzed: mar me 'dod pa rnams la ni mar me /
translated: To those who want lamps, he gives lamps.

original: na ba'i gsos sman 'dod pa nas mi'i yo byad ci'ang rung ba'i bar du 'dod pa rnams la ni sbyin par byed de /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la ji ltar dbul ba de bzhin du nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la'ang chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang /
analyzed: na ba'i gsos sman 'dod pa nas mi'i yo byad ci'ang rung ba'i bar du 'dod pa rnams la ni sbyin par byed de / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la ji ltar dbul ba de bzhin du nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la'ang chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang /
translated: To those who want medicine to cure the sick, up to those who want any human necessities, he gives them.🔽Just as he gives to the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones, in the same way he gives Dharma robes, alms-food, bedding, medicine for curing the sick,

original: yo byad rnams sbyin @350b par byed do //
analyzed: yo byad rnams sbyin @350b par byed do //
translated: and necessities to the Shravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / mar dang / 'bru mar dang / mar me dag sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / mar dang / 'bru mar dang / mar me dag sbyin par byed do //
translated: He gives flowers, garlands, incense, ointments, powders, parasols, victory banners, flags, butter, oil, and lamps.

original: ji ltar tshul khrims dang ldan pa de dag la sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de bzhin du tshul khrims 'chal ba rnams la'ang sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar tshul khrims dang ldan pa de dag la sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de bzhin du tshul khrims 'chal ba rnams la'ang sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
translated: Just as he gives gifts to those who are moral, so he gives gifts to those who are immoral.

original: de bzhin du mi rnams la'ang sbyin pa sbyin //🔽par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rnams la'ang sbyin pa sbyin // par byed do //
translated: In the same way, he gives gifts to humans.

original: de bzhin du mi ma yin par gyur pa rnams la'ang sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi ma yin par gyur pa rnams la'ang sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
translated: In the same way, he gives gifts to non-humans.

original: de snod dang snod ma yin par yongs su mi rtog gi /🔽sems can thams cad la tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi 'du shes nye bar bzhag nas /
analyzed: de snod dang snod ma yin par yongs su mi rtog gi / sems can thams cad la tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi 'du shes nye bar bzhag nas /
translated: He does not discriminate between suitable and unsuitable recipients.

original: sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
translated: He gives gifts to all sentient beings, having established the perception that they are not different.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad tha dad pa med par rtogs pa'i phyir yongs su shes shing mngon du byas nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad tha dad pa med par rtogs pa'i phyir yongs su shes shing mngon du byas nas /
translated: Because he has understood and realized that all phenomena are not different.

original: de tha dad pa med pa'i sbyin pa byin pas /
analyzed: de tha dad pa med pa'i sbyin pa byin pas /
translated: By giving gifts that are not different,

original: tha dad pa med pa'i chos /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i chos /
translated: he attains a Dharma that is not different,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags mthong na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags mthong na /
translated: “Subhūti, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva sees a being born in the animal realm,

original: 'di snyam du bdag gi sbyin gnas ni /
analyzed: 'di snyam du bdag gi sbyin gnas ni /
translated: he should think, ‘My field of giving

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin gyi /🔽dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems bskyed na /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin gyi / dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems bskyed na /
translated: is the perfect Buddha,🔽not one born in the animal realm.’

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma yin no //
translated: If he thinks this, it is not the Dharma of the bodhisattvas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rang gi sems yongs su dag na /
analyzed: rang gi sems yongs su dag na /
translated: If his own mind is pure,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i @351a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i @351a *//
translated: the bodhisattva’s

original: sbyin gnas yongs su dag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sbyin gnas yongs su dag pa'i phyir te /
translated: field of giving is pure.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni bdag gis sems can dbul po 'di dag sbyin pas bsdus na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni bdag gis sems can dbul po 'di dag sbyin pas bsdus na /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva thinks, ‘If I gather these poor beings through giving,

original: gzhan gyi rdzas dag la rku bar mi 'gyur zhing chog shes par gyur nas gzhan dag la'ang sbyin pa byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rdzas dag la rku bar mi 'gyur zhing chog shes par gyur nas gzhan dag la'ang sbyin pa byed par 'gyur /
translated: they will not steal others’ possessions, and having become content, they will also give to others.’

original: de bzhin du sbyin bas bsdus na srog chags rnams kyi srog gcod par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin bas bsdus na srog chags rnams kyi srog gcod par mi 'gyur /
translated: In the same way, if you gather beings through generosity, you will not kill living beings.

original: de bzhin du sbyin pas bsdus na /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pas bsdus na /
translated: In the same way, if you gather beings through generosity,

original: rdzun mi zer /🔽phra ma mi smra /🔽dag rtsub po mi smra /
analyzed: rdzun mi zer / phra ma mi smra / dag rtsub po mi smra /
translated: you will not tell lies.🔽You will not speak divisively.🔽You will not speak harshly.

original: tshig 'khyal pa mi smra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshig 'khyal pa mi smra bar 'gyur te /
translated: You will not speak meaninglessly.

original: de dag rgyu des lus zhig pa'i 'og tu /
analyzed: de dag rgyu des lus zhig pa'i 'og tu /
translated: By that cause, after the breakup of the body,

original: rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i khyim dag tu skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i khyim dag tu skye bar 'gyur /
translated: they will be reborn in the great sāla tree–like royal families.

original: de bzhin du bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i khyim dag tu skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i khyim dag tu skye bar 'gyur /
translated: In the same way, they will be reborn in the great sāla tree–like brahmin families.

original: khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i khyim dag tu skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i khyim dag tu skye bar 'gyur /
translated: They will be reborn in the great sāla tree–like business families.🔽By that very cause,

original: de dag rgyu de nyid kyis /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag rgyu de nyid kyis / 'di lta ste /
translated: they will go forth🔽from the home life into the teachings of those very blessed ones.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: They will go forth in the vehicle of the hearers,🔽in the vehicle of the solitary buddhas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
translated: The vehicle of the solitary realizers🔽

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pas phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i myang na las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du 'gyur ro snyam nas /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pas phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i myang na las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du 'gyur ro snyam nas /
translated: and with the vehicle of the Perfectly Awakened Ones, up to the realm of nirvana without remainder of the aggregates.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdag gis sems can mgon med pa rnams kyi mgon dang / gnas med pa rnams kyi gnas dang / yongs su 'dren pa med pa rnams @351b kyi yongs su 'dren par 'gyur bar bya'o zhes sngon yi dam 'di ma bcas sam /🔽phyir rgol ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdag gis sems can mgon med pa rnams kyi mgon dang / gnas med pa rnams kyi gnas dang / yongs su 'dren pa med pa rnams @351b kyi yongs su 'dren par 'gyur bar bya'o zhes sngon yi dam 'di ma bcas sam / phyir rgol ba'am /
translated: “Have I not previously made this vow: ‘I will be the protector of those beings who have no protector, the guide of those who have no guide, the light of those who have no light, and the rest for those who have no rest’?🔽“When I see a foe,

original: gsod pa mthong ngam /
analyzed: gsod pa mthong ngam /
translated: or someone who has come to kill me,

original: gzhan gang dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus bslangs na'ang des sbyin nam mi sbyin snyam du sems gzhan bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gang dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus bslangs na'ang des sbyin nam mi sbyin snyam du sems gzhan bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: or someone else who asks for the bodhisattva great being’s body, I should not arouse any other thought than ‘I will give it away’ or ‘I will not give it away.’

original: 'khrug pa med pa'i sems kyis phyir rgol ba dang / gsod pa de dag la rang gi lus sbyin par bya'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrug pa med pa'i sems kyis phyir rgol ba dang / gsod pa de dag la rang gi lus sbyin par bya'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: With a mind free from agitation, he should give his body to those who are hostile and those who are killers. And why?

original: 'di ltar de ni sems can thams cad kyi don dang / phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni sems can thams cad kyi don dang / phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa yin gyi /
translated: Because he has set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of the welfare, benefit, and happiness of all sentient beings,

original: lus dang srog gi phyir ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang srog gi phyir ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: not for the sake of body and life.

original: gal te sbyin nam mi sbyin snyam du rnam par rtog par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te sbyin nam mi sbyin snyam du rnam par rtog par gyur na ni /
translated: If he should think, ‘Should I give or should I not give?’

original: de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / de las gzhan pa 'phags pa'i gang zag de dag dang / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin gyi 'jig rten gyis kyang de la khyod la sus gsol ba btab na /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / de las gzhan pa 'phags pa'i gang zag de dag dang / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin gyi 'jig rten gyis kyang de la khyod la sus gsol ba btab na /
translated: then the lord buddhas, the bodhisattva great beings, the pratyekabuddhas, the other noble beings, and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas will all say to him, ‘Who has asked you

original: bdag sems can thams cad kyi skyabs dang / gnas dang / mgon dang dpung gnyen dang / yongs su 'dren par 'gyur bar bya'o zhes sngon gyi tshe rabs su yi dam 'di bcas zhes smad par 'gyur ro //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa las /
analyzed: bdag sems can thams cad kyi skyabs dang / gnas dang / mgon dang dpung gnyen dang / yongs su 'dren par 'gyur bar bya'o zhes sngon gyi tshe rabs su yi dam 'di bcas zhes smad par 'gyur ro // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa las /
translated: I will be a refuge, a support, a protector, a final relief, and a guide for all sentient beings.”

original: mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i le'u zhes bya ste nyi shu brgyad pa'o ////
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i le'u zhes bya ste nyi shu brgyad pa'o ////
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines, this is the chapter called “The Distinctive Characteristics.”

original: de @352a *// nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de @352a *// nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti addressed the Blessed One as follows:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Reverend Lord!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ji ltar chos kyi sbyin pas sems can rnams sdud par byed /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ji ltar chos kyi sbyin pas sems can rnams sdud par byed /
translated: How do great bodhisattva beings, when practicing the transcendent perfection of wisdom, attract sentient beings through the gift of the sacred doctrine?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams chos kyi sbyin pas sems can rnams sdud pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams chos kyi sbyin pas sems can rnams sdud pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Subhūti, here the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom gathers beings with the gift of the Dharma in two ways.

original: rab 'byor 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, the gift of the Dharma is mundane and supramundane.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mundane gift of the Dharma?

original: gang 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams brjod pa dang / 'chad pa dang / rab tu ston pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams brjod pa dang / 'chad pa dang / rab tu ston pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: It is the explanation, teaching, demonstration, and discernment of mundane dharmas.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mi sdug pa'i le'u dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga brjod pa dang; 'chad pa dang / rab tu ston pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i le'u dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga brjod pa dang; 'chad pa dang / rab tu ston pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: the chapter on foulness, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the five kinds of superknowledge, and the explanation, teaching, demonstration, and discernment of those.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the mundane gift of the Dharma.

original: ci'i phyir 'jig rten pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jig rten pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they called mundane?

original: 'jig rten las mi 'phags pas; de'i phyir 'jig rten pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las mi 'phags pas; de'i phyir 'jig rten pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they do not transcend the world, they are called mundane.

original: de dag ni 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa de byin nas /
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa de byin nas /
translated: Having given that mundane generosity,

original: rnam grangs du mas sems can de dag bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med @352b pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa de dag las 'byed par byed /
analyzed: rnam grangs du mas sems can de dag bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med @352b pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa de dag las 'byed par byed /
translated: they cause those beings to be separated from and turn away from those concentrations, immeasurables, formless absorptions, and higher knowledges by means of many explanations.

original: zlog par byed de /
analyzed: zlog par byed de /
translated: Having separated them and turned them away,

original: phye zhing bzlog nas kyang thabs la mkhas pas 'phags pa'i chos la 'god par byed de; 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phye zhing bzlog nas kyang thabs la mkhas pas 'phags pa'i chos la 'god par byed de; 'di lta ste /
translated: they establish them in the noble dharmas by means of skillful means, namely,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la 'god par byed do //
translated: in the four establishments of mindfulness, and similarly up to the noble eightfold path, and in the three doors of liberation.

original: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / rang byang chub kyi bar la 'god par byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / rang byang chub kyi bar la 'god par byed de /
translated: Similarly, they establish them in the result of stream enterer, and similarly, up to in the state of a pratyekabuddha.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa yin no //
translated: This is the supramundane giving of the Dharma.

original: ci'i phyir de 'jig rten las 'das pa yin zhen 'jig rten las rgal ba dang / 'jig rten rnams kyi gong na 'dug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de 'jig rten las 'das pa yin zhen 'jig rten las rgal ba dang / 'jig rten rnams kyi gong na 'dug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it supramundane? Because it transcends the world and is above the world.

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams ni gang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams ni gang /
translated: What are the noble dharmas?

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu ni gang zhe na /
translated: What are the fruits of the noble dharmas?

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The noble dharmas are

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag go /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag go /
translated: the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the three gateways to liberation, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, and so on up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: 'phags pa'i chos kyi 'bras bu dag ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos kyi 'bras bu dag ni /
translated: The fruits of the noble dharmas

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: are as follows:

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: the fruit of entering the stream, and similarly, connect this with each,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs byang chub kyi bar dag go /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs byang chub kyi bar dag go /
translated: up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor / de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta mod kyi /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi 'phags pa'i chos rnams ni gang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu shes pa @353a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi 'phags pa'i chos rnams ni gang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu shes pa @353a *//
translated: The noble dharmas of bodhisattva great beings are the knowledge of the fruit of stream enterer,

original: dang / rang byang chub shes pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bar du shes pa dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu shes pa nas /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du shes pa dang / de bzhin du zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang / 'dus byas dang /
analyzed: dang / rang byang chub shes pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bar du shes pa dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu shes pa nas / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du shes pa dang / de bzhin du zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang / 'dus byas dang /
translated: the knowledge of the fruit of once-returner, the knowledge of the fruit of non-returner, the knowledge of the fruit of a worthy one, the knowledge of a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, and similarly, the knowledge of up to the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, and similarly, the knowledge of the ten tathāgata powers,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams shes pa ste /
translated: up to the knowledge of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and similarly, the knowledge of dharmas with defilement and without defilement, mundane and supramundane dharmas, compounded and uncompounded dharmas.

original: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi 'phags pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi 'phags pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Those are called the noble dharmas of bodhisattva great beings.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the fruit of the noble qualities of the bodhisattva great beings?”

original: gang nyon mongs pa dang / bag chags dang mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa'o //
analyzed: gang nyon mongs pa dang / bag chags dang mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa'o //
translated: It is the abandonment of all afflictions, propensities, and connections.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob lags sam /
analyzed: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob lags sam /
translated: do bodhisattva great beings also attain the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no /
translated: “Subhūti, it is so, it is so.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob bo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob bo //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings also attain the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: gsol ba / btsun @353b pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol ba / btsun @353b pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Lord,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' chen pos kyang /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' chen pos kyang /
translated: if bodhisattva great beings

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob lags na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob lags na /
translated: “If one attains the knowledge of all aspects,

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la khyad par ci mchis /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la khyad par ci mchis /
translated: then what is the difference between a bodhisattva-mahāsattva and a tathāgata, a saint, genuinely and fully awake?

original: tha dad du bgyi ba ni ci mchis /
analyzed: tha dad du bgyi ba ni ci mchis /
translated: What is the distinction to be made?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob ste /
translated: “Subhūti, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva attains the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas /
translated: Having attained the knowledge of all aspects,

original: gdod de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gdod de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: only then is he called a tathāgata.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos thams cad kyi mthar phyin pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos thams cad kyi mthar phyin pa kho na yin la /
translated: Subhūti, a tathāgata is one who has reached the end of all dharmas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
translated: while a bodhisattva is one who is pursuing.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos thams cad la mun pa med pa nyid thob pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos thams cad la mun pa med pa nyid thob pa yin la /
translated: A tathāgata is one who has attained the absence of darkness with regard to all dharmas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rjes su 'thob pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rjes su 'thob pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva is the one who attains it subsequently.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i khyad par yin no //
translated: Subhūti, this is the difference between the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One, and the bodhisattva, the great being.

original: 'di ni tha dad du bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni tha dad du bya ba yin no //
translated: This is the distinction.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa'i rten yin zhes bya'o //🔽rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @354a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa'i rten yin zhes bya'o // rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @354a *//
translated: Subhūti, the mundane giving of the Dharma by the bodhisattva, the great being, is said to be the basis for the supramundane giving of the Dharma.

original: chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pas /🔽'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa las sems can rnams btsud nas /🔽'phags pa'i gnas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa las 'dzud par byed /
analyzed: chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pas / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa las sems can rnams btsud nas / 'phags pa'i gnas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa las 'dzud par byed /
translated: Subhūti, in that way, the bodhisattva, the great being, practicing the perfection of wisdom, through skillful means,🔽having caused sentient beings to enter the mundane giving of the Dharma,

original: 'god par byed do //
analyzed: 'god par byed do //
translated: causes them to enter, causes them to abide in the supramundane giving of the Dharma, the abode of the noble ones.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la 'god par byed do;;/
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la 'god par byed do;;/
translated: Similarly, they establish them in the ten powers of the tathāgatas, and in the four fearlessnesses, four detailed and thorough knowledges, and eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, up to and in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: /'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa /🔽bam po nyi shu dgu pa /
analyzed: /'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa / bam po nyi shu dgu pa /
translated: Noble Eight Thousand: Perfection of Wisdom

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos byis pa so so'i skye bo dang thun mong ma yin pa dag gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos byis pa so so'i skye bo dang thun mong ma yin pa dag gang yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what are the supramundane dharmas of bodhisattva great beings that are not shared in common with ordinary persons?”

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “They are these:

original: dran pa nyer bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nyer bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: the four establishments of mindfulness, four right efforts, four legs of miraculous power, five faculties, five powers, seven limbs of awakening, and eightfold noble path,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: the three gateways to liberation, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of correct knowledge,

original: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis @354b dang; dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang /
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis @354b dang; dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang /
translated: great loving kindness, great compassion, the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, the thirty-two major marks and eighty minor marks of a great being, all the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad de /
translated: and all the meditative stabilization gateways.

original: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: These are the supramundane qualities of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: de dag brjod pa dang / 'chad pa dang / rab tu ston pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag brjod pa dang / 'chad pa dang / rab tu ston pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation, teaching, demonstration, and revelation of those is called the bodhisattva great beings’ supramundane Dharma generosity.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattvas’ four applications of mindfulness consist in?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtun pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtun pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas /
translated: Here, bodhisattva great beings are diligent, alert, and mindful.

original: 'jig rten la brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa dang / de bzhin du phyi'i lus dang / de bzhin du nang dang phyi'i tshor ba rnams dang / de bzhin du sems dang chos la'ang rgya cher sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten la brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa dang / de bzhin du phyi'i lus dang / de bzhin du nang dang phyi'i tshor ba rnams dang / de bzhin du sems dang chos la'ang rgya cher sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: They have eliminated worldly covetousness and unhappiness and they observe the internal body while remaining focused on the body. Likewise, they observe the external body and likewise the internal and external feelings, and likewise the mind and phenomena.

original: de dag ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the four applications of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi gang zhe na 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi gang zhe na 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed /
translated: What are the four right efforts? Here, bodhisattva mahāsattvas generate enthusiasm,🔽strive,

original: 'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom /🔽sems rab tu 'dzin /
analyzed: 'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom / sems rab tu 'dzin /
translated: exert vigorous effort,🔽control the mind, and focus it correctly in order to prevent the arising of evil, nonvirtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen.

original: yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa dang / de bzhin du sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa dang / de bzhin du sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed /
translated: Similarly, they generate enthusiasm,🔽strive,

original: 'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom /🔽sems rab tu 'dzin /🔽yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa @355a *//
analyzed: 'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom / sems rab tu 'dzin / yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa @355a *//
translated: exert vigorous effort,🔽control the mind, and focus it correctly in order to abandon evil, nonvirtuous dharmas that have arisen.

original: dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed /
analyzed: dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed /
translated: They generate enthusiasm,🔽strive,

original: 'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom /🔽sems rab tu 'dzin /
analyzed: 'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom /🔽sems rab tu 'dzin /
translated: exert vigorous effort,🔽control the mind, and focus it correctly in order to give rise to virtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen.

original: yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa dang / dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas par bya ba dang / mi nyams par bya ba dang / shin tu rgyas par bya ba dang / phyir zhing 'byung bar bya ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed; 'bad /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa dang / dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas par bya ba dang / mi nyams par bya ba dang / shin tu rgyas par bya ba dang / phyir zhing 'byung bar bya ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed; 'bad /
translated: to give rise to aspiration,🔽to make effort,🔽to focus the mind,🔽and to be correctly settled in order to prevent non-virtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen,🔽to give rise to aspiration,

original: brtson 'grus rtsom /🔽sems rab tu 'dzin /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom / sems rab tu 'dzin /
translated: to make effort,🔽to focus the mind,🔽and to be correctly settled in order to give rise to virtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen,🔽and to give rise to aspiration,🔽to make effort,🔽to focus the mind,

original: yang dag par rab tu 'jog ste /🔽'di dag ni yang dag par spong ba bzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu 'jog ste / 'di dag ni yang dag par spong ba bzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: and to be correctly settled in order to maintain, not lose, increase,🔽and fully perfect virtuous dharmas that have already arisen.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the four legs of manifestation?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dben pa la gnas pa /🔽'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dben pa la gnas pa / 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings, with the legs of manifestation that are the meditative stabilization of aspiration, the meditative stabilization of perseverance, the meditative stabilization of intention, and the meditative stabilization of analysis, are based in seclusion,🔽based in freedom from attachment,

original: 'gog pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: 'gog pa la gnas pa /
translated: based in cessation,

original: rnam par spong bas yongs su bsgyur ba bsgom pa dang / de bzhin du brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang; spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dben pa la gnas pa /🔽'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa /🔽'gog pa la gnas pa /🔽rnam par spong bas yongs su bsgyur ba bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par spong bas yongs su bsgyur ba bsgom pa dang / de bzhin du brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang; spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dben pa la gnas pa / 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa / 'gog pa la gnas pa / rnam par spong bas yongs su bsgyur ba bsgom pa ste /
translated: Similarly, the cultivation of the foot of the supernormal knowledge of magical power that is endowed with the formative force of exertion, and is transformed by the abandonment of laziness, is the cultivation of the foot of the supernormal knowledge of magical power that is endowed with the formative force of exertion, and is transformed by the abandonment of laziness.

original: de dag ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the four feet of the supernormal knowledge.

original: dbang po lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po lnga gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the five faculties?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / @355b dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po ste /
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / @355b dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po ste /
translated: the faculty of faith, the faculty of perseverance, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, and the faculty of wisdom.

original: de dag ni dbang po lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni dbang po lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the five faculties.

original: stobs lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: stobs lnga gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the five powers?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dad pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs te /
analyzed: dad pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs te /
translated: and the power of wisdom.

original: de dag ni stobs lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni stobs lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the five powers.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven factors of awakening?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:🔽the factor of awakening of mindfulness,🔽the factor of awakening of investigation of phenomena,🔽the factor of awakening of perseverance,🔽the factor of awakening of joy,

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
translated: the factor of awakening of pliancy,🔽the factor of awakening of concentration,🔽and the factor of awakening of equanimity.

original: de dag ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the seven factors of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the noble eightfold path?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol pa dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /🔽yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te; de dag ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol pa dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te; de dag ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and right concentration.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the three gateways to liberation?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa ste /
translated: the gateway to liberation that is emptiness, the gateway to liberation that is signlessness, and the gateway to liberation that is wishlessness.

original: de dag ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the three gateways to liberation.

original: de la rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid gang zhe na /🔽stong pa nyid @356a *//
analyzed: de la rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid gang zhe na / stong pa nyid @356a *//
translated: “What is the gateway to liberation that is emptiness?

original: kyi rnam pas sems rtse gcig pa ste /
analyzed: kyi rnam pas sems rtse gcig pa ste /
translated: It is a one-pointed mind through the aspect of emptiness.

original: de ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the emptiness gate of liberation.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the signless gate of liberation?

original: mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pas sems rtse gcig pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pas sems rtse gcig pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is one-pointedness of mind through the aspect of signlessness.

original: de ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the signless gate of liberation.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the wishless gate of liberation?

original: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pas sems rtse gcig pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pas sems rtse gcig pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is one-pointedness of mind through the aspects of impermanence and suffering.

original: de ni rnam par thar ba'i sgo smon pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam par thar ba'i sgo smon pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the wishless gate of liberation.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight liberations?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
analyzed: gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
translated: The first liberation is when one with form sees forms.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second liberation is when one, not perceiving forms internally, sees forms externally.

original: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas te /
translated: The pleasant liberation is the one in which the body is manifest.🔽

original: bsgrubs nas gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o //🔽de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: bsgrubs nas gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o // de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: The third liberation is when one actualizes and accomplishes the liberation of the beautiful with the body.

original: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing /
analyzed: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing /
translated: The fourth liberation is when one completely transcends the perception of form and the perception of obstruction disappears.

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas /
translated: The fifth liberation is when one does not pay attention to the perception of variety and thinks, “Space is infinite,” and accomplishes and abides in the sphere of infinite space.🔽The sixth liberation is when one completely transcends the sphere of infinite space and thinks, “Consciousness is infinite,” and accomplishes and abides in the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las @356b yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las @356b yang dag par 'das te /
translated: The seventh liberation is when one completely transcends the sphere of infinite consciousness and thinks, “There is nothing whatsoever,” and accomplishes and abides in the sphere of nothing whatsoever.

original: 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas bsgrubs te gnas pa'i bar dag ste /
analyzed: 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas bsgrubs te gnas pa'i bar dag ste /
translated: The eighth liberation is when one completely transcends the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception and actualizes and accomplishes with the body the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: de dag ni rnam par thar pa brgyad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par thar pa brgyad ces bya'o //
translated: These are called the eight liberations.
