original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine serial absorptions?

original: 'di la 'dod pa dag las dben pa /
analyzed: 'di la 'dod pa dag las dben pa /
translated: Here, one achieves and abides in the first concentration, which is free from the desires,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa /🔽rtog pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa / rtog pa dang bcas pa /
translated: free from negative and non-virtuous attributes,

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /🔽dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa'i bar dag bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de bzhin du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched nas /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa / dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa'i bar dag bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de bzhin du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched nas /
translated: endowed with ideation and scrutiny,🔽and born of concentration and rapture.🔽Similarly, one achieves and abides in the second concentration, the third concentration, and the fourth concentration.

original: 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa'i bar du bsgrubs nas gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa'i bar du bsgrubs nas gnas pa ste /
translated: Similarly, one achieves and abides in the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothingness, the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, and the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: de dag ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the nine serial absorptions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten powers of the tathāgatas?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gnas la'ang gnas su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gnas la'ang gnas su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /
translated: Subhuti, here the Tathagata, the Arhat, the fully Enlightened Buddha, knows as it really is that a basis is a basis,🔽and that a non-basis is a non-basis.

original: gnas ma yin pa la'ang gnas ma yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i las rnams dang / las yang dag par len pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa gnas kyi sgo dang /🔽rgyu'i sgo nas yang dag pa @357a *//
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa la'ang gnas ma yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i las rnams dang / las yang dag par len pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa gnas kyi sgo dang / rgyu'i sgo nas yang dag pa @357a *//
translated: Moreover, the Tathagata knows as it really is the maturation of actions that have been performed and accumulated, whether in the past, present, or future, in terms of the door of their basis and the door of their cause.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs pa /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs pa /
translated: Moreover, the Tathagata knows as it really is the various world systems.

original: khams du ma pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan rnams kyi dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang /
analyzed: khams du ma pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan rnams kyi dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang /
translated: the various elements just as they are;🔽the faculties of other beings and other individuals, whether superior or not, just as they are;🔽the various and numerous aspirations of the world just as they are;

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas mos pa sna tshogs pa dang / mos pa du ma ba'i 'jig rten yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas mos pa sna tshogs pa dang / mos pa du ma ba'i 'jig rten yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang /
translated: and the paths that lead everywhere just as they are.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang; ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang ldan pa thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang; gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pas sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang; ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang ldan pa thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang; gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pas sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang /
translated: “Moreover, with his pure divine eye that surpasses the human eye, the Thus-Gone One sees sentient beings passing away and being born,

original: skye ba nas bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba dang / las ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba'i bar dag mthong zhing /
analyzed: skye ba nas bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba dang / las ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba'i bar dag mthong zhing /
translated: and he sees how they go to good or bad rebirths in accordance with their actions.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas sngon gyi gnas rnam pa @357b du ma rjes su dran te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas sngon gyi gnas rnam pa @357b du ma rjes su dran te / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Moreover, the Thus-Gone One recollects his many previous lives.🔽He recollects:

original: tshe rabs gcig kyang rjes su dran pa nas /
analyzed: tshe rabs gcig kyang rjes su dran pa nas /
translated: one lifetime,

original: sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma'i bar dag kyang rnam pa dang bcas /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma'i bar dag kyang rnam pa dang bcas /
translated: He recollects his many previous abodes with their aspects and particulars.🔽Moreover, the Tathāgata, through the destruction of the contaminants, has realized and attained in this very life the destruction of the contaminants, and he proclaims his knowledge of the destruction of the contaminants.🔽He proclaims his knowledge of the path that leads everywhere.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of various higher cognitions.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of the recollection of former existences.

original: yul phyogs dang bcas par rjes su dran pa dang; gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas zag pa rnams zad pas zag pa med cing sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba tshe 'di nyid la rang gi mngon par shes pas mngon sum du byas nas bsgrubs te gnas shing /
analyzed: yul phyogs dang bcas par rjes su dran pa dang; gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas zag pa rnams zad pas zag pa med cing sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba tshe 'di nyid la rang gi mngon par shes pas mngon sum du byas nas bsgrubs te gnas shing /
translated: He proclaims the knowledge of the passing away and rebirth of beings.

original: bdag gi skye ba ni zad /
analyzed: bdag gi skye ba ni zad /
translated: He proclaims the knowledge of the destruction of the contaminants.

original: tshangs par spyod pa ni spyad /🔽bya ba ni byas /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa ni spyad / bya ba ni byas /
translated: He proclaims the knowledge of the path that leads everywhere.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of various higher cognitions.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of the recollection of former existences.

original: srid pa 'di las gzhan ni mi shes so zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: srid pa 'di las gzhan ni mi shes so zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He proclaims the knowledge of the passing away and rebirth of beings.

original: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu zhes bya'o //
translated: He proclaims the knowledge of the destruction of the contaminants.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of the path that leads everywhere.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of various higher cognitions.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of the recollection of former existences.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of the passing away and rebirth of beings.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: He proclaims the knowledge of the destruction of the contaminants.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: He proclaims the knowledge of the path that leads everywhere.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of various higher cognitions.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of the recollection of former existences.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of the passing away and rebirth of beings.

original: nga yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes dam bcas na /
analyzed: nga yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes dam bcas na /
translated: He proclaims the knowledge of the destruction of the contaminants.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of the path that leads everywhere.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of various higher cognitions.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of the recollection of former existences.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of the passing away and rebirth of beings.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of the destruction of the contaminants.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of the path that leads everywhere.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of various higher cognitions.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of the recollection of former existences.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of the passing away and rebirth of beings.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of the destruction of the contaminants.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of the path that leads everywhere.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of various higher cognitions.🔽He proclaims the knowledge of the recollection of former existences.

original: 'dir chos 'di dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so zhes lha dang bcas pa dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang / bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgu'i 'jig rten na chos dang mthun par bdag la rgol ba'i rgyu de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: 'dir chos 'di dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so zhes lha dang bcas pa dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang / bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgu'i 'jig rten na chos dang mthun par bdag la rgol ba'i rgyu de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Here, I do not see any cause for dispute with anyone in the world, including gods, Māras, Brahmā, monks, or brahmins, that could be raised in a way that accords with the Dharma, such as, ‘These phenomena have not been fully awakened into.’

original: rgyu de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas bde ba 'thob cing bag tsha ba med pa thob la /
analyzed: rgyu de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas bde ba 'thob cing bag tsha ba med pa thob la /
translated: Since I do not see any such cause, I have attained happiness and fearlessness.

original: mi 'jigs pa thob ste; gnas kyis khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su dam bca'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa thob ste; gnas kyis khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su dam bca'o //
translated: I have attained the state of fearlessness and have taken my place as the supreme leader of the herd.

original: 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra yang dag par bsgrag go /
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra yang dag par bsgrag go /
translated: I have proclaimed the lion’s roar in the midst of the assembly.

original: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo dge sbyong ngam /🔽bram ze'am / lha'am @358a *//
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo dge sbyong ngam / bram ze'am / lha'am @358a *//
translated: I have set in motion the wheel of Brahmā,🔽which cannot be done by any monk,🔽brahmin, god,🔽Māra, Brahmā,

original: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
analyzed: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
translated: or anyone else in the world.

original: su'ang rung bas chos dang mthun par 'jig rten du ma bskor ba bdag gis bskor bar bya'o zhes bya ba dang / nga zag ba zad do zhes dam bcas na /🔽'dir zag pa 'di dag ma zad do zhes dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: su'ang rung bas chos dang mthun par 'jig rten du ma bskor ba bdag gis bskor bar bya'o zhes bya ba dang / nga zag ba zad do zhes dam bcas na / 'dir zag pa 'di dag ma zad do zhes dge sbyong ngam /
translated: If I were to claim, “My defilements are exhausted,”🔽I would not see any reason for any ascetic or brahmin to dispute with me here, saying, “These defilements of yours have not been exhausted.”

original: bram ze 'ga' zhig bdag la rgol ba'i rgyu de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba rgya ched sbyar bar bya ba dang / ngas nyan thos rnams la bar du gcod pa'i chos gang dag bshad pa de dag bsten kyang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes 'dir dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: bram ze 'ga' zhig bdag la rgol ba'i rgyu de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba rgya ched sbyar bar bya ba dang / ngas nyan thos rnams la bar du gcod pa'i chos gang dag bshad pa de dag bsten kyang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes 'dir dge sbyong ngam /
translated: If I were to claim, “Those things that I have explained to my disciples as obstructive phenomena will not become obstructive even if they are relied upon,”

original: bram ze'am / lha'am /
analyzed: bram ze'am / lha'am /
translated: I would not see any reason for any ascetic or brahmin,🔽or for any god, demon, Brahmā, or anyone else in the world to dispute with me here, saying, “Those things that you have explained to your disciples as obstructive phenomena will become obstructive if they are relied upon.”

original: bdud dam / 'ga' zhig bdag la rgol ba'i rgyu de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes rgya cher sbyar bar bya ba dang / ngas nyan thos rnams la nges par 'byin pa /
analyzed: bdud dam / 'ga' zhig bdag la rgol ba'i rgyu de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes rgya cher sbyar bar bya ba dang / ngas nyan thos rnams la nges par 'byin pa /
translated: If I were to claim, “Those things that I have explained to my disciples as leading to definite emergence are not leading to definite emergence,”

original: nges par 'byed pa de byed pa sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par 'byung bar 'gyur ba lam gang bshad pa de lam 'di ni nges par 'byin pa ma yin /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa de byed pa sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par 'byung bar 'gyur ba lam gang bshad pa de lam 'di ni nges par 'byin pa ma yin /
translated: The path that is explained as the means of definite emergence, the arising of the cessation of suffering, is not a path that definitely brings deliverance.

original: nges par rtogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: nges par rtogs pa ma yin /
translated: It is not a definite realization.

original: byed pa po'i sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par 'gyur ba ma yin zhes dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: byed pa po'i sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par 'gyur ba ma yin zhes dge sbyong ngam /
translated: It is not the means of the cessation of the suffering of the agent.🔽No one can dispute this with me, whether it be a monk,

original: bram ze'am / lha'am /
analyzed: bram ze'am / lha'am /
translated: a brahman, a god,

original: bdud dam / 'ga' zhig bdag la rgol ba'i rgyu de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes rgya cher sbyar bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdud dam / 'ga' zhig bdag la rgol ba'i rgyu de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes rgya cher sbyar bar bya ba ste /
translated: a demon, or anyone else.

original: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the four forms of fearlessness of the tathāgatas.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four forms of correct knowledge?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig pa @358b pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ste /
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig pa @358b pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ste /
translated: the correct knowledge of meanings, the correct knowledge of dharmas, the correct knowledge of clear expression, and the correct knowledge of inspired speech.

original: de dag ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the four right discriminations.

original: byams pa chen po gang zhe na /
analyzed: byams pa chen po gang zhe na /
translated: What is great loving kindness?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sems can thams cad la dgra bo dang / mdza' bshes la 'dra bar mdzad pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sems can thams cad la dgra bo dang / mdza' bshes la 'dra bar mdzad pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the Tathāgata’s attitude of equality toward enemies and friends.

original: de ni byams pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byams pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called great loving kindness.

original: de la snying rje chen po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la snying rje chen po gang zhe na /
translated: What is great compassion?

original: sems can ma yin pa'i sems can rnams la byams pa mi gtong ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems can ma yin pa'i sems can rnams la byams pa mi gtong ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the non-abandonment of loving kindness toward beings who are not beings.

original: de ni snying rje chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni snying rje chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called great compassion.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha?

original: 'di lta ste de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa med pa dang / ca co med pa dang / bsnyel ba med pa dang / sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med pa dang / tha dad pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa med pa dang / ca co med pa dang / bsnyel ba med pa dang / sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med pa dang / tha dad pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med pa dang /
translated: They are: the Tathāgata has no error, no idle talk, no loss of memory, no unconcentrated mind, no discrimination of different kinds, no indifference due to lack of investigation, no diminution of effort, no diminution of energy, no loss of mindfulness, no loss of concentration, no loss of wisdom, no loss of liberation, and his knowledge of liberation is ever present.

original: 'dun pa nyams pa med pa dang / brtson 'grus nyams pa med pa dang / dran pa nyams pa med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pa dang / shes rab nyams pa med pa dang / rnam par grol ba nyams pa med pa dang /🔽rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba nyams pa med pa dang / 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: 'dun pa nyams pa med pa dang / brtson 'grus nyams pa med pa dang / dran pa nyams pa med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pa dang / shes rab nyams pa med pa dang / rnam par grol ba nyams pa med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba nyams pa med pa dang / 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa dang /
translated: It is to be without decline in aspiration, without decline in diligence, without decline in mindfulness, without decline in samādhi, without decline in wisdom, without decline in liberation,🔽and without decline in the vision of the wisdom of liberation. It is to engage in the vision of wisdom that is unattached and unobstructed with regard to the past. It is to engage in the vision of wisdom that is unattached and unobstructed with regard to the future.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba @359a *//
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba @359a *//
translated: It is to engage in the vision of wisdom that is unattached and unobstructed with regard to the present.

original: 'jug pa dang / lus kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / ngag gi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa dang / lus kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / ngag gi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste /
translated: All his mental actions are preceded by knowledge and follow knowledge.

original: de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ces bya'o //
translated: These are called the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the Tathāgata’s thirty-two marks of a great person?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das ni zhabs shin tu gnas pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni zhabs shin tu gnas pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavān has feet with heels that are very prominent.

original: de la zhabs shin tu gnas pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la zhabs shin tu gnas pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here, the feet with heels that are very prominent are as follows:

original: zhabs kyi 'og gi mthil gnyis thams cad kyis sa la kun tu reg pa ste /
analyzed: zhabs kyi 'og gi mthil gnyis thams cad kyis sa la kun tu reg pa ste /
translated: The soles of both feet touch the ground all around.

original: dper na / za ma tog zhabs shin tu mnyam zhing phyang de ba /
analyzed: dper na / za ma tog zhabs shin tu mnyam zhing phyang de ba /
translated: For example, it is like a box with a very flat bottom.

original: sa gzhi shin tu mnyam pa la bzhag na /🔽'og gi zhabs thams cad kyis sa la kun tu reg pa bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ni zhabs shin tu gnas pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sa gzhi shin tu mnyam pa la bzhag na / 'og gi zhabs thams cad kyis sa la kun tu reg pa bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ni zhabs shin tu gnas pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: When he places his foot on perfectly level ground,🔽it is as if the entire sole of his foot were in contact with the ground.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni kun nas mu khyud khor yug dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni kun nas mu khyud khor yug dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One has feet with ankles that do not protrude.

original: de la mu khyud khor yug dang ldan pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la mu khyud khor yug dang ldan pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here, the feet with ankles that do not protrude are as follows:

original: zhabs kyi 'og gi mthil gnyis la 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang bcas pa /
analyzed: zhabs kyi 'og gi mthil gnyis la 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang bcas pa /
translated: On the soles of his feet are two wheels with a thousand spokes,🔽navels,

original: lte ba dang bcas pa /🔽mu khyud dang bcas pa dag mnga' ste /
analyzed: lte ba dang bcas pa / mu khyud dang bcas pa dag mnga' ste /
translated: and rims.

original: thams cad kyang kha dog gser lta bu'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang kha dog gser lta bu'o //
translated: They are all the color of gold.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil ni @359b 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil ni @359b 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa'o //
translated: The palms of his hands and the soles of his feet are soft and youthful.

original: de dag la phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de dag la phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here, the palms of his hands and the soles of his feet being soft and youthful are as follows:

original: dper na / shing bal kyi 'da' ba'am /
analyzed: dper na / shing bal kyi 'da' ba'am /
translated: They are like cotton wool or

original: ras bal gyi 'da' ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: ras bal gyi 'da' ba lta bu ste /
translated: like a lotus leaf.

original: ji ltar mi gzhan dag la med pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mi gzhan dag la med pa lta bu yin no //
translated: It is like that of no other person.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni sor mo ring ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni sor mo ring ba'o //
translated: The Blessed One has long fingers and toes.

original: de la sor mo ring ba ni 'di lta yin te /
analyzed: de la sor mo ring ba ni 'di lta yin te /
translated: Here, long fingers and toes means that

original: de'i phyag dang zhabs rnams kyi sor mo dag lhag par ring ste /
analyzed: de'i phyag dang zhabs rnams kyi sor mo dag lhag par ring ste /
translated: his fingers and toes are exceptionally long,

original: ji ltar mi gzhan dag la med pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mi gzhan dag la med pa lta bu yin no //
translated: like that of no other person.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni phyag dang zhabs dra ba dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni phyag dang zhabs dra ba dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: The Blessed One has webbed fingers and toes.🔽The webs between his fingers and toes are prominent,

original: de'i phyag dang zhabs la dra ba lhag pa dag mnga' ba ni ji ltar mi gzhan dag la med pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyag dang zhabs la dra ba lhag pa dag mnga' ba ni ji ltar mi gzhan dag la med pa lta bu yin no //
translated: like that of no other person.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni zhabs rting ba yangs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni zhabs rting ba yangs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One has broad heels.

original: de la rting ba yangs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rting ba yangs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here, broad heels means that

original: de'i zhabs kyi rting pa gnyis kyi mthil yangs pa ni ji ltar mi gzhan dag la med pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de'i zhabs kyi rting pa gnyis kyi mthil yangs pa ni ji ltar mi gzhan dag la med pa lta bu yin no //
translated: the soles of his feet are broad, like that of no other person.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni zhabs long mo'i tshigs mi mngon pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni zhabs long mo'i tshigs mi mngon pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One has inconspicuous ankle joints.

original: de la zhabs long bu'i tshigs mi mngon pa ni 'di yin te /🔽rting ba yangs pa la yang dag par sbyor la /
analyzed: de la zhabs long bu'i tshigs mi mngon pa ni 'di yin te / rting ba yangs pa la yang dag par sbyor la /
translated: The “non-protruding ankles” are as follows:🔽The ankles are well-rounded.

original: rting ba yangs pa'ang zhabs long mo'i tshigs mi mngon pa la sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: rting ba yangs pa'ang zhabs long mo'i tshigs mi mngon pa la sbyor ba ste /
translated: The well-rounded ankles are connected to the non-protruding ankles.

original: ji ltar mi gzhan dag la med pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mi gzhan dag la med pa lta bu yin no //
translated: This is not the case for other people.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni byin pa ri dvags ae n+ya ya'i byin pa lta bu dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni byin pa ri dvags ae n+ya ya'i byin pa lta bu dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavān has shanks like an antelope.

original: de la byin pa ri dvags ae n+ya ya'i lta bu ni 'di yin te /🔽de'i byin pa byin gyis @360a *//🔽phra bar skyes shing /
analyzed: de la byin pa ri dvags ae n+ya ya'i lta bu ni 'di yin te / de'i byin pa byin gyis @360a *// phra bar skyes shing /
translated: The shanks like an antelope are as follows:🔽His shanks are well-rounded.

original: byin gyis phra bar yang dag par byung ba ste /
analyzed: byin gyis phra bar yang dag par byung ba ste /
translated: They are well-formed and slender.

original: dper na ri dvags kyi rgyal po ae n+ya ya'i lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dper na ri dvags kyi rgyal po ae n+ya ya'i lta bu yin no //
translated: They are like the shanks of the king of antelopes.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni bzhengs bzhin du ma btud par phyag bus mor slebs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni bzhengs bzhin du ma btud par phyag bus mor slebs pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavān, standing upright, can touch his knees with his hands without bending over.

original: de la bzhengs bzhin du ma btud par phyag bus mo slebs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la bzhengs bzhin du ma btud par phyag bus mo slebs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The “touching the knees with the hands without bending over” is as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni /
translated: The Bhagavān,

original: bzhengs na sku ma btud par phyag gnyis kyis rang gi bus mo'i lha nga la yang dag par reg par mdzad cing /🔽kun du nyug par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhengs na sku ma btud par phyag gnyis kyis rang gi bus mo'i lha nga la yang dag par reg par mdzad cing / kun du nyug par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: When standing, without bending his body, he can touch his kneecaps with both hands.🔽He is able to touch his kneecaps with both hands without bending his body.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni 'doms kyi spa ba sbubs su nub pa yin no; ;de la 'doms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa nyid ni 'di yin te /🔽dper na / rigs btsun pa'i glang po che cang shes sam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni 'doms kyi spa ba sbubs su nub pa yin no; ;de la 'doms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa nyid ni 'di yin te / dper na / rigs btsun pa'i glang po che cang shes sam /
translated: The Blessed One’s male organ is concealed in a sheath.

original: rta cang shes kyi lta bu yin no //🔽bcom ldan 'das ni ba spu re re nas mdzes par skyes shing g-yas su 'khyil ba yin no //
analyzed: rta cang shes kyi lta bu yin no // bcom ldan 'das ni ba spu re re nas mdzes par skyes shing g-yas su 'khyil ba yin no //
translated: His male organ is concealed in a sheath, like that of a noble horse or elephant.🔽The Blessed One’s body hairs are individually grown and curl to the right.

original: de la ba spu re re nas mdzes par skyes shing g-yas su 'khyil ba nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la ba spu re re nas mdzes par skyes shing g-yas su 'khyil ba nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: His body hairs are individually grown and curl to the right.

original: de'i spu khung bu re re nas /🔽spu re re mthon mthing la lcang lor 'khyil ba 'jam zhing snum la /
analyzed: de'i spu khung bu re re nas / spu re re mthon mthing la lcang lor 'khyil ba 'jam zhing snum la /
translated: Each of his pores contains a single hair.

original: g-yas su 'khyil cing mdzes par skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: g-yas su 'khyil cing mdzes par skyes pa yin no //
translated: His body hairs are dark blue, curly, soft, glossy, and curl to the right.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One has body hairs that point upward.

original: de la sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is what body hairs that point upward means:

original: de'i dbu dang sku las skyes pa'i dbu skra dang / spu rnams ni kha gyen du bltas shing mthon mthing la kun nas lcang @360b lor 'khyil ba 'jam zhing snum la g-yas su 'khyil ba mdzes par skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i dbu dang sku las skyes pa'i dbu skra dang / spu rnams ni kha gyen du bltas shing mthon mthing la kun nas lcang @360b lor 'khyil ba 'jam zhing snum la g-yas su 'khyil ba mdzes par skyes pa yin no //
translated: The hair on his head and body grows in an upward direction. It is dark blue, curls to the right, is soft, glossy, and grows in tight curls.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni phags pa srab cing 'jam la snum pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni phags pa srab cing 'jam la snum pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One has skin that is smooth, soft, and glossy.

original: de la pags pa srab cing 'jam la snum pa ni 'di yin te /🔽de'i sku la chu'am /
analyzed: de la pags pa srab cing 'jam la snum pa ni 'di yin te / de'i sku la chu'am /
translated: This is what skin that is smooth, soft, and glossy means:🔽Water and dust do not stick to his body

original: rdul kun du mi chags shing mi gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rdul kun du mi chags shing mi gnas pa yin no //
translated: and do not remain there.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni mdog gser lta bu dang ldan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni mdog gser lta bu dang ldan te /
translated: The Blessed One has a golden complexion.

original: dper na / dzambu'i chu bo'i gser gyi mchod sdong la rin po che sna tshogs kyis spras pa ltar gzugs bzang zhing mdzes pa lta na sdug pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na / dzambu'i chu bo'i gser gyi mchod sdong la rin po che sna tshogs kyis spras pa ltar gzugs bzang zhing mdzes pa lta na sdug pa yin te /
translated: For example, just as a pillar of Jambū River gold is adorned with various jewels, he is well proportioned, beautiful, and pleasant to behold.

original: des na gser gyi mdog lta bu zhes bya'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das ni bdun mtho ba yin no //
analyzed: des na gser gyi mdog lta bu zhes bya'o // bcom ldan 'das ni bdun mtho ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be “like the color of gold.”🔽The Bhagavān has seven prominent body parts.

original: de la bdun mtho ba nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la bdun mtho ba nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: What are the seven?🔽The two prominent parts of his feet are beautiful, attractive, and delightful, and are filled with flesh and blood.

original: de'i zhabs gnyis kyi gong mtho ba gnyis gzugs bzang zhing mdzes la lta na sdug pa sha dang khrag gis yongs su rgyas par gyur pa dang / de bzhin du phyag gnyis kyi gong mtho ba gnyis gzugs bzang zhing mdzes la lta na sdug pa sha dang khrag gis yongs su rgyas par gyur pa dang /
analyzed: de'i zhabs gnyis kyi gong mtho ba gnyis gzugs bzang zhing mdzes la lta na sdug pa sha dang khrag gis yongs su rgyas par gyur pa dang / de bzhin du phyag gnyis kyi gong mtho ba gnyis gzugs bzang zhing mdzes la lta na sdug pa sha dang khrag gis yongs su rgyas par gyur pa dang /
translated: The two prominent parts of his hands are beautiful, attractive, and delightful, and are filled with flesh and blood.

original: thal gong gnyis mtho bar gyur ba dang / gnya' gong du mtho ba gcig gzugs bzang zhing mdzes la lta na sdug pa /
analyzed: thal gong gnyis mtho bar gyur ba dang / gnya' gong du mtho ba gcig gzugs bzang zhing mdzes la lta na sdug pa /
translated: The two prominent parts of his shoulders are prominent, and the prominent part of his neck is beautiful, attractive, and delightful,

original: sha dang khrag gis yongs su rgyas par gyur pa yin no //🔽bcom ldan 'das ni dpung mgo shin tu zlum pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sha dang khrag gis yongs su rgyas par gyur pa yin no // bcom ldan 'das ni dpung mgo shin tu zlum pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: and is filled with flesh and blood.🔽The Bhagavān has shoulders that are well rounded.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni thal gong rgyas pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni thal gong rgyas pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavān has broad collarbones.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni sku shin tu drang por 'khrungs pa yin no //🔽bcom ldan 'das @361a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni sku shin tu drang por 'khrungs pa yin no // bcom ldan 'das @361a *//
translated: The body of the Lord was born straight.

original: ni sku n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa yin no //🔽de la n+ya gro dha ltar sku chu zheng gab pa nyid ni 'di yin te /🔽chur ji srid pa zheng du'ang de srid la /
analyzed: ni sku n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa yin no // de la n+ya gro dha ltar sku chu zheng gab pa nyid ni 'di yin te / chur ji srid pa zheng du'ang de srid la /
translated: The body of the Lord was like a nyagrodha tree,🔽with a height equal to the width.

original: zheng du ji srid pa chur yang de srid de /
analyzed: zheng du ji srid pa chur yang de srid de /
translated: The height and the width were equal.

original: de ni n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the body of the Lord like a nyagrodha tree, with a height equal to the width.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni 'gram pa seng ge'i 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni 'gram pa seng ge'i 'dra ba yin no //
translated: The cheeks of the Lord were like lions.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni tshems bzhi bcu mnga' ba yin no //🔽bcom ldan 'das ni tshems thags bzang ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni tshems bzhi bcu mnga' ba yin no // bcom ldan 'das ni tshems thags bzang ba yin no //
translated: The Lord had forty teeth.🔽The teeth of the Lord were even.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni tshems rtse mo mtho zhing rno la dkar ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni tshems rtse mo mtho zhing rno la dkar ba yin no //
translated: The teeth of the Lord were sharp-edged,

original: bcom ldan 'das ni ro bro ba'i mchog dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni ro bro ba'i mchog dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: and the Lord had the most excellent taste.

original: de'i mgur drang por mid pa drang zhing ma yo la thogs pa med par mid du rung bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i mgur drang por mid pa drang zhing ma yo la thogs pa med par mid du rung bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: His throat is straight and not crooked, and he can swallow without impediment.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni ljags ring zhing srab pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni ljags ring zhing srab pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat has a long and slender tongue.

original: de la ljags ring zhing srab pa nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la ljags ring zhing srab pa nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here, “long and slender” means

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhed na zhal nas ljags phyung ste /🔽shangs kyi bu ga gnyis dang / spyan gyi khung bu gnyis dang / snyan gyi bu ga gnyis su reg par mdzad cing /🔽yongs su nyug par mdzad la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhed na zhal nas ljags phyung ste / shangs kyi bu ga gnyis dang / spyan gyi khung bu gnyis dang / snyan gyi bu ga gnyis su reg par mdzad cing / yongs su nyug par mdzad la /
translated: that if the Tathāgata wishes, he can extend his tongue from his mouth🔽and cover his entire forehead,🔽touch and stroke his two ears and the two eye sockets,

original: dbu'i mtshams su thug pa'i zhal gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad kyang 'gebs par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: dbu'i mtshams su thug pa'i zhal gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad kyang 'gebs par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: and completely cover his entire brow.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang ldan pa yin no //🔽bcom ldan 'das ni spyan yangs shing rdzi ma ba'i lta bu yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang ldan pa yin no // bcom ldan 'das ni spyan yangs shing rdzi ma ba'i lta bu yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat has a Brahmā-like voice.🔽The Bhagavat has eyes that are like those of a great bull.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni spyan mthon mthing lta bu dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni spyan mthon mthing lta bu dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat has eyes that are like the color of the blue lotus.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni spyan gyi @361b tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //🔽bcom ldan 'das ni 'od 'dom gang pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni spyan gyi @361b tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa yin no // bcom ldan 'das ni 'od 'dom gang pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavān has a full set of teeth.🔽The Bhagavān has forty teeth.🔽The Bhagavān has even teeth.🔽The Bhagavān has very white teeth.🔽The Bhagavān has eyes that are like deep blue lotuses.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni zhal zla ba nya ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni zhal zla ba nya ba lta bu yin no //
translated: The Bhagavān has eyelashes that are like a cow’s.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni mdzod spu smin mtshams su 'khrungs la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni mdzod spu smin mtshams su 'khrungs la /
translated: The Bhagavān has a head that is shaped like a turban.🔽The Bhagavān has hair that is very black.🔽The Bhagavān has hair that is very glossy.🔽The Bhagavān has hair that is very soft.🔽The Bhagavān has hair that is not disordered.🔽The Bhagavān has hair that is not mixed.

original: shing bal ltar 'jam zhing me tog kunda dang / zla ba dang / dung dang / padma'i rtsa lag dang / ba'i 'o ma dang / pha mo'i mdog lta bu yin no //
analyzed: shing bal ltar 'jam zhing me tog kunda dang / zla ba dang / dung dang / padma'i rtsa lag dang / ba'i 'o ma dang / pha mo'i mdog lta bu yin no //
translated: The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.🔽The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.🔽The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.🔽The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.🔽The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.🔽The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.🔽The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.🔽The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.🔽The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa yin no //🔽de dag ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa yin no // de dag ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis yin te /
translated: The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.🔽The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.🔽The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.🔽The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.🔽The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.🔽The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.🔽The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.🔽The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.🔽The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.🔽The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.🔽The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.🔽The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.🔽The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan de dag dang ldan pas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rang bzhin gyis snang bas khyab par mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan de dag dang ldan pas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rang bzhin gyis snang bas khyab par mdzad do //
translated: The Bhagavān has a head that is not seen by all.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhed na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhed na /
translated: The Bhagavān has a head that is not

original: mtshan de dag gis 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med /
analyzed: mtshan de dag gis 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med /
translated: These names illuminate countless,

original: grangs med tshad med pa dag snang bas khyab par mdzad cing /
analyzed: grangs med tshad med pa dag snang bas khyab par mdzad cing /
translated: immeasurable, and limitless world systems.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pas sems can rnams gdul ba'i dbang nye bar bzung nas /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pas sems can rnams gdul ba'i dbang nye bar bzung nas /
translated: Then, the Tathāgata, having taken into account the need to guide sentient beings,

original: 'od 'dom gang bar byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: 'od 'dom gang bar byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: blesses the light to extend for a distance of one fathom.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa ma mdzad du zin na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa ma mdzad du zin na /
translated: If the Tathāgata did not bless it,

original: zla ba dang / nyi ma gnyis kyang 'jig rten na yod par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: zla ba dang / nyi ma gnyis kyang 'jig rten na yod par mi 'gyur /
translated: even the two luminaries, the sun and moon, would not exist in the world.

original: zla ba gcig dang / zla ba phyed dang / dus dang / lo khyud 'khor rnams kyang 'jig rten na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba gcig dang / zla ba phyed dang / dus dang / lo khyud 'khor rnams kyang 'jig rten na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The single moon, the half-month, the seasons, and the yearly cycles would not appear in the world.

original: sems can rnams gdul ba'i dbang nye bar bzung nas /
analyzed: sems can rnams gdul ba'i dbang nye bar bzung nas /
translated: Having taken into account the need to guide sentient beings,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi gsung gis /🔽stong gsum gyi stong chen @362a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi gsung gis / stong gsum gyi stong chen @362a *//
translated: the Tathāgata, with his natural speech,

original: po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di go bar mdzad do //
analyzed: po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di go bar mdzad do //
translated: makes himself understood throughout this world system of a billion worlds.

original: bzhed na gong du'ang gsung chen pos kyang go bar mdzad do //
analyzed: bzhed na gong du'ang gsung chen pos kyang go bar mdzad do //
translated: If he wishes, he can also make them understand with a great voice.

original: yon tan dang / phan yon de dag thams cad ni nga sngon du byang chub sems dpar gyur cing /
analyzed: yon tan dang / phan yon de dag thams cad ni nga sngon du byang chub sems dpar gyur cing /
translated: All these qualities and benefits were accomplished by me when I was previously a bodhisattva

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pas bsgrubs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pas bsgrubs so //
translated: and practiced the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: sbyin pa gnyis po zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pas sems can rnams sdud par byed de /
analyzed: sbyin pa gnyis po zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pas sems can rnams sdud par byed de /
translated: they gather beings with the two kinds of generosity: the generosity of material things and the generosity of the Dharma.

original: rab 'byor / 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin no //
translated: Subhūti, this is also a quality of the bodhisattva great beings that is marvelous and wonderful.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la spyod pa na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la spyod pa na /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the six perfections,

original: snyan par smra pas ji ltar sems can rnams sdud ce na /
analyzed: snyan par smra pas ji ltar sems can rnams sdud ce na /
translated: how do they gather beings with pleasant speech?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la spyod pa na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la spyod pa na /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the six perfections

original: thog ma kho nar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas sems can rnams sdud do //
analyzed: thog ma kho nar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas sems can rnams sdud do //
translated: first gather beings with the perfection of generosity.

original: de'i 'og tu tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas so //🔽de'i 'og tu bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas so // de'i 'og tu bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas so //
translated: After that, they gather them with the perfection of moral discipline.🔽After that, they gather them with the perfection of patience.

original: de'i 'og tu brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas so //
translated: After that, they gather them with the perfection of perseverance.

original: de'i 'og tu bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas so //
translated: After that, they gather them with the perfection of concentration.

original: de'i 'og tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can rnams sdud par byed de /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can rnams sdud par byed de /
translated: After that, they gather beings with the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / @362b pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po snyan par smra bas sems can rnams sdud par byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / @362b pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po snyan par smra bas sems can rnams sdud par byed do //
translated: Subhūti, with these six perfections bodhisattva great beings gather beings with pleasant speech.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gis dge ba'i chos thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po don spyod pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gis dge ba'i chos thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro // rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po don spyod pas /
translated: Because all wholesome dharmas are included in these six perfections.

original: ji ltar sems can rnams sdud ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems can rnams sdud ce na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings who practice the meaning gather beings?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la yun ring por spyod pa na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la yun ring por spyod pa na /
translated: Subhūti, here, for a long time practicing the six perfections,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po las gzhan mi byed par rtag tu sems can rnams sdud par byed de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po las gzhan mi byed par rtag tu sems can rnams sdud par byed de / 'di lta ste /
translated: bodhisattva great beings who do not do anything else always gather beings.🔽They gather them

original: sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pas sdud par byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pas sdud par byed do //
translated: with giving, kind words, doing good, and consistency.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what are the Tathāgata’s eighty excellent minor marks?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sen mo zangs kyi mdog lta bu dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sen mo zangs kyi mdog lta bu dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The lord buddhas have copper-colored nails.

original: sred med kyi bu'i ltar sku grims pa yin no //
analyzed: sred med kyi bu'i ltar sku grims pa yin no //
translated: Their bodies are firm like Nārāyaṇa.

original: pus mo'i lha nga dag mdzes par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: pus mo'i lha nga dag mdzes par grub pa yin no //
translated: His knees are well-rounded.

original: sku gtsang ba dag yin no //🔽sku 'jam pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sku gtsang ba dag yin no // sku 'jam pa dag yin no //
translated: His body is clean.🔽His body is smooth.

original: sku mnyen pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sku mnyen pa dag yin no //
translated: His body is supple.

original: sku snum bag can dag yin no //
analyzed: sku snum bag can dag yin no //
translated: His body is well-oiled.

original: sku ma btud pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sku ma btud pa dag yin no //
translated: His body is not bent.

original: sor mo rnams ring ba dang / byin gyis phra ba dag yin no //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sor mo rnams zlum pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sor mo rnams ring ba dang / byin gyis phra ba dag yin no // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sor mo rnams zlum pa dag yin no //
translated: His fingers are long.🔽The fingers of the Blessed Buddhas are rounded.

original: sor mo rnams byin gyis phra ba dag yin no //🔽rtsa rnams @363a *//🔽mi mngon pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sor mo rnams byin gyis phra ba dag yin no // rtsa rnams @363a *// mi mngon pa dag yin no //
translated: The fingers of the Blessed Buddhas are tapering.🔽His veins are not visible.

original: long bu rnams mi mngon pa dag yin no //🔽sku dbyibs legs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: long bu rnams mi mngon pa dag yin no // sku dbyibs legs pa dag yin no //
translated: His ankles do not protrude.🔽His body is well-proportioned.

original: sku shin tu legs par 'brel ba dag yin no //
analyzed: sku shin tu legs par 'brel ba dag yin no //
translated: His body is well-knit.

original: skye mched rnams shin tu yongs su dag pa dag yin no //
analyzed: skye mched rnams shin tu yongs su dag pa dag yin no //
translated: His sense-faculties are very pure.

original: mkhyen pa yongs su dag pa dag yin no //
analyzed: mkhyen pa yongs su dag pa dag yin no //
translated: His knowledge is very pure.

original: spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa dag yin no //
translated: His deportment is perfect.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dpal dang / blo gros dang ldan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dpal dang / blo gros dang ldan pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are glorious and wise.

original: blta bar 'os pa dag yin no //🔽zhal ha cang mi ring ba dag yin no //
analyzed: blta bar 'os pa dag yin no // zhal ha cang mi ring ba dag yin no //
translated: They are worthy of being seen.🔽Their faces are not too long.

original: zhal kang kong med pa dag yin no //
analyzed: zhal kang kong med pa dag yin no //
translated: Their faces are not sunken.

original: sgros bimpa ltar dmar ba dag yin no //
analyzed: sgros bimpa ltar dmar ba dag yin no //
translated: Their lips are red like the bimba fruit.

original: zhal yongs su rgyas pa dag yin no //
analyzed: zhal yongs su rgyas pa dag yin no //
translated: Their faces are full.

original: dbyangs zab pa dag yin no //🔽lte ba zab pa dag yin no //
analyzed: dbyangs zab pa dag yin no // lte ba zab pa dag yin no //
translated: Their voices are deep.🔽Their navels are deep.

original: lte ba shin tu zlum pa dag yin no //
analyzed: lte ba shin tu zlum pa dag yin no //
translated: Their navels are round.

original: lte ba g-yas su 'khyil ba dag yin no //
analyzed: lte ba g-yas su 'khyil ba dag yin no //
translated: Their navels turn to the right.

original: phyag dang zhabs yongs su rgyas pa dag yin no //
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs yongs su rgyas pa dag yin no //
translated: Their hands and feet are full.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni phyag dang zhabs ji ltar dgongs pa bzhin dang ldan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni phyag dang zhabs ji ltar dgongs pa bzhin dang ldan pa dag yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have hands and feet with webbing.

original: phyag gi mthil mnyam pa dag yin no //
analyzed: phyag gi mthil mnyam pa dag yin no //
translated: The palms of their hands are even.

original: phyag gi ri mo bar ma chad pa dag yin no //
analyzed: phyag gi ri mo bar ma chad pa dag yin no //
translated: The lines on their hands are unbroken.

original: phyag gi ri mo mtho ba dag yin no //
analyzed: phyag gi ri mo mtho ba dag yin no //
translated: The lines on their hands are deep.

original: sku la dri ma med cing dri mi zhim pa med pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sku la dri ma med cing dri mi zhim pa med pa dag yin no //
translated: Their bodies are without stains and without bad smells.

original: mdog gsal ba dag yin no //
analyzed: mdog gsal ba dag yin no //
translated: They have a clear complexion.

original: skye mched kyi sgo bzang ba dag yin no //
analyzed: skye mched kyi sgo bzang ba dag yin no //
translated: They have a good sense of the sense-fields.

original: zhal zla ba lta bu dag yin no //
analyzed: zhal zla ba lta bu dag yin no //
translated: Their faces are like the moon.

original: gsong phor gsung ba dag yin no //
analyzed: gsong phor gsung ba dag yin no //
translated: Their speech is like the sound of the kalaviṅka bird.

original: zhal khro gnyer gyi rim pa mad pa dag yin no //
analyzed: zhal khro gnyer gyi rim pa mad pa dag yin no //
translated: Their faces are without frowns.

original: spu'i khung bu thams cad @363b nas dri yid du 'ong ba 'byung ba dag yin no //
analyzed: spu'i khung bu thams cad @363b nas dri yid du 'ong ba 'byung ba dag yin no //
translated: From all their pores comes a pleasant smell.

original: de dag gi zhal gyi dri zhim pa dag yin no //🔽seng ge'i stabs su gshegs pa dag yin no //🔽glang po che'i dbang po'i stabs su gshegs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi zhal gyi dri zhim pa dag yin no // seng ge'i stabs su gshegs pa dag yin no // glang po che'i dbang po'i stabs su gshegs pa dag yin no //
translated: Their breath smells sweet.🔽They walk with the gait of a lion.🔽They walk with the gait of a lordly elephant.

original: ngang pa'i stabs su gshegs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: ngang pa'i stabs su gshegs pa dag yin no //
translated: They walk with the gait of a swan.

original: dbu gdugs 'dra ba dag yin no //
analyzed: dbu gdugs 'dra ba dag yin no //
translated: Their heads are like parasols.

original: gsung snyan cing rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa dag yin no //🔽tshems mche ba rno ba dang ldan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gsung snyan cing rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa dag yin no // tshems mche ba rno ba dang ldan pa dag yin no //
translated: Their speech is pleasant and complete in all aspects.🔽Their eye-teeth are sharp.

original: shangs mtho ba dag yin no //
analyzed: shangs mtho ba dag yin no //
translated: Their noses are prominent.

original: ljags dmar ba dag yin no //
analyzed: ljags dmar ba dag yin no //
translated: Their tongues are red.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni ljags srab cing che ba dag yin no //🔽spu mthon mthing can dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni ljags srab cing che ba dag yin no // spu mthon mthing can dag yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas have slender and large tongues.🔽Their body hair is dark blue.

original: spu gtsang ba dag yin no //
analyzed: spu gtsang ba dag yin no //
translated: Their body hair is clean.

original: spyan yangs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: spyan yangs pa dag yin no //
translated: Their eyes are very wide.

original: bu ga'i sgo rnams yongs su mnyams pa dag yin no //
analyzed: bu ga'i sgo rnams yongs su mnyams pa dag yin no //
translated: Their orifices are not open.

original: phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil dmar ba dag yin no; ;lte ba ma bye ba dag yin no //🔽dku ma rnyongs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil dmar ba dag yin no; ;lte ba ma bye ba dag yin no // dku ma rnyongs pa dag yin no //
translated: The palms of their hands and the soles of their feet are red.🔽Their navels are deep.

original: phyal phyang de ba dag yin no //
analyzed: phyal phyang de ba dag yin no //
translated: Their navels are not twisted.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sku la gnyer ma med pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sku la gnyer ma med pa dag yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas have no wrinkles on their bodies.

original: tshigs mdzes pa dag yin no //
analyzed: tshigs mdzes pa dag yin no //
translated: Their joints are beautiful.

original: tshigs ring ba dag yin no //
analyzed: tshigs ring ba dag yin no //
translated: Their joints are long.

original: phyag dang zhabs yongs su dag pa dag yin no //
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs yongs su dag pa dag yin no //
translated: Their hands and feet are very clean.

original: 'od 'dom gang mnyam pa dag yin no //
analyzed: 'od 'dom gang mnyam pa dag yin no //
translated: Their light is the same as a fathom.

original: 'od kyis gsal bar mdzad cing gshegs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: 'od kyis gsal bar mdzad cing gshegs pa dag yin no //
translated: They walk with a light that illuminates.

original: lha dang mi gang dag de dag gi sku mthong ba de dag tshim par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha dang mi gang dag de dag gi sku mthong ba de dag tshim par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those gods and humans who see their bodies are satisfied.

original: srog chags thams cad kyis mthong yang brnyas par mi byed do //🔽sems can rnams la @364a *//
analyzed: srog chags thams cad kyis mthong yang brnyas par mi byed do // sems can rnams la @364a *//
translated: Even when all beings look at him, he is not despised.

original: rjes su ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: rjes su ston par mdzad do //
translated: He is a teacher to all beings.

original: de dag gi gsung ni 'khor dang mthun par khyab par mdzad kyi /
analyzed: de dag gi gsung ni 'khor dang mthun par khyab par mdzad kyi /
translated: His speech pervades the assembly in accordance with the mind of each being.

original: 'khor gyi phyi rol tu gsung mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'khor gyi phyi rol tu gsung mi 'gro'o //
translated: It does not go beyond the assembly.

original: ro stod sengge'i lta bu dag yin no //
analyzed: ro stod sengge'i lta bu dag yin no //
translated: His shoulders are like those of a lion.

original: sku'i tshigs legs par 'brel ba dag yin no //
analyzed: sku'i tshigs legs par 'brel ba dag yin no //
translated: His body is well-proportioned.

original: spyi gtsug bltar mi mthong ba dag yin no //
analyzed: spyi gtsug bltar mi mthong ba dag yin no //
translated: His crown protrudes.

original: dbu skra mthon mthing la 'jam zhing ring ba dag yin no //
analyzed: dbu skra mthon mthing la 'jam zhing ring ba dag yin no //
translated: His hair is deep blue, soft, and long.

original: dbu skra ma 'khrugs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: dbu skra ma 'khrugs pa dag yin no //
translated: His hair is not disheveled.

original: dbu skra gyen du phyogs shing bzang la lcang lor 'khyil pa dag yin no //
analyzed: dbu skra gyen du phyogs shing bzang la lcang lor 'khyil pa dag yin no //
translated: His hair curls to the right, is beautiful, and is in ringlets.

original: dbu skra ma 'dzings pa dag yin no //🔽thugs kar dpal gyi be'us legs par brgyan pa dag dang ldan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: dbu skra ma 'dzings pa dag yin no // thugs kar dpal gyi be'us legs par brgyan pa dag dang ldan pa dag yin no //
translated: His hair is not matted.🔽His chest is adorned with a srivatsa mark.

original: phyag dang zhabs kyi mtshan dpal gyis 'bar ba dang ldan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs kyi mtshan dpal gyis 'bar ba dang ldan pa dag yin no //
translated: His hands and feet are marked with auspicious symbols and are radiant.

original: mtshal dang / ldong ros dang / tsin pi sta dang / mthing shing dang / zangs g-ya'i kha dog gis bris pa lta bu'i mtshan rnams dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshal dang / ldong ros dang / tsin pi sta dang / mthing shing dang / zangs g-ya'i kha dog gis bris pa lta bu'i mtshan rnams dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: They are like the color of vermilion, red arsenic, cinnabar, indigo, copper sulfate, and copper.

original: rab 'byor / de dag ni dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de dag ni dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yin te /
translated: Subhūti, these are the eighty minor marks.

original: de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku legs par brgyan nas /
analyzed: de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku legs par brgyan nas /
translated: The Tathāgata’s body is well adorned with them,

original: lham me lhan ne lhang nge'o //
analyzed: lham me lhan ne lhang nge'o //
translated: and it is radiant, bright, and clear.

original: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dag yin no //
translated: These are the ones that bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should complete.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag la @364b 'di skad 'doms shing 'di skad rjes su ston te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag la @364b 'di skad 'doms shing 'di skad rjes su ston te /
translated: advise and instruct other bodhisattvas like this:

original: rigs kyi bu dag tshur sheg /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag tshur sheg /
translated: ‘Come here, sons of a good family!

original: khyed cag yi ge mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas par gyis shig /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: khyed cag yi ge mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas par gyis shig / 'di lta ste /
translated: You should become skilled in the accomplishment of letters.

original: yi ge gcig la mkhas par gyis shig /
analyzed: yi ge gcig la mkhas par gyis shig /
translated: You should become skilled in one letter.

original: yi ge gnyis la mkhas par gyis shig /
analyzed: yi ge gnyis la mkhas par gyis shig /
translated: You should become skilled in two letters.

original: de bzhin du gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga dang / drug dang / bdun dang / brgyad dang / dgu dang / bcu dang / de bzhin du nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu'i bar dang / yi ge brgya dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga dang / drug dang / bdun dang / brgyad dang / dgu dang / bcu dang / de bzhin du nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu'i bar dang / yi ge brgya dang /
translated: Similarly, you should become skilled in three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, up to a hundred letters,

original: yi ge stong gi bar la mkhas par gyis shig /
analyzed: yi ge stong gi bar la mkhas par gyis shig /
translated: and up to a thousand letters.

original: yi ge gcig gis ngag gi rang bzhin thams cad rtogs par gyis shig /
analyzed: yi ge gcig gis ngag gi rang bzhin thams cad rtogs par gyis shig /
translated: You should understand the nature of all speech through one letter.

original: de bzhin du gnyis dang; gsum dang / yi ge brgya dang / stong gi bar dag gis ngag gi rang bzhin thams cad rtogs par gyis shig /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis dang; gsum dang / yi ge brgya dang / stong gi bar dag gis ngag gi rang bzhin thams cad rtogs par gyis shig /
translated: Similarly, you should understand the nature of all speech through two, three, up to a hundred letters, and up to a thousand letters.

original: de bzhin du yi ge gcig tu yi ge'i phyi mo bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis po dag 'dus par gyis shig ;yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyi nang du yi ge gcig 'dus par gyis shig ces 'doms shing rjes su ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin du yi ge gcig tu yi ge'i phyi mo bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis po dag 'dus par gyis shig ;yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyi nang du yi ge gcig 'dus par gyis shig ces 'doms shing rjes su ston to //
translated: In the same way, you should include the forty-two letters in a single letter, and you should include a single letter in the forty-two letters.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yi ge gcig tu yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis po dag 'dus par gyis shig /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yi ge gcig tu yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis po dag 'dus par gyis shig /
translated: Subhūti, in this way, bodhisattva great beings should include the forty-two letters in a single letter.

original: yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyi nang du yi ge gcig 'dus par gyis shig /
analyzed: yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyi nang du yi ge gcig 'dus par gyis shig /
translated: They should include a single letter in the forty-two letters.

original: yi ge gcig gis yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis la mkhas par byas la /
analyzed: yi ge gcig gis yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis la mkhas par byas la /
translated: They should be skilled in the forty-two letters through a single letter.

original: de bzhin du yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyis yi ge gcig la mkhas par byas nas /🔽yi ge mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas par 'gyur ro //🔽yi ge mngon par bsgrub @365a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyis yi ge gcig la mkhas par byas nas / yi ge mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas par 'gyur ro // yi ge mngon par bsgrub @365a *//
translated: In the same way, they should be skilled in a single letter through the forty-two letters.🔽They should be skilled in the accomplishment of letters.

original: pa la mkhas par byas nas /
analyzed: pa la mkhas par byas nas /
translated: They should be skilled in the accomplishment of letters.

original: yi ge med pa mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yi ge med pa mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: They should be skilled in the accomplishment of the absence of letters.

original: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni chos la mkhas pa dang / yi ge la mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni chos la mkhas pa dang / yi ge la mkhas pa yin te /
translated: the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One is skilled in the Dharma and skilled in letters.

original: yi ges yi ge med pa'i chos ston kyang /
analyzed: yi ges yi ge med pa'i chos ston kyang /
translated: He teaches the Dharma that is without letters through letters.

original: rab 'byor / yi ge dang yi ge med pa la ma gtogs pa'i chos gang yang med do //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yi ge dang yi ge med pa la ma gtogs pa'i chos gang yang med do // de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
translated: Subhūti, there is no Dharma whatsoever that is not included in letters and the absence of letters.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gal te mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang; thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi slad du /
analyzed: gal te mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang; thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi slad du /
translated: if, due to the emptiness beyond extremes and the emptiness without beginning or end,

original: sems can yang gtan dmigs su ma mchis la /
analyzed: sems can yang gtan dmigs su ma mchis la /
translated: sentient beings are also ultimately unapprehendable,

original: chos kyang dmigs su ma mchis shing /
analyzed: chos kyang dmigs su ma mchis shing /
translated: and phenomena are also unapprehendable,

original: chos kyi rang bzhin yang dmigs su ma mchis lags na /
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin yang dmigs su ma mchis lags na /
translated: and the intrinsic nature of phenomena is also unapprehendable,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
translated: then how do bodhisattva great beings practice the six perfections,

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / de bzhin du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid bcu bzhi dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / de bzhin du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid bcu bzhi dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: Similarly, they practice the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, and likewise the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, the fourteen emptinesses,🔽the emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs @365b bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs @365b bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: signlessness, and wishlessness meditative stabilizations, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial absorptions, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la spyod pa /
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la spyod pa /
translated: great love, great compassion, and up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis ji ltar sems can rnams la chos ston cing /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis ji ltar sems can rnams la chos ston cing /
translated: They teach the Dharma to sentient beings by means of the six perfections that arise from the ripening of karma.

original: de bzhin du rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa drug gis sems can rnams la chos ston par bgyid lags /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa drug gis sems can rnams la chos ston par bgyid lags /
translated: In the same way, they teach the Dharma to sentient beings with the six kinds of preternatural knowledge that arise from the results of evolution.

original: sems can dang / sems can du gdags pa ni dmigs su ma mchis lags te /
analyzed: sems can dang / sems can du gdags pa ni dmigs su ma mchis lags te /
translated: “ Sentient beings and the designation of sentient beings are not apprehended.

original: sems can dmigs su ma mchis pas phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams dmigs su ma mchis /
analyzed: sems can dmigs su ma mchis pas phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams dmigs su ma mchis /
translated: Since sentient beings are not apprehended, the aggregates, constituents, and sense fields are not apprehended.

original: de bzhin du sems can dmigs su ma mchis pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can dmigs su ma mchis pas /
translated: In the same way, since sentient beings are not apprehended,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dmigs su ma mchis /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dmigs su ma mchis /
translated: the six perfections are not apprehended.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way, connect this with each,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du dmigs su ma mchis /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du dmigs su ma mchis /
translated: up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not apprehended.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dmigs su ma mchis /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dmigs su ma mchis /
translated: The eighty minor marks are not apprehended.

original: sems can dmigs su ma mchis pas /
analyzed: sems can dmigs su ma mchis pas /
translated: Since sentient beings are not apprehended,

original: sems can du gdags pa ma mchis /
analyzed: sems can du gdags pa ma mchis /
translated: the designation of sentient beings does not exist.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched du gdags pa ma mchis /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched du gdags pa ma mchis /
translated: The designation of the aggregates, constituents, and sense fields does not exist.🔽In the same way, connect this with each,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: up to

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar du gdags pa dmigs su ma mchis lags na /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar du gdags pa dmigs su ma mchis lags na /
translated: up to the eighty minor marks are non-apprehensible,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /🔽sems can rnams la chos ston @366a *//
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa / sems can rnams la chos ston @366a *//
translated: Venerable Transcendent Victor,

original: pa'i chos de gang lags /
analyzed: pa'i chos de gang lags /
translated: what is the Dharma🔽that the bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom teach to sentient beings?

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Venerable Transcendent Victor,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can rnams mchis ba ma lags pa'i chos rnams la yang dag par 'dzin du stsal cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can rnams mchis ba ma lags pa'i chos rnams la yang dag par 'dzin du stsal cing /
translated: do the bodhisattva great beings cause sentient beings to take up non-existent phenomena,

original: de sems can rnams la phyin ci log la sbyor bar bgyid pa'am /
analyzed: de sems can rnams la phyin ci log la sbyor bar bgyid pa'am /
translated: and do they cause sentient beings to engage in error

original: gcig tu mi 'gyur lags grang /
analyzed: gcig tu mi 'gyur lags grang /
translated: or is it not so?

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Venerable Transcendent Victor,
