original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa des ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa des ni /
translated: it is because those bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang mi dmigs lags na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang mi dmigs lags na /
translated: do not apprehend even the state of a bodhisattva,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams lta dmigs par ga la 'gyur ba'i slad du'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams lta dmigs par ga la 'gyur ba'i slad du'o //
translated: How could the factors of awakening be a reference point?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Su­bhūti then asked him, “Lord, if all phenomena are empty of inherent nature, how can bodhisattvas, having trained in the emptiness of inherent nature, fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: The Lord said, “Su­bhūti, it is so!

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: rab 'byor / sems can dmigs su med pas nang stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems can dmigs su med pas nang stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Su­bhūti, because sentient beings are non-apprehensible, you should know that they are inner emptiness.

original: de bzhin du phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid dang /
translated: Similarly, you should know that they are outer emptiness, outer and inner emptiness, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, and the emptiness of essential nature.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / phung po stong pa nyid dang / skye mched stong pa nyid dang / 'phags pa'i bden @366b pa stong pa nyid dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba stong pa nyid dang /🔽thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / bdag stong pa nyid dang / sems can stong ba nyid dang / skye ba po stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin du gso ba dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / phung po stong pa nyid dang / skye mched stong pa nyid dang / 'phags pa'i bden @366b pa stong pa nyid dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / bdag stong pa nyid dang / sems can stong ba nyid dang / skye ba po stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin du gso ba dang /
translated: the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of its own mark, the emptiness of the aggregates, the emptiness of the sense bases, the emptiness of the noble truths, the emptiness of dependent origination,🔽the emptiness of what is without beginning or end, the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned, the emptiness of self, the emptiness of sentient beings, the emptiness of living beings, and likewise the emptiness of humans,

original: gang zag dang / shed las skyes pa dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang / slong ba po dang / kun nas slong ba po dang / tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag dang / shed las skyes pa dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang / slong ba po dang / kun nas slong ba po dang / tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: the emptiness of individuals, the emptiness of those born of Manu, the emptiness of sons of Manu, the emptiness of agents, the emptiness of instigators, the emptiness of feelers, the emptiness of knowers, and the emptiness of perceivers.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa stong pa nyid dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa stong pa nyid dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang /
translated: The applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties,

original: stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: the powers, the branches of awakening, and the noble eightfold path should be known as emptiness.

original: de bzhin du stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the emptiness of emptiness, the signlessness of signlessness, and the wishlessness of wishlessness should be known as emptiness.

original: de bzhin du rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the eight deliverances and the nine serial absorptions should be known as emptiness.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin du mi 'jigs pa bzhi stong pa nyid dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi stong pa nyid dang / byams pa chen po stong pa nyid dang / snying rje chen po stong pa nyid @367a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin du mi 'jigs pa bzhi stong pa nyid dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi stong pa nyid dang / byams pa chen po stong pa nyid dang / snying rje chen po stong pa nyid @367a *//
translated: In the same way, the ten powers of the tathāgatas are empty of the ten powers of the tathāgatas, and similarly, the four fearlessnesses are empty of the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges are empty of the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love is empty of great love, great compassion is empty of great compassion,

original: dang; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dang; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are empty of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu stong pa nyid dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i bar du stong pa nyid dang / rang byang chub stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa stong pa nyid dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu stong pa nyid dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i bar du stong pa nyid dang / rang byang chub stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa stong pa nyid dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub stong pa nyid dang /
translated: “In the same way, the result of stream enterer is empty of the result of stream enterer, and the result of a worthy one is empty of the result of a worthy one, and a pratyekabuddha’s awakening is empty of a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, and the bodhisattva’s faultless state is empty of the bodhisattva’s faultless state, and complete buddhahood is empty of complete buddhahood,🔽and the knowledge of all aspects is empty of the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong pa nyid dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong pa nyid dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: the emptiness of the buddha-field and the emptiness of the full accomplishment of beings should be known.

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni chos de dag thams cad stong pa nyid du mthong nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni chos de dag thams cad stong pa nyid du mthong nas /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom, seeing all those dharmas as empty,

original: phyin ci log gis zin pa'i sems can rnams la chos ston par byed la /
analyzed: phyin ci log gis zin pa'i sems can rnams la chos ston par byed la /
translated: teach the Dharma to beings who are seized by error.

original: sems can de dag kyang mi dmigs so; ;chos de'ang 'di ltar ci nas kyang stong pa nyid de dag las mi 'da' ba de ltar ston par byed do //
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang mi dmigs so; ;chos de'ang 'di ltar ci nas kyang stong pa nyid de dag las mi 'da' ba de ltar ston par byed do //
translated: And they do so in such a way that those beings, too, are not apprehended, and that Dharma is taught in such a way that it does not go beyond those emptinesses.

original: de ltar mthong ste /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ste /
translated: They see it like this.

original: chos thams cad sgrib pa med pa nyid du shes nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad sgrib pa med pa nyid du shes nas /
translated: Having understood all dharmas as being without obscurations,

original: de chos gang yang 'khrug par mi byed cing gnyis su'ang mi 'byed par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du'ang ston to //
analyzed: de chos gang yang 'khrug par mi byed cing gnyis su'ang mi 'byed par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du'ang ston to //
translated: they do not disturb any dharma and do not divide it into two, but teach it as it really is.

original: rab 'byor / dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dper na /
translated: “Subhūti, it is just as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa zhig gis sprul pa stong phrag du ma mngon par sprul nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa zhig gis sprul pa stong phrag du ma mngon par sprul nas /
translated: “Subhūti, suppose a tathāgata emanated many thousands of emanations,

original: sprul pa de dag nyid kha cig ni sbyin pa la sbyor bar byed cing /
analyzed: sprul pa de dag nyid kha cig ni sbyin pa la sbyor bar byed cing /
translated: and some of those emanations were engaged in generosity,

original: kha cig ni tshul khrims la /🔽kha cig ni bzod pa la /
analyzed: kha cig ni tshul khrims la / kha cig ni bzod pa la /
translated: some in morality,🔽some in patience,

original: kha cig ni brtson 'grus la /
analyzed: kha cig ni brtson 'grus la /
translated: some in perseverance,

original: @367b kha cig ni bsam gtan la /
analyzed: @367b kha cig ni bsam gtan la /
translated: some in concentration,

original: kha cig ni shes rab la sbyar bar byed cing /
analyzed: kha cig ni shes rab la sbyar bar byed cing /
translated: some in wisdom,

original: kha cig ni tshad med pa dag la /
analyzed: kha cig ni tshad med pa dag la /
translated: some in the immeasurables,

original: kha cig ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag la /
analyzed: kha cig ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag la /
translated: some in the formless absorptions,

original: kha cig ni mngon par shes pa rnams la sbyor bar byed na /
analyzed: kha cig ni mngon par shes pa rnams la sbyor bar byed na /
translated: and some in the clairvoyances.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: ci de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa des gang yang bye brag tu byas pa yod snyam mam /🔽gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: ci de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa des gang yang bye brag tu byas pa yod snyam mam / gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Would those emanations by the Tathāgata have done anything at all?”

original: ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: ma mchis lags so //
translated: He replied, “No, they would not, Lord.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / khyod kyis rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / khyod kyis rnam grangs des na /
translated: “Subhūti, because of this one of many explanations

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na ji ltar sems can rnams la chos ston par byed pa de ltar sems can de dag kyang sa la rab tu 'god par byed la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na ji ltar sems can rnams la chos ston par byed pa de ltar sems can de dag kyang sa la rab tu 'god par byed la /
translated: “Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom teach the Dharma to sentient beings, they establish those sentient beings in the levels in just that way.

original: sems can de dag kyang /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang /
translated: And those sentient beings should be known to be liberated from error in just that way,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: ma bcings ma grol ba'i tshul gyis phyin ci log dag las yongs su thar bar byed pa de ltar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ma bcings ma grol ba'i tshul gyis phyin ci log dag las yongs su thar bar byed pa de ltar rig par bya'o //
translated: by way of being neither bound nor liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar gzugs ni rang bzhin nyid kyis ma bcings ma grol ba yin la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar gzugs ni rang bzhin nyid kyis ma bcings ma grol ba yin la /
translated: Subhūti, it is because form is neither bound nor liberated by way of its intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rang bzhin nyid kyis ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rang bzhin nyid kyis ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: Similarly, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are neither bound nor liberated by way of their intrinsic nature.

original: gzugs kyi ma bcings ma grol ba nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi ma bcings ma grol ba nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin la /
translated: The non-bondage and non-liberation of form is not form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i ma bcings ma grol ba nyid gang yin pa de rnam @368a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i ma bcings ma grol ba nyid gang yin pa de rnam @368a *//
translated: Similarly, the unfettered and unbound nature of feelings, perceptions, formations, and consciousness is not fettered or unbound.🔽

original: par shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, the unfettered and unbound nature of feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness is not consciousness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar gzugs dang / de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar gzugs dang / de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir te /
translated: Su­bhūti, it is because physical forms, and similarly, feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness are utterly pure.

original: de bzhin du 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi bar la'ang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi bar la'ang sbyar ro //
translated: The same refrain should be applied to the other phenomena, up to and including conditioned and unconditioned elements.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas sems can rnams la chos ston par byed kyang sems can du dmigs pa'ang med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas sems can rnams la chos ston par byed kyang sems can du dmigs pa'ang med do //
translated: Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom in that manner teach the sacred doctrine to sentient beings, yet they do not apprehend even sentient beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de chos thams cad dmigs su med pa la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de chos thams cad dmigs su med pa la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas shing /
translated: Subhūti, it is because those bodhisattva great beings stand in the nonapprehending of all dharmas.

original: de gzugs dang; de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid la mi gnas pa'i tshul dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyi stong pa nyid la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas la /
analyzed: de gzugs dang; de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid la mi gnas pa'i tshul dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyi stong pa nyid la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas la /
translated: They stand in the emptiness of form, and similarly, they stand in the emptiness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, and they stand in the emptiness of compounded and uncompounded dharmas without standing.

original: rab 'byor / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos dang / 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni gang na'ang mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos dang / 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni gang na'ang mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because the emptiness of compounded and uncompounded dharmas and the emptiness of compounded dharmas do not stand anywhere.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: 'di ltar chos de dag dang / stong pa nyid de dag la gang la gnas par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid med cing dmigs su med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos de dag dang / stong pa nyid de dag la gang la gnas par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid med cing dmigs su med de /
translated: it is because those dharmas and those emptinesses have no intrinsic nature and cannot be apprehended to stand anywhere.

original: rab 'byor / @368b dngos po med pa'ang dngos po med pa la mi gnas la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / @368b dngos po med pa'ang dngos po med pa la mi gnas la /
translated: Subhūti, non-entities do not stand in non-entities,

original: rang gi dngos po'ang rang gi dngos po la mi gnas te /
analyzed: rang gi dngos po'ang rang gi dngos po la mi gnas te /
translated: and their own entities do not stand in their own entities,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po'ang gzhan gyi dngos po la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po'ang gzhan gyi dngos po la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and other entities do not stand in other entities.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de dag thams cad dmigs su med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag thams cad dmigs su med de /
translated: It is because all of them are non-apprehensible.

original: dmigs su med pa gang yin pa de ni gang na yang gnas par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs su med pa gang yin pa de ni gang na yang gnas par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is non-apprehensible does not become established anywhere.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa stong pa nyid de dag thams cad kyis chos 'di dag la rab tu sgom par byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa stong pa nyid de dag thams cad kyis chos 'di dag la rab tu sgom par byed de /
translated: Subhūti, in that way bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom thoroughly cultivate these dharmas with all those emptinesses.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams dang / 'phags pa thams cad la nyes pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams dang / 'phags pa thams cad la nyes pa med pa yin no //
translated: the lord buddhas, the bodhisattva great beings, the pratyekabuddhas, the śrāvakas of the tathāgatas, and all the āryas are without fault.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams kyis kyang chos nyid 'di nyid rjes su sangs rgyas shing rtogs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams kyis kyang chos nyid 'di nyid rjes su sangs rgyas shing rtogs te /
translated: Subhūti, it is because those lord buddhas, those bodhisattva great beings, those pratyekabuddhas, and those śrāvakas of the tathāgatas have realized and understood this very dharma-constituent.

original: de kho na bzhin du chos de dag dang / chos rnams gyi chos nyid las mi 'da' bar sems can rnams la bstan cing stong par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du chos de dag dang / chos rnams gyi chos nyid las mi 'da' bar sems can rnams la bstan cing stong par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have taught it to beings and made it empty just as it is, so that those dharmas and the dharmas’ dharma-constituent are not transgressed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag ni chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag @369a *//
analyzed: de dag ni chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag @369a *//
translated: They are the dharmadhātu, suchness,🔽and the perfect limit.

original: pa'i mtha' las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i mtha' las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not go beyond the dharma-constituent, suchness, and the very limit of reality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de dag la gang 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la gang 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro // de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
translated: Because they have no intrinsic nature that would go beyond them.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' las mi 'da' ba lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi dbyings dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' las mi 'da' ba lags na /
translated: if they do not go beyond the dharma-constituent, suchness, and the very limit of reality,

original: 'o na ci gzugs kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: 'o na ci gzugs kyang gzhan la /
translated: then is form one thing,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyang gzhan /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang gzhan /
translated: the dharma-constituent another,

original: de bzhin nyid kyang gzhan /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang gzhan /

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan nyid /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan nyid /
translated: the very limit of reality another,

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar du'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar du'ang gzhan la /
translated: and consciousness another,

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kyang gzhan /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kyang gzhan /
translated: and are mundane and supramundane dharmas another?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa ma mchis pa dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyang gzhan pa zhig lags sam /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa ma mchis pa dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyang gzhan pa zhig lags sam /
translated: Are dharmas with outflows and dharmas without outflows, and conditioned and unconditioned dharmas, also different?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / ma yin no //

analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das / gal te gzugs kyang gzhan ma lags la /

analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang gzhan ma lags / rnam par shes pa'i bar du'ang gzhan ma lags la /

original: chos kyi dbyings kyang gzhan ma lags te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang gzhan ma lags te /
translated: and consciousness is not one thing and the dharma-constituent another,

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi bar la'ang sbyar bar bgyi ba lags na /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi bar la'ang sbyar bar bgyi ba lags na /
translated: and if the same is applied up to conditioned and unconditioned dharmas,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: de ltar na ni las dkar gnag rnams kyi rnam par smin par @369b rnam par dgod pa dang gda' bar ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na ni las dkar gnag rnams kyi rnam par smin par @369b rnam par dgod pa dang gda' bar ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: how will the arrangement of the ripening of wholesome and unwholesome actions be made?

original: las nag po rnams kyi rnam par smin pa nag po sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags rnams kyi nang na gda' ba dang / las dkar po rnams kyi rnam par smin pa dkar po lha dang / mi rnams kyi nang na gda' ba dang /
analyzed: las nag po rnams kyi rnam par smin pa nag po sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags rnams kyi nang na gda' ba dang / las dkar po rnams kyi rnam par smin pa dkar po lha dang / mi rnams kyi nang na gda' ba dang /
translated: The black ripening of black actions is found among hell beings, animals, and pretas,🔽and the white ripening of white actions is found among gods and humans.🔽The white and black ripening of white and black actions is found among those who have been reborn as animals and among humans.

original: de bzhin du las dkar gnag rnams kyi rnam par smin pa dkar gnag dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gyur pa rnams dang / mi rnams kyi nang na gda' ba dang / de bzhin du las mi dkar mi gnag pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa mi dkar mi gnag pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du las dkar gnag rnams kyi rnam par smin pa dkar gnag dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gyur pa rnams dang / mi rnams kyi nang na gda' ba dang / de bzhin du las mi dkar mi gnag pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa mi dkar mi gnag pa ni /
translated: The non-white and non-black ripening of non-white and non-black actions

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: is the result of stream enterer,🔽the result of once-returner,🔽the result of non-returner,🔽arhatship,🔽individual enlightenment,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba lags /
translated: and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor / kun rdzob kyi ba den pa tshad mar byas nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / kun rdzob kyi ba den pa tshad mar byas nas /
translated: “Subhūti, having taken the conventional truth as valid,

original: 'bras bu rnam par bzhag pa ston par mdzad kyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par bzhag pa ston par mdzad kyi /
translated: the presentation of the fruits is taught.

original: don dam pa'i bden par ni 'bras bu rnam par bzhag pa bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden par ni 'bras bu rnam par bzhag pa bstan par mi nus so //
translated: But in the ultimate truth, the presentation of the fruits cannot be taught.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar don dam pa'i bden par gzugs dang / de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang; rnam par shes pa'i skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam pa'i bden par gzugs dang / de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang; rnam par shes pa'i skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang /
translated: Because in the ultimate truth, form, and likewise feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, are unborn, unceasing, uncontaminated,

original: rnam par byang ba med pa /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba med pa /
translated: and unpurified.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / @370a *//
analyzed: 'di lta ste / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / @370a *//
translated: It is like this:🔽The Dharma of the emptiness of what transcends limits

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi chos de ni rnam par mi rtog cing brjod du med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi chos de ni rnam par mi rtog cing brjod du med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the emptiness of what is beginningless and endless is non-conceptual and inexpressible.

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said: “Lord, Blessed One,

original: gal te kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten te /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten te /
translated: If the result is established in dependence on the conventional truth,

analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par bzhag pa lags na byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bur mi 'gyur lags sam /
translated: then would not all foolish ordinary beings be the result of stream enterer?

original: de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mi 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mi 'gyur lags sam /
translated: Similarly, would they not be the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / ci byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kun rdzob kyi bden pa'am /🔽don dam pa'i bden bshes sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ci byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kun rdzob kyi bden pa'am / don dam pa'i bden bshes sam /
translated: “Subhūti, do foolish ordinary beings know the conventional truth or the ultimate truth?

original: de dag la ni /
analyzed: de dag la ni /
translated: They do not know either of them.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: the result of stream enterer, and similarly, connect this with each, up to

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar gyi rnam par bzhag pa'ang med do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar gyi rnam par bzhag pa'ang med do //
translated: the state of a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are not established for them.”🔽“Lord, if the result of stream enterer is not established, and similarly, connect this with each, up to if the state of a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are not established, then, Lord, how will there be a distinction among the bodhisattva great beings, and how will there be a distinction among the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattva great beings?”

original: rab 'byor / gang gi phyir byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang gi phyir byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad la /
translated: Subhūti, it is because all foolish ordinary beings

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa med cing 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom pa med la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa med cing 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom pa med la /
translated: do not have the eightfold noble path, do not cultivate the eightfold noble path,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i 'bras bu med pa de nyid kyi phyir byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad la 'bras bu rnam par bzhag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i 'bras bu med pa de nyid kyi phyir byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad la 'bras bu rnam par bzhag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and do not have the result of the eightfold noble path. For that very reason, the result is not established for all foolish ordinary beings.

original: rab 'byor / 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams la ni @370b mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam bsgom pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam bsgom pa'i 'bras bu'ang yod do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams la ni @370b mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam bsgom pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam bsgom pa'i 'bras bu'ang yod do //
translated: Subhūti, for the noble beings, there is the path to nirvāṇa, there is the cultivation of the path to nirvāṇa, and there is the result of the cultivation of the path to nirvāṇa.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / 'phags pa'i gang zag de dag nyid la 'bras bu rnam par bzhag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'phags pa'i gang zag de dag nyid la 'bras bu rnam par bzhag pa yin gyi /

analyzed: gzhan dag la ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //

analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das / ci lam bsgom na / 'bras bu thob lags sam /
translated: “Lord,🔽is the fruit attained by cultivating the path,

analyzed: 'on te lam ma bsgom pa 'bras bu thob par 'gyur legs / de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //

original: rab 'byor / lam bsgoms na'ang 'bras bu mi 'thob la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / lam bsgoms na'ang 'bras bu mi 'thob la /
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti, the fruit is not attained by cultivating the path,

analyzed: lam la bsgoms pa'ang 'bras bu 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: nor is the fruit attained without cultivating the path.

original: rab 'byor / lam ma bsgoms par yang 'bras bu mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / lam ma bsgoms par yang 'bras bu mi 'thob ste /
translated: Subhūti, the fruit is not attained without cultivating the path,

original: lam med par yang 'bras bu thob pa med la /
analyzed: lam med par yang 'bras bu thob pa med la /

original: lam la gnas te 'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: lam la gnas te 'ang ma yin te /

analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa sems can rnams la 'bras bu rnam par 'god pa byed mod kyi / 'dus byas kyi khams la'am /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being who practices the perfection of wisdom does indeed set out the fruits for beings.🔽But he does not set out the fruits by way of annihilating the compounded element

analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams la tshar gcad pa'i tshul gyis 'bras bu rnam par 'god pa ma yin no //

analyzed: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ni kun tu sbyor ba gsum spangs pa'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti, the Tathāgata sets out the fruits for beings by way of the nonannihilation of the compounded element and the uncompounded element.🔽Subhūti, what do you think, is the fruit of stream enterer set out by way of annihilating the three fetters?

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang gnod sems bsrabs pa'i phyir lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang gnod sems bsrabs pa'i phyir lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Is the fruit of once-returner set out by way of annihilating the desire and malice that are reduced?

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The realization of the fruit of a pratyekabuddha is due to the abandonment of the five fetters that are in conformity with the higher realms and the abandonment of the five fetters that are in conformity with the lower realms.

analyzed: 'di'i don bdag gis ji ltar 'tshal bar bgyi lags /
translated: The realization of the fruit of a pratyekabuddha is due to the abandonment of the five

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: rab 'byor / ci rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ci rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: “Subhūti, is the fruit of entering the stream,

analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
translated: arhatship,

original: rang byang chub bam /
analyzed: rang byang chub bam /
translated: individual enlightenment,

original: bla na med pa yang @371b dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dus byas yin nam /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang @371b dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dus byas yin nam /
translated: or unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening conditioned?

original: 'o na de 'dus ma byas yin /
analyzed: 'o na de 'dus ma byas yin /
translated: Or are they unconditioned?”

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Venerable Blessed One,

original: chos de dag thams cad ni 'dus ma bgyis lags so //
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad ni 'dus ma bgyis lags so //
translated: all those phenomena are unconditioned.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / ci 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la tshar gcad du yod dam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ci 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la tshar gcad du yod dam /
translated: “Subhūti, are unconditioned phenomena to be eliminated?”

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Venerable Blessed One,

original: ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: ma mchis lags so //
translated: they are not.”🔽“Subhūti, when a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family

original: rab 'byor / ci rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang gi tshe 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ci rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang gi tshe 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams /
translated: realize that conditioned and unconditioned phenomena

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: are not two,

original: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig par rtogs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig par rtogs pa de'i tshe /
translated: When they realize that all phenomena are characterized by a single characteristic—that is, no characteristic—

original: 'di lta ste; 'dus byas sam 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang la'ang tshar gcod par byed dam /🔽gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: 'di lta ste; 'dus byas sam 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang la'ang tshar gcod par byed dam / gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: then they will not destroy anything, whether conditioned or unconditioned phenomena.

original: ma lags so //
analyzed: ma lags so //
translated: ” “No, they will not, Lord.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa tshar gcad du med pa'i phyir /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa tshar gcad du med pa'i phyir / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, in that way, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not destroy anything,

original: nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir sems can rnams la chos ston par byed cing /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir sems can rnams la chos ston par byed cing /
translated: then, because of inner emptiness, up to the emptiness of its own mark, they teach the doctrine to sentient beings.

original: bdag kyang chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen par mi byed la /
analyzed: bdag kyang chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen par mi byed la /
translated: They themselves do not settle down on any phenomenon,

original: gzhan dag kyang chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen par byed du mi 'jug ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen par byed du mi 'jug ste /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: and they do not cause others to settle down on any phenomenon.🔽They do not settle down on any phenomenon,🔽and they do not cause others to settle down on any phenomenon.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar ram /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar ram /
translated: the perfection of generosity, and similarly, up to the perfection of wisdom,

original: bsam gtan dang po'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'am /
translated: the first concentration,

original: @372a *// bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar ram /
analyzed: @372a *// bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar ram /
translated: up to the fourth concentration,

original: byams pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: byams pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'am /
translated: the absorption in loving kindness,

original: snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms la snyoms par 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms la snyoms par 'jug pa'am /
translated: the absorption in compassion, in joy, and in equanimity,

original: de bzhin du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'am; 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar ram /
analyzed: de bzhin du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'am; 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar ram /
translated: and similarly, the absorption in the sense field of infinite space, up to the absorption in the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams sam /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams sam /
translated: the applications of mindfulness,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar ram /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar ram /
translated: up to the noble eightfold path,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum mam /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum mam /
translated: the three gateways to liberation,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and in the same vein,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mngon par zhen par mi byed de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mngon par zhen par mi byed de /
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de dag la mngon par zhen par mi byed pas /
analyzed: de dag la mngon par zhen par mi byed pas /
translated: Since they do not settle down on them,

original: chos gang la'ang chags pa med do //
analyzed: chos gang la'ang chags pa med do //
translated: they are not attached to any dharma at all.

original: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ni sbyin pa'ang sbyin par byed la /
analyzed: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ni sbyin pa'ang sbyin par byed la /
translated: For example, a magical creation of the Tathāgata gives a gift,

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu'ang nyams su myong bar byed /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu'ang nyams su myong bar byed /
translated: and it experiences the result of that gift,

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu la'ang mi gnas te /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu la'ang mi gnas te /
translated: but it does not stand in the result of that gift.

original: sems can rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba kho na'i don du pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi bar la spyod cing /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba kho na'i don du pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi bar la spyod cing /
translated: It practices the six perfections for the sole purpose of bringing beings to complete nirvāṇa,

original: de bzhin du zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi bar la spyod mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi bar la spyod mod kyi /
translated: and similarly it practices the dharmas with and without outflows, the mundane and supramundane, and the conditioned and unconditioned dharmas,

original: chos gang la'ang mi gnas so //
analyzed: chos gang la'ang mi gnas so //
translated: but it does not stand in any dharma.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu @372b phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu @372b phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: chos thams cad la spyod mod kyi //
analyzed: chos thams cad la spyod mod kyi //
translated: practice all dharmas,

original: chos gang la'ang mi gnas shing chags pa med do //
analyzed: chos gang la'ang mi gnas shing chags pa med do //
translated: but they do not stand in any dharma and are not attached to any dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar des chos thams cad kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid legs par rtogs pa'i phyir ro ////
analyzed: 'di ltar des chos thams cad kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid legs par rtogs pa'i phyir ro ////
translated: Because they have thoroughly realized the characteristics of all phenomena.🔽Noble Mahāyāna Sūtra

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in a Hundred Thousand Lines

original: bam po sum cu pa /
analyzed: bam po sum cu pa /
translated: Chapter Thirty

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Venerable Blessed One,

original: gal te chos thams cad mtshan ma ma mchis pa'i mchog lags te /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad mtshan ma ma mchis pa'i mchog lags te /
translated: if all phenomena are the supreme absence of marks,

original: mtshan ma ni btags pa tsam kun tu rtog pa las byung ba lags na /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni btags pa tsam kun tu rtog pa las byung ba lags na /
translated: and marks are mere imputations arising from conceptualization,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: ji ltar bdag kyang dge ba'i chos rnams las khyad par 'thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag kyang dge ba'i chos rnams las khyad par 'thob par 'gyur la /
translated: attain distinction in virtuous qualities themselves

original: gzhan dag kyang dge ba'i chos khyad par du 'thob pa la sbyor bar bgyid cing /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang dge ba'i chos khyad par du 'thob pa la sbyor bar bgyid cing /
translated: and connect others to the attainment of distinction in virtuous qualities,

original: dge ba'i chos rnams kyis sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid la /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams kyis sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid la /
translated: and how do they complete one ground after another through virtuous qualities?

original: sems can rnams kyang theg pa gsum po dag la sbyor bar bgyid cing /🔽rab tu 'god par bgyid lags /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang theg pa gsum po dag la sbyor bar bgyid cing / rab tu 'god par bgyid lags /
translated: and they establish them in them.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti then asked him,

original: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dngos po'am /🔽dngos po'i mtshan ma zhig sgom zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dngos po'am / dngos po'i mtshan ma zhig sgom zhing /
translated: “Lord, if bodhisattva great beings meditate on a thing or🔽a sign of a thing,

original: dngos po med pa dang / mtshan @373a *//
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang / mtshan @373a *//
translated: and do not meditate on a nonthing and a signless,🔽then those bodhisattva great beings will not themselves attain the special state🔽and will not connect others to the special state🔽and establish them in it.”🔽“Subhūti, if bodhisattva great beings meditate on a thing or🔽a sign of a thing,

original: ma med pa mi sgom na ni /
analyzed: ma med pa mi sgom na ni /
translated: and do not meditate on a nonthing and a signless,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bdag kyang khyad par 'thob par mi 'gyur la /🔽gzhan dag kyang khyad par la sbyor bar byed cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bdag kyang khyad par 'thob par mi 'gyur la / gzhan dag kyang khyad par la sbyor bar byed cing /
translated: then those bodhisattva great beings will not themselves attain the special state🔽and will not connect others to the special state

original: rab tu 'god par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu 'god par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and establish them in it.

original: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / de bzhin du brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / de bzhin du brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: and similarly, the perfection of perseverance,

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
translated: the perfection of patience, and the perfection of morality,

original: gal te mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed la /
analyzed: gal te mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed la /
translated: and if, by means of the very absence of attributes, they perfect the perfection of generosity,

original: de bzhin du gal te mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis bsam gtan rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis bsam gtan rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: and similarly, if, by means of the very absence of attributes, they perfect the meditative stabilizations,

original: gal te mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: gal te mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: if they perfect the immeasurables and formless absorptions by means of the very absence of attributes,

original: de bzhin du gal te mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar du sgom zhing yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar du sgom zhing yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: Similarly, if they cultivate and perfect the applications of mindfulness, the correct exertions, and so on up to the eightfold noble path, they do so exclusively by way of the absence of attributes.

original: de bzhin du mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i ting nge @373b 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i ting nge @373b 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: Similarly, they perfect the meditative stabilities of emptiness, the absence of attributes, and the absence of aspiration exclusively by way of the absence of attributes.

original: de bzhin du mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: Similarly, they perfect the emptiness of internal phenomena exclusively by way of the absence of attributes.

original: mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis phyi stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis phyi stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: They perfect the emptiness of external phenomena exclusively by way of the absence of attributes.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein,

original: mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: they perfect , up to and including the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, exclusively by way of the absence of attributes.

original: de bzhin du mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis rnam par thar pa brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis rnam par thar pa brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: In the same way, they complete the eight liberations by means of the very absence of attributes.

original: mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: They complete the nine serial steps of meditative absorption by means of the very absence of attributes.

original: de bzhin du mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byed na /
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan ma med pa kho na'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byed na /
translated: In the same way, they complete the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four kinds of intrepid confidence, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great loving kindness, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas by means of the very absence of attributes.

original: de ltar na de de dag la mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis chags par mi byed la /
analyzed: de ltar na de de dag la mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis chags par mi byed la /
translated: In this way, they do not become attached to these by means of the very absence of attributes.

original: phyin ci log tu'ang mi 'gyur te /🔽de dge ba'i chos 'di dag bsgoms nas gzhan dag kyang /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu'ang mi 'gyur te / de dge ba'i chos 'di dag bsgoms nas gzhan dag kyang /
translated: They do not become distorted.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Having cultivated these virtuous qualities, they also cause others🔽to cultivate them.

original: dge ba'i chos de dag nyid la sbyor bar byed cing rab tu 'god par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos de dag nyid la sbyor bar byed cing rab tu 'god par byed do //
translated: and they will also apply themselves to those wholesome dharmas and will be established in them.

original: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de la tha na se gol gtogs pa tsam du'ang chos kyi mtshan ma zhig yod par gyur @374a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de la tha na se gol gtogs pa tsam du'ang chos kyi mtshan ma zhig yod par gyur @374a *//
translated: Subhūti, if even for the time it takes to snap one’s fingers, a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom were to have a causal sign of a dharma,

original: na'ang / rab 'byor /
analyzed: na'ang / rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de /
translated: that bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: would not fully awaken to all dharmas without exception as they really are, that is, as signless, not having memory, and not having attention.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams la de bzhin nyid du 'god par mi 'gyur ro; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams la de bzhin nyid du 'god par mi 'gyur ro; ;rab 'byor /
translated: he would not establish them in suchness, that is, in the uncontaminated dharmas.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni mtshan ma med pa dang / dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni mtshan ma med pa dang / dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med pa yin te /
translated: All those dharmas without outflows are without signs, without recollection, and without mentation.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi rtag tu sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi rtag tu sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: Subhūti, in this way, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas practicing the perfection of wisdom always benefit sentient beings with dharmas without outflows.

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord, Blessed One,

original: gal te chos thams cad mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / dran pa ma mchis pa dang / yid la byed pa ma mchis pa lags na /

analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam / gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /

original: rab 'byor / 'o na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub nyid mtshan ma med pa yin nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'o na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub nyid mtshan ma med pa yin nam /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Well then, Subhūti, are the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, and the state of a pratyekabuddha signless?

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub nyid mtshan ma med pa yin nam; gsol pa /

analyzed: de de lta lags te /

original: btsun pa bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: btsun pa bde bar gshegs pa /

original: rab 'byor / @375a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / @375a *//

analyzed: khyod kyis rnam grangs des na /

analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa yin par rig par bya'o //

original: rab 'byor / mtshan ma med pa'i chos 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur te /

translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who train in this signless Dharma will increase in all wholesome roots.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhin dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhin dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang /
translated: the six perfections, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power,

original: dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: the five faculties, the five powers, the seven limbs of awakening, the noble eightfold path, and in the same vein,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar gyis rtag tu rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar gyis rtag tu rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they will always increase in all the buddhadharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ma gtogs par gzhan la bslab par mi bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ma gtogs par gzhan la bslab par mi bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should not train in anything other than emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po 'dir dge ba'i chos thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po 'dir dge ba'i chos thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because all wholesome dharmas are included in these three gateways to liberation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid ni chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa yin la /🔽rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa ni mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba yin /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid ni chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa yin la / rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa ni mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba yin /
translated: Why is that?🔽It is because the gateway to liberation of emptiness is all dharmas being empty of their own marks;🔽the gateway to liberation of signlessness is being free from all signs;

original: @375b rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa ni smon lam thams cad rnam par spangs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: @375b rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa ni smon lam thams cad rnam par spangs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: and the gateway to liberation of wishlessness is being free from all wishes.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni phung po lnga po dag la skye ba dang 'jig par rjes su lta zhing slob pa yin /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni phung po lnga po dag la skye ba dang 'jig par rjes su lta zhing slob pa yin /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains in these three gateways to liberation trains in observing the arising and passing away of the five aggregates.

original: de bzhin du skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs pa la slob pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs pa la slob pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, he trains in realizing the twelve sense fields, the eighteen elements, and similarly the four noble truths.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis po rtogs par khong du chud pa la slob pa yin /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis po rtogs par khong du chud pa la slob pa yin /
translated: He trains in realizing and comprehending the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: de nas nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la slob pa yin /
analyzed: de nas nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la slob pa yin /
translated: Then he trains in inner emptiness, outer emptiness, and inner and outer emptiness.

original: de bzhin du dngos po med pa stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la slob pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po med pa stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la slob pa yin /
translated: Similarly, he trains in the emptiness of non-apprehension up to the emptiness of essential nature.

original: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob pa yin /
translated: Similarly, he trains in the six perfections.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar la slob pa yin /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar la slob pa yin /
translated: He trains in the four establishments of mindfulness, up to the eightfold noble path.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag pa rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la slob pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag pa rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la slob pa yin no //
translated: He trains in the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Ten Thousand Lines,

original: chos kyi sbyin pa'i le'u zhes bya ste nyi shu dgu pa'o ////🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa'i le'u zhes bya ste nyi shu dgu pa'o //// de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: this is chapter twenty-nine, “The Gift of Dharma.”🔽Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: @376a *// 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la slob pa na phung po lnga po dag la ji ltar skye ba dang 'jig par rjes su lta zhing slob pa lags
analyzed: @376a *// 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la slob pa na phung po lnga po dag la ji ltar skye ba dang 'jig par rjes su lta zhing slob pa lags
translated: “Well then, Blessed One, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom train in the three gateways to liberation, how do they train in observing the arising and cessation of the five aggregates?”

original: / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa /
translated: “Su­bhūti, here bodhisattva great beings training in the perfection of wisdom

original: gzugs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: gzugs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: know form as it truly is.

original: gzugs gang las kyang mi skye ba dang / gang du'ang 'gag pa med pa dang / gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gzugs gang las kyang mi skye ba dang / gang du'ang 'gag pa med pa dang / gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: They know that form does not arise from anywhere, that it does not cease anywhere, and that the real nature of form is just as it is.

original: gzugs ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: gzugs ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
translated: How do they know form as it truly is?

original: dper na / dbu ba rdos pa la snying po gtan med pa de bzhin du gzugs kyang /
analyzed: dper na / dbu ba rdos pa la snying po gtan med pa de bzhin du gzugs kyang /
translated: For example, just as a lump of foam has no essence at all, so too is form.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like a lump of foam.🔽It is like a lump of foam.

original: shin tu gse tshags dang / shin tu gsong ldong du rab tu shes so //🔽gzugs kyi skye ba ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: shin tu gse tshags dang / shin tu gsong ldong du rab tu shes so // gzugs kyi skye ba ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: It is like a lump of foam.🔽It is like a lump of foam.

analyzed: gzugs ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba med la gang du'ang 'gro ba med de /
translated: It is like a lump of foam.🔽It is like a lump of foam.🔽It is like a lump of foam.🔽It is like a lump of foam.

analyzed: gzugs gang nas kyang 'ong ba med pa nyid dang / gang du'ang 'gro ba med pa nyid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: It is like a lump of foam.🔽It is like a lump of foam.🔽It is like a lump of foam.🔽It is like a lump of foam.🔽It is like a lump of foam.🔽It is like a lump of foam.🔽It is like a lump of foam.🔽It is like a lump of foam.🔽It is like a lump of foam.🔽It is like a lump of foam.🔽It is like a lump of foam.🔽It is like a lump of foam.

original: de ltar gzugs kyi skye ba rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de ltar gzugs kyi skye ba rab tu shes so //
translated: It is like a lump of foam.

original: gzugs kyi 'gag pa ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'gag pa ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: It is like a lump of foam.🔽It is like a lump of foam.

original: gzugs de gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba med la /
analyzed: gzugs de gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba med la /
translated: It is like a lump of foam.

original: zad pa dang 'jig pa'i @376b chos can dang ldan pa de ltar gzugs kyi 'gag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: zad pa dang 'jig pa'i @376b chos can dang ldan pa de ltar gzugs kyi 'gag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: It is like a lump of foam.

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
translated: How does one know the suchness of form as it truly is?

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid la skye ba'ang med /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid la skye ba'ang med /
translated: The suchness of form is unborn

original: 'gag pa'ang med /🔽gang nas kyang 'ong ba med /
analyzed: 'gag pa'ang med / gang nas kyang 'ong ba med /
translated: and unceasing.🔽It does not come from anywhere

original: gang du'ang 'gro ba med /🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa'ang med /
analyzed: gang du'ang 'gro ba med / kun nas nyon mongs pa'ang med /
translated: and does not go anywhere.

original: rnam par byang ba'ang med /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'ang med /
translated: It is neither afflicted nor purified,

original: 'phel ba'ang med /
analyzed: 'phel ba'ang med /
translated: neither increases nor decreases,🔽and is not something that can be known.

original: 'grib pa'ang med pa de ltar gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'grib pa'ang med pa de ltar gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: In this way, the suchness of form is known as it truly is.

original: tshor ba ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: tshor ba ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
translated: How is feeling known as it truly is?

original: chu'i chu bur gyi gnas pa bzhin du /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: chu'i chu bur gyi gnas pa bzhin du / 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like a water bubble in that🔽it is quickly formed and quickly destroyed.

original: shin tu 'bras yin pa dang / shin tu zug rdu yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: shin tu 'bras yin pa dang / shin tu zug rdu yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: In this way, feeling is known as it truly is.🔽Feeling does not come from anywhere

original: tshor ba gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba med la /
analyzed: tshor ba gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba med la /
translated: and does not go anywhere.

original: de ni gsum 'dus pa las kyang 'byung ba de ltar tshor ba'i skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de ni gsum 'dus pa las kyang 'byung ba de ltar tshor ba'i skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: It arises from the coming together of the three. In this way, one should accurately understand the arising of sensation.

original: tshor ba gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba med la /
analyzed: tshor ba gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba med la /
translated: Sensation does not come from anywhere, nor does it go anywhere.

original: zad pa dang 'jig pa'i chos can dang yang ldan pa de ltar tshor ba'i 'gog pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //🔽tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa'ang med /
analyzed: zad pa dang 'jig pa'i chos can dang yang ldan pa de ltar tshor ba'i 'gog pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so // tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa'ang med /
translated: It is endowed with the nature of cessation and destruction. In this way, one should accurately understand the cessation of sensation.

original: rnam par byang ba'ang med /🔽'phel ba'ang med /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'ang med / 'phel ba'ang med /
translated: The suchness of sensation is neither defiled nor purified,

original: 'grib pa'ang med pa de ltar tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //🔽'du shes ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta @377a *//
analyzed: 'grib pa'ang med pa de ltar tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so // 'du shes ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta @377a *//
translated: neither increases nor decreases. In this way, one should accurately understand the suchness of sensation.
