original: ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
translated: How should one accurately understand perception?

original: dper na / smig rgyu ni chu 'dod pa la slu bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na / smig rgyu ni chu 'dod pa la slu bar byed pa yin te /
translated: For example, a mirage deceives those who desire water.

original: smig rgyu la chu dmigs su med pa de ltar 'du shes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: smig rgyu la chu dmigs su med pa de ltar 'du shes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: Just as water is not perceived in a mirage, so he knows the perception of a mirage to be just as it is, in accordance with reality.

original: 'du shes gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba med la /
analyzed: 'du shes gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba med la /
translated: He knows that perception does not come from anywhere or go anywhere,

original: log par kun tu rtog pa las kyang 'byung zhing gdags pas /
analyzed: log par kun tu rtog pa las kyang 'byung zhing gdags pas /
translated: and that it arises from false imagination and is imputed.

original: tha snyad du 'dogs par byed pa de ltar 'du shes kyi skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: tha snyad du 'dogs par byed pa de ltar 'du shes kyi skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the arising of perception to be just as it is, in accordance with reality, in that it is imputed conventionally.

original: de gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba med la /
analyzed: de gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba med la /
translated: He knows that perception does not come from anywhere or go anywhere,

original: zad pa dang 'jig pa'i chos can yang ldan pa de ltar 'du shes kyi 'gog pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: zad pa dang 'jig pa'i chos can yang ldan pa de ltar 'du shes kyi 'gog pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: and that it is subject to destruction and disintegration, so he knows the cessation of perception to be just as it is, in accordance with reality.

original: 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa'ang med /🔽rnam par byang ba'ang med /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa'ang med / rnam par byang ba'ang med /
translated: In the suchness of perception there is no defilement,🔽no purification,🔽no increase,

original: 'phel ba'ang med /
analyzed: 'phel ba'ang med /
translated: and no decrease.

original: 'grib pa'ang med pa de ltar 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'grib pa'ang med pa de ltar 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: And they do not decrease. In this way, they know the suchness of perception just as it is, in reality.

original: 'du byed rnams ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
translated: “How do they know formations just as they are?

original: dper na / chu shing shun pa so sor phye na /
analyzed: dper na / chu shing shun pa so sor phye na /
translated: For example, when the bark of a plantain tree is peeled away,

original: snying po dmigs su med pa de ltar 'du byed yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: snying po dmigs su med pa de ltar 'du byed yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: no core is found. In this way, they know formations just as they are.

original: 'du byed rnams gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba med la /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba med la /
translated: Formations do not come from anywhere or go anywhere.

original: log par kun tu rtog pa las kyang 'byung ba de ltar 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba yang @377b dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: log par kun tu rtog pa las kyang 'byung ba de ltar 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba yang @377b dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: They arise from wrong conceptualization. In this way, they know the arising of formations just as it is.

original: de dag gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba med la /
analyzed: de dag gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba med la /
translated: They do not come from anywhere or go anywhere.

original: zad pa dang 'jig pa'i chos dang yang ldan pa de ltar 'du byed rnams kyi 'gog pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: zad pa dang 'jig pa'i chos dang yang ldan pa de ltar 'du byed rnams kyi 'gog pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: In this way, they know the cessation of formations as it truly is.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi de bzhin nyid la skye ba'ang med /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi de bzhin nyid la skye ba'ang med /
translated: The suchness of formations is unborn,

original: 'gag pa'ang med /🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa'ang med /🔽rnam par byang ba'ang med /
analyzed: 'gag pa'ang med / kun nas nyon mongs pa'ang med / rnam par byang ba'ang med /
translated: undying,🔽unbound,🔽unliberated,

original: 'phel ba'ang med /
analyzed: 'phel ba'ang med /
translated: neither increasing nor decreasing.

original: 'grib pa'ang med pa de ltar 'du byed rnams kyi de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'grib pa'ang med pa de ltar 'du byed rnams kyi de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: In this way, they know the suchness of formations as it truly is.

original: rnam par shes pa ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
translated: “How do they know consciousness as it truly is?

original: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan zhig gis lam gyi bzhi mdor 'dug nas /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan zhig gis lam gyi bzhi mdor 'dug nas /
translated: For example, it is like a magician who sits at a crossroads

original: skye bo phal po che'i mdun du byis pa la 'drid par byed pa dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi po /
analyzed: skye bo phal po che'i mdun du byis pa la 'drid par byed pa dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi po /
translated: and deceives the crowd of people with the four divisions of his army.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs ston par byed pa de ltar rnam par shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs ston par byed pa de ltar rnam par shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows consciousness as it really is, as a collection of elephants, a collection of horses, a collection of chariots, a collection of foot soldiers, and a collection of infantry leaders.

original: rnam par shes pa gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba med la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba med la /
translated: He knows consciousness as it really is, as not coming from anywhere and not going anywhere.

original: 'du byed las kyang rab tu 'byung ba dang / 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis kyang bskyed pa de ltar rnam par shes pa'i skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'du byed las kyang rab tu 'byung ba dang / 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis kyang bskyed pa de ltar rnam par shes pa'i skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the arising of consciousness as it really is, as arising from volitional formations, and as produced by the condition of volitional formations.

original: rnam par shes pa de gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba med la /🔽zad pa dang / @378a *//
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba med la / zad pa dang / @378a *//
translated: He knows the cessation of consciousness as it really is, as the cessation of consciousness that does not come from anywhere and does not go anywhere.

original: 'jig pa'i chos dang yang ldan pa de ltar rnam par shes pa'i 'gag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i chos dang yang ldan pa de ltar rnam par shes pa'i 'gag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the cessation of consciousness as it really is, as the cessation of consciousness that is subject to destruction, disappearance, and disintegration.

original: rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / 'phel ba med pa dang / 'grib pa med pa de ltar rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / 'phel ba med pa dang / 'grib pa med pa de ltar rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: The suchness of consciousness is unborn, unceasing, uncontaminated, unpurified, non-increasing, and non-decreasing.

original: khams rnams ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: khams rnams ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
translated: How does one accurately understand the suchness of consciousness?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: mig gi khams ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: mig gi khams ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong par rab tu shes so //
translated: One understands that the eye element is empty of inherent nature.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong par rab tu shes so //
translated: Similarly, one understands that the form element and the eye consciousness element are empty of inherent nature.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong par rab tu shes te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong par rab tu shes te /
translated: In the same way, one understands that up to the mind consciousness element is empty of the inherent nature of the mind consciousness element.

original: de ltar na khams rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na khams rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the elements are known as they are in reality.

original: skye mched rnams ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: skye mched rnams ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
translated: How are the sense-spheres known as they are in reality?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: nang gi skye mched drug ni nang gi skye mched drug gis stong par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched drug ni nang gi skye mched drug gis stong par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: The six internal sense-spheres are known as they are in reality as empty of the six internal sense-spheres.

original: de bzhin du phyi'i skye mched drug ni phyi'i skye mched drug gis stong par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi'i skye mched drug ni phyi'i skye mched drug gis stong par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: Similarly, the six external sense-spheres are known as they are in reality as empty of the six external sense-spheres.

original: de ltar na skye mched rnams yang dag pa @378b ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na skye mched rnams yang dag pa @378b ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the sense-spheres are known as they are in reality.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
translated: How are the four noble truths known as they are in reality?

original: sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid ni nyams su gnod pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid ni nyams su gnod pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of suffering is harm.

original: kun 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni rab tu skye ba'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni rab tu skye ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of origination is production.

original: 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid ni zhi ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of cessation is peace.

original: lam gyi mtshan nyid ni ngas par 'byin pa ste /🔽'phags pa'i bden pa rnam gnyis las rnam par grol ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes shing /
analyzed: lam gyi mtshan nyid ni ngas par 'byin pa ste / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnam gnyis las rnam par grol ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes shing /
translated: The characteristic of the path is that it is a means of escape.🔽One should know the two kinds of noble truths as they really are.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnam gnyis ma yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnam gnyis ma yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: One should know the two kinds of noble truths as they really are.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
translated: How should one know dependent origination as it really is?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa dang / don gcig pa ma yin pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa dang /
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa dang / don gcig pa ma yin pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa dang /
translated: non-arising, non-ceasing, non-annihilation, non-eternity, not the same, not different, not coming, not going,

original: spros pa dang bral ba dang / zhi bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: spros pa dang bral ba dang / zhi bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: free from mental proliferation, and peace.

original: de ltar na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa yin no //
translated: In this way, one should know dependent origination as it really is.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Reverend Lord!

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /🔽de ltar phan tshun tha dad pa'i chos rnams de ltar rab tu 'tshal na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa / de ltar phan tshun tha dad pa'i chos rnams de ltar rab tu 'tshal na /
translated: If bodhisattva great beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom

original: 'o na des chos kyi @379a *//
analyzed: 'o na des chos kyi @379a *//
translated: understand those phenomena that are mutually distinct in that way,

original: dbyings rnam par dkrugs par mi 'gyur lags sam /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dbyings rnam par dkrugs par mi 'gyur lags sam / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: then will they not disturb the expanse of reality?

original: rab 'byor / gal te chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan 'ga' zhig yod na ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan 'ga' zhig yod na ni /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Su­bhūti, if there were any other phenomena apart from the expanse of reality,

original: rnam par dkrugs par yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: rnam par dkrugs par yang 'gyur na /
translated: then they would be disturbed.

original: rab 'byor / chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos 'ga' yang dmigs su med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos 'ga' yang dmigs su med de /
translated: Su­bhūti, however, no phenomena apart from the expanse of reality can be apprehended.

original: gal te dmigs su yod na ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dkrugs par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dmigs su yod na ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dkrugs par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to be apprehended, then the dharma-element would be disturbed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams kyis chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos 'ga' yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams kyis chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos 'ga' yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, because the Tathāgatas, Bodhisattvas, Pratyekabuddhas, and Disciples of the Tathāgatas do not apprehend any dharma that is not included in the dharma-element.

original: ma dmigs pas de ston par mi byed do //
analyzed: ma dmigs pas de ston par mi byed do //
translated: Since they do not apprehend it, they do not teach it.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: Subhūti, thus should Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas, practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa rnam par dkrug tu med pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa rnam par dkrug tu med pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: train in the indivisible, undifferentiated dharma-element.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi dbyings la slob pas gang la bslabs pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi dbyings la slob pas gang la bslabs pa lags /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva great beings’ training in the dharma-constituent?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @379b chos kyi dbyings la slob pas ni chos thams cad la bslabs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @379b chos kyi dbyings la slob pas ni chos thams cad la bslabs pa yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings’ training in the dharma-constituent is a training in all dharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings su 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings su 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because all dharmas are included in the dharma-constituent.”

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Lord,

original: ci'i slad du chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings su 'dus pa lags //
analyzed: ci'i slad du chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings su 'dus pa lags //
translated: why are all dharmas included in the dharma-constituent?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: The Lord said,

original: ma byung yang rung chos thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings ni dbyer med pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: ma byung yang rung chos thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings ni dbyer med pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa nyid de /
translated: “Subhūti, whether Tathāgatas arise or do not arise, all dharmas remain in the dharma-constituent, which is suchness, unaltered suchness, unaltered reality, and the true nature of dharmas.

original: rab 'byor / chos kyi dbyings de'ang chos thams cad de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos kyi dbyings de'ang chos thams cad de /
translated: Subhūti, that dharma-constituent is all dharmas.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du bstan pa dang lung du ma bstan pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams yin te /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du bstan pa dang lung du ma bstan pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams yin te /
translated: virtuous and nonvirtuous, determinate and indeterminate, contaminated and uncontaminated, mundane and supramundane, compounded and uncompounded.

original: de dag ni chos thams cad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni chos thams cad ces bya'o //
translated: These are called all phenomena.

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Blessed One,

original: gal te chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings lags na /
translated: if all phenomena are the realm of phenomena,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: how should bodhisattva great beings train in the perfection of wisdom?

original: de bzhin du ji ltar bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ji ltar brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ji ltar bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ji ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ji ltar brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ji ltar bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ji ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Similarly, how should they train in the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality,

original: ji @380a *// ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji @380a *// ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should we train in the perfection of generosity?

original: de bzhin du ji ltar bsam gtan dang po dang / ji ltar gnyis pa dang / ji ltar gsum pa dang / ji ltar bsam gtan bzhi pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar bsam gtan dang po dang / ji ltar gnyis pa dang / ji ltar gsum pa dang / ji ltar bsam gtan bzhi pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: Similarly, how should we train in the first concentration, how in the second concentration, how in the third concentration, and how in the fourth concentration?

original: de bzhin du ji ltar byams pa dang / ji ltar snying rje dang / ji ltar dga' ba dang / ji ltar btang snyoms la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar byams pa dang / ji ltar snying rje dang / ji ltar dga' ba dang / ji ltar btang snyoms la bslab par bgyi /
translated: Similarly, how should we train in loving kindness, how in compassion, how in joy, and how in equanimity?

original: de bzhin du ji ltar nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / ji ltar 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / ji ltar 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar la bslab par bgyi /
translated: Similarly, how should we train in the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space, and how in the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception?

original: de bzhin du ji ltar dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la bslab par bgyi /
translated: Similarly, how should we train in the applications of mindfulness?

original: de bzhin du ji ltar yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / de bzhin du rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / de bzhin du rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path?🔽How should they train in emptiness,

original: ji ltar stong pa nyid dang / ji ltar mtshan ma med pa dang / ji ltar smon pa med pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar stong pa nyid dang / ji ltar mtshan ma med pa dang / ji ltar smon pa med pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness?

original: ji ltar rnam par thar pa brgyad la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par thar pa brgyad la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the eight aspects of liberation?

original: ji ltar mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la bslab par bgyi; ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la bslab par bgyi; ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the nine serial steps of meditative absorption? How should they train in the ten powers of the tathāgatas?

original: ji ltar mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the four assurances and the four kinds of exact knowledge?

original: ji ltar byams @380b pa chen po dang / ji ltar snying rje chen po dang / ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar byams @380b pa chen po dang / ji ltar snying rje chen po dang / ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the four assurances?🔽How should they train in the four kinds of exact knowledge?🔽How should they train in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha?🔽How should they train in the thirty-two major marks of a great person?

original: ji ltar skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / ji ltar dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / ji ltar dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the eighty minor marks?

original: ji ltar rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag yongs su grub par bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag yongs su grub par bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in order to perfect the great sāla tree–like royal families?🔽How should they train in order to perfect the great sāla tree–like brahmin families?

original: ji ltar bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag yongs su grub par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag yongs su grub par bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag yongs su grub par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag yongs su grub par bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in order to perfect the great sāla tree–like business families?

original: ji ltar rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i ris su skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i ris su skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in order to be reborn in the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings?

original: ji ltar sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i ris su skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i ris su skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should we train in order to be reborn in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three?

original: de bzhin du ji ltar gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i ris kyi bar du skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i ris kyi bar du skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
translated: Similarly, how should we train in order to be reborn in the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations?

original: ji ltar tshangs ris kyi lha'i ris su skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar tshangs ris kyi lha'i ris su skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should we train in order to be reborn in the Heaven of the Assembly of Brahma?

original: ji ltar 'od gsal dang / dge rgyas dang / 'bras bu che ba'i lha'i ris su skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar 'od gsal dang / dge rgyas dang / 'bras bu che ba'i lha'i ris su skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should we train in order to be reborn in the Heaven of Luminous Radiance, the Heaven of Great Fruition, and the Heaven of Perfected Virtue?

original: ji ltar 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha'i ris su skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha'i ris su skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should we train in order to be reborn in the Heaven of the Multitude of Chief Gods?

original: ji ltar gnas gtsang ma'i lha'i ris su skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi zhing der skye bar yang mi bgyid lags /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas gtsang ma'i lha'i ris su skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi zhing der skye bar yang mi bgyid lags /
translated: How should we train in order to be reborn in the Heaven of Pure Abodes, without being reborn there?

original: ji ltar nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi lha'i ris su skye bar bgyi @381a *//
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi lha'i ris su skye bar bgyi @381a *//
translated: How should we train in order to be reborn in the Heaven of Infinite Space?

original: ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi zhing der yang skye bar mi bgyi lags /🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi zhing der yang skye bar mi bgyi lags / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and we should train in order to be reborn there, but we should not be reborn there.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lha'i ris kyi bar du skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi zhing /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lha'i ris kyi bar du skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi zhing /
translated: In the same vein, we should train in order to be reborn in the divine realms of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: der yang skye bar mi bgyi lags /
analyzed: der yang skye bar mi bgyi lags /
translated: but we should not be reborn there.

original: ji ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang po la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang po la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should we train in the first generation of bodhicitta?

original: ji ltar gnyis pa dang / ji ltar gsum pa dang / ji ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed pa bcu pa'i bar la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyis pa dang / ji ltar gsum pa dang / ji ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed pa bcu pa'i bar la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should we train in the second, the third, and up to the tenth generation of bodhicitta?

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should we train in the first bodhisattva level?

original: de bzhin du ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa /
translated: In the same vein, how should we train in the bodhisattva levels,

original: bcu pa'i bar la bslab par bgyi /🔽ji ltar nyan thos kyi sa la bslab bar bgyi /
analyzed: bcu pa'i bar la bslab par bgyi / ji ltar nyan thos kyi sa la bslab bar bgyi /
translated: up to and including the tenth?🔽How should we train in the level of the śrāvakas?

original: ji ltar rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should we train in the level of the pratyekabuddhas?

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the bodhisattvas’ faultlessness?

original: ji ltar sems can yongs su smin par bgyi ba la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sems can yongs su smin par bgyi ba la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in bringing sentient beings to maturity?

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyi ba la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyi ba la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in purifying a buddhafield?

original: ji ltar gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in all the dhāraṇī gateways?

original: ji ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in all the samādhi gateways?

original: ji ltar gang la bslabs pas chos thams cad kyi rnam pa 'tshal bar 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar gang la bslabs pas chos thams cad kyi rnam pa 'tshal bar 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the bodhisattva path, by training in which they will know the aspects of all phenomena?

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Venerable Blessed One,

original: chos kyi dbyings de la ni rnam par rtog pa de dag ma mchis lags na /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de la ni rnam par rtog pa de dag ma mchis lags na /
translated: those conceptual thoughts do not exist in the realm of phenomena.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Venerable Blessed One,

original: @381b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyin ci log la spyod pa'am /
analyzed: @381b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyin ci log la spyod pa'am /
translated: will bodhisattva great beings who engage in error

original: gcig tu mi 'gyur lags grang /
analyzed: gcig tu mi 'gyur lags grang /
translated: not be mistaken?

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Venerable Blessed One,

original: chos kyi dbyings de la ni rnam par rtog pa de dag ma mchis pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de la ni rnam par rtog pa de dag ma mchis pa'i slad du ste /
translated: Because in the realm of phenomena, those conceptual thoughts do not exist.

original: gzugs kyang chos kyi dbyings ma lags /
analyzed: gzugs kyang chos kyi dbyings ma lags /
translated: Form is not the realm of phenomena.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi skye mched dang; chos kyi skye mched kyi bar yang ma lags /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi skye mched dang; chos kyi skye mched kyi bar yang ma lags /
translated: Feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness, and from the eye-source up to the phenomena-source are not it.

original: mig gi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams gyi bar yang ma lags /
analyzed: mig gi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams gyi bar yang ma lags /
translated: From the eye constituent up to the mind consciousness constituent are not it.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams las gud na'ang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams las gud na'ang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis /
translated: The realm of phenomena is not separate from form, feeling, perception, and formation.

original: rnam par shes pa las gud na'ang ma mchis /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las gud na'ang ma mchis /
translated: It is not separate from consciousness.

original: mig gi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched las gud na'ang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis /
analyzed: mig gi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched las gud na'ang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis /
translated: The realm of phenomena is not separate from the eye-source up to the phenomena-source.

original: mig gi khams las gud na'ang ma mchis /
analyzed: mig gi khams las gud na'ang ma mchis /
translated: It is not separate from the eye constituent.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar las gud na'ang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar las gud na'ang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis te /
translated: Up to the mind consciousness constituent, the realm of phenomena is not separate from them.

original: gzugs nyid chos kyi dbyings lags la /
analyzed: gzugs nyid chos kyi dbyings lags la /
translated: Form itself is the dharma-constituent.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid gzugs lags so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid gzugs lags so //
translated: The dharma-constituent itself is form.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa nyid chos kyi dbyings lags la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa nyid chos kyi dbyings lags la /
translated: Similarly, consciousness itself is the dharma-constituent.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid rnam par shes pa lags te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid rnam par shes pa lags te /
translated: The dharma-constituent itself is consciousness.

original: le'u snga mar ji ltar bsgres pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: le'u snga mar ji ltar bsgres pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as it was expanded in the previous chapter,

original: chos thams cad la'ang rgya cher sbyar bar bgyi lags so //
analyzed: chos thams cad la'ang rgya cher sbyar bar bgyi lags so //
translated: it should be expanded in the same way for all dharmas.

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis che dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal @382a *//
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis che dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal @382a *//
translated: The Lord having said that, he said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: to; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: to; ;rab 'byor /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin no //
translated: it is just so.

original: ji skad du smras pa de bzhin te chos kyi dbyings la ni rnam par rtog pa de dag thams cad med de /🔽gzugs kyang chos kyi dbyings ma yin la /
analyzed: ji skad du smras pa de bzhin te chos kyi dbyings la ni rnam par rtog pa de dag thams cad med de / gzugs kyang chos kyi dbyings ma yin la /
translated: As you say, in the dharma-constituent all those discriminations do not exist.🔽Form is not the dharma-constituent.

original: gzugs las gud na'ang chos kyi dbyings med /
analyzed: gzugs las gud na'ang chos kyi dbyings med /
translated: The dharma-constituent is not other than form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang chos kyi dbyings ma yin la; rnam shes pa las gud na'ang chos kyi dbyings med de /🔽gzugs nyid chos kyi dbyings yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang chos kyi dbyings ma yin la; rnam shes pa las gud na'ang chos kyi dbyings med de / gzugs nyid chos kyi dbyings yin la /
translated: Likewise, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not the dharma-constituent, and apart from consciousness there is no dharma-constituent.🔽Form itself is the dharma-constituent.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid gzugs yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid gzugs yin no //
translated: The dharma-constituent itself is form.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar nyid chos kyi dbyings yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar nyid chos kyi dbyings yin la /
translated: Likewise, up to consciousness itself is the dharma-constituent.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid rnam par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid rnam par shes pa yin te /
translated: The dharma-constituent itself is consciousness.

original: phung po rnams kyi skabs su ji ltar bsgres pa de bzhin du skye mched rnams la'ang rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //🔽rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi skabs su ji ltar bsgres pa de bzhin du skye mched rnams la'ang rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o // rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Just as it is explained in the context of the aggregates, so it should be extensively applied to the sense-spheres.

original: chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos 'ga' zhig mthong na ni /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos 'ga' zhig mthong na ni /
translated: Subhūti, if bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom were to see any dharma not included in the dharma-constituent,

original: de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: they would not strive for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor / gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, it is because bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos 'ga' yang mi mthong ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos 'ga' yang mi mthong ste /
translated: do not see any phenomenon that is not included in the dharma-constituent.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings su shes na /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings su shes na /
translated: Therefore, when they know all phenomena as the dharma-constituent,🔽they know all phenomena to be without distinction.

original: chos thams cad @382b mid med pa la 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad @382b mid med pa la 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: This is form.

original: 'di ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshor ba'o //
translated: This is feeling.

original: 'di ni 'du shes so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'du shes so //
translated: This is perception.

original: 'di dag ni 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'du byed rnams so //
translated: These are volitional factors.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: This is consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein,

original: 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo zhes bya ba'i bar du ming gi brdas ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo zhes bya ba'i bar du ming gi brdas ston par byed do //
translated: this is unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: rab 'byor / dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dper na /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: an illusionist or

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis gzugs mthong ba 'ga' zhig kho na la byin gyis brlabs nas /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis gzugs mthong ba 'ga' zhig kho na la byin gyis brlabs nas /
translated: having empowered some people to see the forms,🔽in the presence of a large crowd of people

original: skye bo phal po che'i mdun du gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs /
analyzed: skye bo phal po che'i mdun du gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs /
translated: displays various forms,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: such as

original: skyes pa'i gzugs sam /
analyzed: skyes pa'i gzugs sam /
translated: the form of a man,

original: bud med kyi gzugs sam /
analyzed: bud med kyi gzugs sam /
translated: the form of a woman,

original: glang po che dang / rta dang / glang gi gzugs rnams sam /
analyzed: glang po che dang / rta dang / glang gi gzugs rnams sam /
translated: the forms of elephants, horses, and oxen,

original: skyed mos tshal nyams dga' ba'am /🔽chu klung nyams dga' ba'am /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal nyams dga' ba'am / chu klung nyams dga' ba'am /
translated: a delightful park,🔽a delightful river,

original: rdzing bu nyams dga' ba'am /🔽ljon shing nyams dga' ba sna tshogs bstan la /
analyzed: rdzing bu nyams dga' ba'am / ljon shing nyams dga' ba sna tshogs bstan la /
translated: a delightful pond,🔽and various delightful trees.

original: der yang gding ba rnam pa sna tshogs dag gam /
analyzed: der yang gding ba rnam pa sna tshogs dag gam /
translated: There he displays various kinds of bedding,

original: gos bgo ba dag kyang bstan /
analyzed: gos bgo ba dag kyang bstan /
translated: and also clothes to wear,

original: me tog phreng ba sna tshogs dag kyang bstan /
analyzed: me tog phreng ba sna tshogs dag kyang bstan /
translated: and also various kinds of flower garlands,

original: bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / myang ba dang / zan dang / btung ba rnam pa sna tshogs dag kyang bstan /
analyzed: bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / myang ba dang / zan dang / btung ba rnam pa sna tshogs dag kyang bstan /
translated: and also various kinds of food and drink, and solid and semisolid foods.

original: glu dbyangs dang / rol mo'i sgra mang bos skye bo phal bo che da mngon par dga' bar byed cing /
analyzed: glu dbyangs dang / rol mo'i sgra mang bos skye bo phal bo che da mngon par dga' bar byed cing /
translated: He teaches the Dharma to many hundreds of thousands of beings with the sound of his voice, with song and music, and he delights the great multitudes.

original: bdag nyid sbyin pa sbyin par byed bar bstan tam /
analyzed: bdag nyid sbyin pa sbyin par byed bar bstan tam /
translated: He teaches that he himself gives gifts.

original: tshul khrims srung ba'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims srung ba'am /
translated: He teaches that he himself guards morality.

original: bzod pa sgom pa'am /
analyzed: bzod pa sgom pa'am /
translated: He teaches that he himself cultivates patience.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom ba'am /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom ba'am /
translated: He teaches that he himself makes an effort in perseverance.

original: bsam gtan dag la snyoms par 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan dag la snyoms par 'jug pa'am /
translated: He teaches that he himself becomes absorbed in meditative stabilization.

original: bdag nyid shes rab sgom par @383a *//🔽yang bstan la /
analyzed: bdag nyid shes rab sgom par @383a *// yang bstan la /
translated: He teaches that he himself cultivates wisdom.

original: yang de rnam pa de dag gis rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag tu skye bar yang bstan /
analyzed: yang de rnam pa de dag gis rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag tu skye bar yang bstan /
translated: He teaches that by those aspects he will be reborn among the royal class that is like a great sāla tree.

original: de bzhin du bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag tu skye ba dang / khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag tu skye ba'ang bstan tam /
analyzed: de bzhin du bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag tu skye ba dang / khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag tu skye ba'ang bstan tam /
translated: He teaches that he will be reborn among the brahmin class that is like a great sāla tree, and he teaches that he will be reborn among the householder class that is like a great sāla tree.

original: de bzhin du rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar yang bstan /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar yang bstan /
translated: He teaches that he will be reborn among the Cāturmahārājika gods.

original: de bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar yang bstan tam /
analyzed: de bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar yang bstan tam /
translated: Similarly, he manifests birth among the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma Heaven, the Heaven of Joy, the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, and the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations.

original: de bzhin du tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar yang bstan /🔽bdag nyid nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'ang bstan tam /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar yang bstan / bdag nyid nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'ang bstan tam /
translated: He manifests birth in the world of Brahmā.🔽He manifests going to the station of infinite space.

original: bdag nyid 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar du nye bar 'gro bar yang bstan tam /
analyzed: bdag nyid 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar du nye bar 'gro bar yang bstan tam /
translated: He manifests going to the station of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de bzhin du bdag nyid rgyun du zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag nyid rgyun du zhugs pa'am /
translated: Similarly, he manifests as a stream enterer,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'am /
translated: a once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'am /
translated: a non-returner,

original: dgra bcom pa'am /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'am /
translated: a worthy one,

original: rang sangs rgyas su bstan tam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas su bstan tam /
translated: a pratyekabuddha,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: or a bodhisattva great being who has generated the mind of awakening for the first time,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang; bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol phyin pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang; bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol phyin pa dang /
translated: They are practicing the perfection of generosity, and similarly, the perfection of discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / de bzhin @383b dus dang po la spyod pa dang / sa bcu pa'i bar la spyod pa dang / de bzhin du mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub par byed pa dang / mngon par shes pa de dag gis rnam par rtsen cing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / de bzhin @383b dus dang po la spyod pa dang / sa bcu pa'i bar la spyod pa dang / de bzhin du mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub par byed pa dang / mngon par shes pa de dag gis rnam par rtsen cing /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom. They are practicing on the first level up to the tenth level, and similarly, they are accomplishing the superknowledges and are playing with those superknowledges.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byed pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dag gis rnam par rtsen par byed pa de dag dang bdag nyid 'dra bar yang bstan /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byed pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dag gis rnam par rtsen par byed pa de dag dang bdag nyid 'dra bar yang bstan /
translated: They illuminate the world, they bring sentient beings to full maturity, they purify the buddhafields, and they play with the dhyānas, liberations, samādhis, and samāpattis.

original: de bzhin du bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po thob pa dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po thob pa dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang ldan pa dang /
translated: In the same way, they are like me in having attained the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis lus legs par brgyan pa dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus lus gsal bar byas par bstan na de na skyes pa dang / bud med dang / khye'u dang / bu mo byis pa so so'i skye bo'i rang bzhin can de dag ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis lus legs par brgyan pa dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus lus gsal bar byas par bstan na de na skyes pa dang / bud med dang / khye'u dang / bu mo byis pa so so'i skye bo'i rang bzhin can de dag ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: If he were to teach with his body well adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being and his body illuminated with the eighty minor marks, then the men, women, boys, and girls there, who are ordinary childish beings by nature, would think this:

original: kye ma mi 'di ji tsam du 'di ltar bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi bar du'ang bstan te /
analyzed: kye ma mi 'di ji tsam du 'di ltar bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi bar du'ang bstan te /
translated: “Oh my! This man has shown himself to be like the Tathāgata in form.

original: mig tu sdug cing snying dga' bar byed pa'i gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs bstan pa dag gis skye bo 'di dag dga' bar byed pa ni legs par bslabs pa yin zhing /
analyzed: mig tu sdug cing snying dga' bar byed pa'i gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs bstan pa dag gis skye bo 'di dag dga' bar byed pa ni legs par bslabs pa yin zhing /
translated: He has delighted these people by showing them various forms that are pleasing to the eye and gladden the heart. He is well trained.

original: bya ba @384a *//
analyzed: bya ba @384a *//
translated: He does

original: mdzes pa dag byed do snyam mo //
analyzed: mdzes pa dag byed do snyam mo //
translated: beautiful things.”

original: de nas skyes pa dang / bud med dang / khye'u dang / bu mo mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can shes nyen can rtog ge dang spyod par ldan pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas skyes pa dang / bud med dang / khye'u dang / bu mo mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can shes nyen can rtog ge dang spyod par ldan pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then, those who are wise, who are skilled, who are discerning, who are learned, whether they are men or women, boys or girls, they think like this:

original: 'di ltar sgyu ma'i las 'di la chos 'ga' yang dmigs su med na /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgyu ma'i las 'di la chos 'ga' yang dmigs su med na /
translated: “In this way, in this illusory activity, no phenomenon is apprehended at all.

original: mi 'di yod pa ma yin pa mig dang / yid rmongs par byed pa'i chos 'di dag gis skye bo 'di dag dga' bar byed pa dang / byis pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sems can 'di dag yod pa ma yin pa la sems can du 'du shes shing /
analyzed: mi 'di yod pa ma yin pa mig dang / yid rmongs par byed pa'i chos 'di dag gis skye bo 'di dag dga' bar byed pa dang / byis pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sems can 'di dag yod pa ma yin pa la sems can du 'du shes shing /
translated: These things that cause delusion of the eye and the mind of this man, by these things, he delights this crowd. And these sentient beings who are of childish nature, they have the notion of a sentient being with regard to what is not a sentient being.

original: rdzes med pa la rdzas su 'du shes pa ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: rdzes med pa la rdzas su 'du shes pa ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin no snyam mo //
translated: They have the notion of a substance with regard to what is not a substance. This is a marvelous and wonderful phenomenon.”

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gang yang mi dmigs la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gang yang mi dmigs la /
translated: There are no phenomena that are not included in the realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos ni gang yang mi mthong ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos ni gang yang mi mthong ste /
translated: There are no phenomena that are not seen as included in the realm of phenomena.

original: sems can dang sems can du gdags pa'ang mi dmigs mod kyi /
analyzed: sems can dang sems can du gdags pa'ang mi dmigs mod kyi /
translated: Although sentient beings and the designation of sentient beings are not apprehended,

original: thabs la mkhas pas bdag kyang sbyin pa sbyin par byed la /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas bdag kyang sbyin pa sbyin par byed la /
translated: they are skilled in means and give gifts themselves.

original: gzhan dag kyang sbyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang sbyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
translated: They also encourage others to take up generosity.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan gyi bar dang / gzhan dag kyang shes rab sgom pa'i bar du yang dag par 'dzin @384b du 'jug cing shes rab kyi bsngags pa'ang brjod la /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan gyi bar dang / gzhan dag kyang shes rab sgom pa'i bar du yang dag par 'dzin @384b du 'jug cing shes rab kyi bsngags pa'ang brjod la /
translated: Similarly, they encourage others to take up morality, patience, diligence, and concentration, up to and encourage others to cultivate wisdom, and they praise wisdom.

original: gzhan gang dag sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi bar du sgom pa de dag gi bsngags pa'ang brjod cing rjes su dga' bar yang byed de /
analyzed: gzhan gang dag sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi bar du sgom pa de dag gi bsngags pa'ang brjod cing rjes su dga' bar yang byed de /
translated: and they also praise and rejoice in others who cultivate generosity, moral discipline, patience, perseverance, meditative concentration, and wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that

original: thabs la mkhas pas bdag la phan pa dang gzhan la phan par byed pa la skyo bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas bdag la phan pa dang gzhan la phan par byed pa la skyo bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: are not discouraged in benefiting themselves and others through skill in means.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs su ji ltar bsgres pa bzhin du chos thams cad kyi ba la'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs su ji ltar bsgres pa bzhin du chos thams cad kyi ba la'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: As explained in the section on the perfections, this should be applied in the same way to all phenomena.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
translated: if all phenomena are empty by nature,

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni sems can dang chos gang yang dmigs su ma mchis na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni sems can dang chos gang yang dmigs su ma mchis na /
translated: In emptiness, no sentient beings and no phenomena are apprehended.

original: 'o na de lta na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
translated: If that is so, then how do bodhisattva great beings, standing in the perfection of wisdom,🔽strive for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of all sentient beings?”🔽The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him, “Lord, if all phenomena are empty of all phenomena,🔽how can bodhisattva great beings, standing in the perfection of wisdom,

original: ji ltar sems can thams cad kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar sems can thams cad kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer ba lags /
translated: strive for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of all sentient beings?”🔽The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him, “Lord, if all phenomena are empty of all phenomena,

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: how can bodhisattva great beings, standing in the perfection of wisdom,🔽strive for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of all sentient beings?”🔽The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him, “Lord, if all phenomena are empty of all phenomena,🔽how can bodhisattva great beings, standing in the perfection of wisdom,🔽strive for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of all sentient beings?”🔽The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him, “Lord, if all phenomena are empty of all phenomena,🔽how can bodhisattva great beings, standing in the perfection of wisdom,🔽strive for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of all sentient beings?”🔽The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him, “Lord, if all phenomena are empty of all phenomena,

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /🔽chos thams cad @385a *//
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te / chos thams cad @385a *//
translated: how can bodhisattva great beings, standing in the perfection of wisdom,🔽strive for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of all sentient beings?”

original: ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him, “Lord, if all phenomena are empty of all phenomena,🔽how can bodhisattva great beings, standing in the perfection of wisdom,

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni sems can dang chos gang yang dmigs su med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni sems can dang chos gang yang dmigs su med do //
translated: strive for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of all sentient beings?”🔽The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him, “Lord, if all phenomena are empty of all phenomena,

original: rab 'byor / gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa ma yin pa zhig tu gyur na ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa ma yin pa zhig tu gyur na ni /
translated: how can bodhisattva great beings, standing in the perfection of wisdom,🔽strive for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of all sentient beings?”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
translated: bodhisattva great beings would not stand in the perfection of wisdom

original: sems can rnams la chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par ston par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par ston par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: and teach all dharmas to be empty of their own essential nature to sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor / gang gi phyir chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang gi phyir chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa de'i phyir /
translated: Subhūti, it is because all dharmas are empty of their own essential nature

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la gnas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la gnas nas /
translated: that bodhisattva great beings, standing in the emptiness of their own essential nature,

original: sems can rnams la chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par ston to //
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par ston to //
translated: teach all dharmas to be empty of their own essential nature to sentient beings.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gang yin zhe na /
translated: “What is the emptiness of all dharmas?

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is this:

original: gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: Form is empty of its own essential nature.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: Similarly, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty of their own essential nature.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la gnas nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la gnas nas /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, abiding in the emptiness of inherent nature,

original: phung po lnga po 'di dag rang bzhin gyis stong par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: phung po lnga po 'di dag rang bzhin gyis stong par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: correctly knows that these five aggregates are empty of inherent nature.

original: de ltar rig nas kyang de kho na bzhin du sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: de ltar rig nas kyang de kho na bzhin du sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: Having known that, he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings in just that way.

original: de bzhin du skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams @385b bco brgyad rang bzhin gyis stong par rig nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams @385b bco brgyad rang bzhin gyis stong par rig nas /
translated: Similarly, having known that the twelve sense bases and the eighteen elements are empty of inherent nature,

original: de kho na bzhin du sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings in just that way.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du rig nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du rig nas /
translated: Similarly, having known that the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, and the four formless absorptions are the emptiness of inherent nature,

original: de kho na bzhin du sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings in just that way.

original: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum rang bzhin gyis stong par rig nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum rang bzhin gyis stong par rig nas /
translated: In the same way, having understood that the four establishments of mindfulness, up to the eightfold noble path, and the three gates of liberation are empty of nature,

original: de kho na bzhin du sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: they teach the Dharma to sentient beings in just that way.

original: de bzhin du rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang /
translated: In the same way, having understood that the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love,

original: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu rang bzhin gyis stong par rig nas /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu rang bzhin gyis stong par rig nas /
translated: great compassion, the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, the thirty-two major marks of a great being, and the eighty minor marks are empty of nature,

original: de kho na bzhin du sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: they teach the Dharma to sentient beings in just that way.

original: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba dang /
translated: Similarly, the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and the elimination of all afflictions and the latent tendencies that cause them to reoccur

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong par @386a *//
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong par @386a *//
translated: are known to be empty of a basic nature,

original: rig nas / de kho na bzhin du sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: rig nas / de kho na bzhin du sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: and they teach the Dharma to sentient beings in just that way.

original: rab 'byor / gal te nang stong pa nyid dngos po zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te nang stong pa nyid dngos po zhig yin na ni /
translated: Subhūti, if the emptiness of internal phenomena were a thing,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams la chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par chos ston par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams la chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par chos ston par mi 'gyur la /
translated: then bodhisattva great beings would not teach the Dharma to sentient beings that all phenomena are empty of a basic nature,

original: rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid bshig par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid bshig par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: and the emptiness of a basic nature would be destroyed.

original: de bzhin du phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang; mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang; mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: ultimate emptiness,🔽conditioned emptiness,🔽unconditioned emptiness,🔽the emptiness of beyond extremes,🔽the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end,🔽the emptiness of nonrepudiation,🔽the emptiness of inherent existence,🔽the emptiness of all phenomena,

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dngos po zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dngos po zhig yin na ni /
translated: and the emptiness of its own mark were things,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams la chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par chos ston par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams la chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par chos ston par mi 'gyur la /
translated: then the bodhisattva great beings would not teach the doctrine that all phenomena are empty of inherent existence to sentient beings.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid bshig par yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid bshig par yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: And the emptiness of inherent existence would be destroyed.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni nam du'ang 'jig par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni nam du'ang 'jig par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Emptiness of intrinsic nature never perishes.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: It is not permanent.

original: 'gro ba'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba'ang ma yin no //
translated: It does not go.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni yul na mi gnas /
analyzed: de ni yul na mi gnas /
translated: It does not exist in a place.

original: phyogs na'ang mi gnas te /
analyzed: phyogs na'ang mi gnas te /
translated: It does not exist in a direction.

original: de ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba @386b med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du'ang 'gro ba @386b med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not come from anywhere, and it does not go anywhere.

original: de ni chos rnams kyi chos gnas pa nyid yin te /🔽de la ni gsog pa'am /
analyzed: de ni chos rnams kyi chos gnas pa nyid yin te / de la ni gsog pa'am /
translated: That is the abiding nature of phenomena.

original: 'jig pa'am / 'phel ba'am /🔽'grib pa'am / skye ba'am /🔽'gag pa'am / kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig pa'am / 'phel ba'am / 'grib pa'am / skye ba'am / 'gag pa'am / kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: In it there is no increase or decrease,🔽no arising or ceasing,

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos gang yang med de /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos gang yang med de /
translated: no defilement or purification.

original: de ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: That is the intrinsic nature of phenomena.

original: rang bzhin de la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer bar byed mod kyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin de la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer bar byed mod kyi /
translated: The bodhisattva great beings who abide in that intrinsic nature do indeed strive for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: chos gang yang 'jug par mi mthong la /
analyzed: chos gang yang 'jug par mi mthong la /
