translated: He does not see any dharma that enters,

original: des chos thams cad zhugs pa med cing gnas pa med par mthong ste /
analyzed: des chos thams cad zhugs pa med cing gnas pa med par mthong ste /
translated: and he sees all dharmas as not entering and not remaining.

original: de nas chos rnams kyi chos gnas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de nas chos rnams kyi chos gnas pa nyid yin no //
translated: Then he sees the dharma-constituent of dharmas.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par mthong nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de las phyir mi ldog go /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par mthong nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de las phyir mi ldog go /
translated: see all dharmas as empty of an intrinsic nature and do not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar des rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid gang la bdag dang / sems can dang; skye ba po dang / gso ba po dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar des rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid gang la bdag dang / sems can dang; skye ba po dang / gso ba po dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang /
translated: Because they see that in emptiness of an intrinsic nature there is no self, no sentient being, no life-force, no creature, no human, no man, no one who is born, no one who is killed, no agent, and no experiencer.

original: tshor ba po dang / tshor bar byed pa po dang / shes pa po dang; mthong ba po dmigs su med pa dang / de bzhin du gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dmigs su med pa dang /🔽de bzhin @387a *//
analyzed: tshor ba po dang / tshor bar byed pa po dang / shes pa po dang; mthong ba po dmigs su med pa dang / de bzhin du gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dmigs su med pa dang / de bzhin @387a *//
translated: the one who feels, the one who causes feeling, the one who knows, and the one who sees are non-apprehensible, and similarly, form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are non-apprehensible,

original: du sbyar te /
analyzed: du sbyar te /
translated: and in the same way connect this with each, up to🔽the eighty minor marks are non-apprehensible.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar du dmigs su med par rgya cher sbyar bar bya ba'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de la gnas nas chos gang la'ang sgrib par mi mthong ste /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar du dmigs su med par rgya cher sbyar bar bya ba'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de la gnas nas chos gang la'ang sgrib par mi mthong ste /
translated: Dwelling in that emptiness of inherent existence, he does not see any dharma that is an obscuration.

original: des chos thams cad sgrib pa med par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des chos thams cad sgrib pa med par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he sees all dharmas as without obscurations.

original: rab 'byor / dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dper na /
translated: “Subhūti, it is just as, for example,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa'i mi rnams la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa'i mi rnams la /
translated: the Tathāgata has emanated people

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa dge slong ngam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa dge slong ngam /
translated: and the Tathāgata has emanated a monk,

original: dge slong ma'am /
analyzed: dge slong ma'am /
translated: or a nun,

original: dge bsnyen nam /
analyzed: dge bsnyen nam /
translated: or a layman,

original: dge bsnyen ma zhig gis bskal pa'am /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma zhig gis bskal pa'am /
translated: or a laywoman, who for an eon or

original: bskal pa las lhag par rgyun ma chad par chos bstan par gyur na /
analyzed: bskal pa las lhag par rgyun ma chad par chos bstan par gyur na /
translated: “Subhūti, if the Tathāgata were to teach the Dharma to those people for more than an eon,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think, Subhūti?

original: ci de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa'i mi de dag la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: ci de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa'i mi de dag la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: Would those people emanated by the Tathāgata have the good fortune to attain the fruit of entering the stream,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /🔽phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth,🔽the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa'i skal ba yod snyam mam /🔽gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa'i skal ba yod snyam mam / gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: or the fruit of arhatship?”

original: ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: ma mchis lags so //
translated: He replied, “No, they would not, Venerable Transcendent Victor.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag la dngos po ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: de dag la dngos po ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Because they do not exist.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: dngos po med pa'i chos rnams la 'bras bu 'thob par ji ltar 'gyur te /🔽rab 'byor / chos thams cad dngos po med pa la shes rab can su zhig /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i chos rnams la 'bras bu 'thob par ji ltar 'gyur te / rab 'byor / chos thams cad dngos po med pa la shes rab can su zhig /
translated: How could a nonexistent phenomenon attain a fruit?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, what wise person would say that all phenomena, which are nonexistent,🔽attain

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the fruit of entering the stream,🔽the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth,

original: lan @387b gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: lan @387b gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the result of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the result of non-returner,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
translated: arhatship,

original: rang byang chub nyid dam /
analyzed: rang byang chub nyid dam /
translated: individual enlightenment,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la mngon par zhen par byed /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la mngon par zhen par byed /
translated: or unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gzhan du na phyin ci log tu ltung ba'i skye dgu rnams phyin ci log med pa la 'dzud cing rab tu 'god par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan du na phyin ci log tu ltung ba'i skye dgu rnams phyin ci log med pa la 'dzud cing rab tu 'god par byed de /
translated: Otherwise, he or she would cause beings who have fallen into error to enter and be established in the absence of error.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir de'ang phyin ci log ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir de'ang phyin ci log ma yin no //
translated: But because there is no conceptualization, that is also not an error.

original: gang la phyin ci log med pa de la ni bdag med do //
analyzed: gang la phyin ci log med pa de la ni bdag med do //
translated: In that which is not an error, there is no self.

original: sems can med do //
analyzed: sems can med do //
translated: There are no sentient beings.

original: shes pa po dang mthong ba po'i bar du med do //
analyzed: shes pa po dang mthong ba po'i bar du med do //
translated: There is no one who knows and no one who sees.

original: de la ni gzugs med do //
analyzed: de la ni gzugs med do //
translated: There is no form.

original: tshor ba med do //
analyzed: tshor ba med do //
translated: There is no feeling.

original: 'du shes med do //
analyzed: 'du shes med do //
translated: There is no perception.

original: 'du byed rnams med do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams med do //
translated: There are no volitional factors.

original: rnam par shes pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med do //
translated: There is no consciousness.

original: gang la gzugs med cing tshor ba med pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'du byed rnams med pa dang / rnam par shes pa med pa de la bdag med pa nas /
analyzed: gang la gzugs med cing tshor ba med pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'du byed rnams med pa dang / rnam par shes pa med pa de la bdag med pa nas /
translated: perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is devoid of a self,

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar du med de /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar du med de /
translated: up to it is devoid of the eighty minor marks.

original: de ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is the emptiness of essential nature.

original: de la ni gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: de la ni gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattvas, abiding in this,

original: sems can rnams phyin ci log las rnam par grol bar byed de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams phyin ci log las rnam par grol bar byed de / 'di lta ste /
translated: liberate sentient beings from their errors.🔽They liberate sentient beings🔽from the notion of a sentient being where there is no sentient being,🔽and similarly from the notion of permanence,

original: sems can med pa la sems can du 'du shes pa dang / de bzhin du rtag par 'du shes pa dang / bde bar 'du shes pa dang / bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / sdug par 'du shes pa dang / de bzhin du gzugs dang /
analyzed: sems can med pa la sems can du 'du shes pa dang / de bzhin du rtag par 'du shes pa dang / bde bar 'du shes pa dang / bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / sdug par 'du shes pa dang / de bzhin du gzugs dang /
translated: the notion of happiness, the notion of a self, the notion of beauty, and similarly from the notions of form,

original: @388a *// tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang // 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes par 'du shes pa'i sems can rnams rnam par shes par 'du shes pa'i bar las rnam par grol bar byed do //
analyzed: @388a *// tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang // 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes par 'du shes pa'i sems can rnams rnam par shes par 'du shes pa'i bar las rnam par grol bar byed do //
translated: and who have the notion of consciousness from the notion of consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way, it should be applied

original: de zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i bar gyi chos rnams la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i bar gyi chos rnams la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: to all dharmas, up to and including those that are contaminated and those that are uncontaminated.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos gang dag yin pa /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos gang dag yin pa /
translated: “What are the uncontaminated dharmas?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:🔽the four applications of mindfulness,🔽the four right efforts,🔽the four legs of psychic power,🔽the five faculties,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang; 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang; 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: the five powers,🔽the seven factors of awakening,🔽the eightfold noble path,🔽the three gateways to liberation,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar de dag kyang don dam par 'dus ma byas ji lta ba de lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar de dag kyang don dam par 'dus ma byas ji lta ba de lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not ultimately unconditioned.

original: de ni ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa yin te /
translated: They are not produced and do not exist as entities.

original: de ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: They are empty of inherent nature.

original: de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub yin te /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub yin te /
translated: That is the awakening of the lord buddhas.

original: de la ni bdag med do //
analyzed: de la ni bdag med do //
translated: There is no self in that.

original: sems can med do //
analyzed: sems can med do //
translated: There is no sentient being.

original: shes pa po dang / mthong ba po'i bar du med do //
analyzed: shes pa po dang / mthong ba po'i bar du med do //
translated: There is no life-force, up to there is no knower and there is no seer.

original: gzugs med do //
analyzed: gzugs med do //
translated: There is no form.

original: tshor ba med do //
analyzed: tshor ba med do //
translated: There is no feeling.

original: 'du shes med do //
analyzed: 'du shes med do //
translated: There is no perception.

original: 'du byed rnams med do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams med do //
translated: There are no formative predispositions.

original: rnam par shes pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med do //
translated: There is no consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein,

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar du med do //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar du med do //
translated: there are no , up to and including the eighty minor marks.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems @388b dpa' chen po ni rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid kyi don ma gtogs par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam gyi ched du ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer bar mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems @388b dpa' chen po ni rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid kyi don ma gtogs par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam gyi ched du ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer bar mi byed do //
translated: Bodhisattva great beings do not strive for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of the path to complete awakening, except for the meaning of the emptiness of inherent nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus kyi mthar yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus kyi mthar yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: That emptiness of inherent nature is empty of inherent nature in the past, in the future, and in the middle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de la gnas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de la gnas nas /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings, standing in that emptiness of inherent nature,

original: sems can rnams kyi sems can du 'du shes pa dang / 'du shes thams cad las rab tu dgrol ba'i phyir lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems can du 'du shes pa dang / 'du shes thams cad las rab tu dgrol ba'i phyir lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod par byed do //
translated: practice the knowledge of path aspects in order to liberate the perceptions of sentient beings and all perceptions.

original: de lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod pa na /
analyzed: de lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod pa na /
translated: When they practice the knowledge of path aspects,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: nyan thos kyi lam dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam dang / lam thams cad la spyod do //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam dang / lam thams cad la spyod do //
translated: They practice the path of the śrāvakas, the path of the pratyekabuddhas, the path of complete buddhahood, and all paths.

original: des lam rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: des lam rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: They perfect the paths.

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byas /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byas /
translated: They bring sentient beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byas te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byas te /
translated: They purify a buddhafield.

original: de'i tshe 'du byed rnams byin gyis brlabs nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'du byed rnams byin gyis brlabs nas /
translated: Then, they bless conditioned things

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi tshul rgyun mi gcod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi tshul rgyun mi gcod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, they do not cut off the way of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi tshul de gang zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi tshul de gang zhe na /
translated: What is the way of the buddhas?

original: @389a *// 'di lta ste /
analyzed: @389a *// 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid 'di yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid 'di yin no //
translated: it is emptiness of inherent nature.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi chos kyi tshul yang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi chos kyi tshul yang /
translated: and the present buddhas

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: is this:

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid 'di nyid yin par gyur to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid 'di nyid yin par gyur to //
translated: the emptiness of inherent nature.🔽The Dharma way of the past buddhas,🔽the future buddhas,🔽and the present buddhas

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi tshul yang 'di nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi tshul yang 'di nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: is this:🔽the emptiness of inherent nature.🔽The Dharma way of the past buddhas,🔽the future buddhas,

original: da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bzhugs shing gzhes pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi chos kyi tshul yang /
analyzed: da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bzhugs shing gzhes pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi chos kyi tshul yang /
translated: and the present buddhas

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: is this:

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid 'di nyid yin te /
translated: the emptiness of inherent nature.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ma gtogs par 'jig rten du 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ma gtogs par 'jig rten du 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas do not appear in the world except in order to teach emptiness.

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings should practice the six perfections that are empty of inherent nature.

original: de ni byang chub kyi spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub kyi spyod pa yin no //
translated: That is the bodhisattva practice.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la spyod pa ni /
translated: The bodhisattva great beings who practice it

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: will not regress from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gsol pa / kye ma btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / kye ma btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Oh Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' @389b sems dpa' chen po dag de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la spyod kyang gzugs kyang gzhan /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' @389b sems dpa' chen po dag de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la spyod kyang gzugs kyang gzhan /
translated: the bodhisattva great beings practice all phenomena as empty of inherent nature, but form is one thing,

original: tshor ba'ang gzhan /
analyzed: tshor ba'ang gzhan /
translated: feeling is another,

original: 'du shes kyang gzhan /
analyzed: 'du shes kyang gzhan /
translated: perception is another,

original: 'du byed rnams kyang gzhan /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyang gzhan /
translated: volitional factors are another,

original: rnam par shes pa'ang gzhan zhing /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'ang gzhan zhing /
translated: consciousness is one thing,

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzhan /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzhan /
translated: and emptiness of intrinsic nature is another;

original: de bzhin du sbyar te sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du'ang gzhan /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du'ang gzhan /
translated: in the same vein, , up to and including the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, are one thing,🔽and emptiness of intrinsic nature is another;

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang gzhan du rang bzhin gyis stong nyid de /🔽rnam par 'khrug par yang mi bgyid la /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang gzhan du rang bzhin gyis stong nyid de / rnam par 'khrug par yang mi bgyid la /
translated: and unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment is one thing,🔽and emptiness of intrinsic nature is another.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lags la; bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub nyid rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid lags pa ni ngo mtshar lags so ////🔽'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lags la; bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub nyid rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid lags pa ni ngo mtshar lags so //// 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa /
translated: It is astonishing that emptiness of intrinsic nature is unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment, and that unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment is emptiness of intrinsic nature.🔽The Noble Mahāyāna Sūtra

original: bam po sum cu gcig pa /
analyzed: bam po sum cu gcig pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Ten Thousand Lines

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor gal te gzugs kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te gzugs kyang gzhan la /
translated: Subhūti, if form were one thing and

original: rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid kyang gzhan /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid kyang gzhan /
translated: intrinsic emptiness another,

original: de bzhin du tshor ba'ang gzhan /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba'ang gzhan /
translated: and likewise, if feeling were one thing,

original: 'du shes kyang gzhan /
analyzed: 'du shes kyang gzhan /
translated: perception were one thing,

original: 'du byed rnams kyang gzhan /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyang gzhan /
translated: volitional factors were one thing,

original: rnam par shes pa'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'ang gzhan la /
translated: and consciousness were one thing,

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzhan /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzhan /
translated: and intrinsic emptiness were another,

original: byang chub kyi bar du'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar du'ang gzhan la /
translated: and if awakening were one thing and

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzhan zhig yin par gyur na ni /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams @390a *//
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzhan zhig yin par gyur na ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams @390a *//
translated: intrinsic emptiness were another,

original: cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'chang rgya bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'chang rgya bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then bodhisattva great beings would not fully awaken to all dharmas through the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / gang gi phyir rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid gzugs yin zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang gi phyir rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid gzugs yin zhing /

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams yin la /

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid rnam par shes pa yin /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid rnam par shes pa yin /

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yin pa de'i phyir /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, practicing the perfection of wisdom,

translated: having understood that all phenomena are empty of inherent nature, fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid 'di la chos gang yang 'jig pa'ang med /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid 'di la chos gang yang 'jig pa'ang med /
translated: Because in this emptiness of inherent nature, no phenomenon is destroyed,

original: ther zug tu gnas pa'ang med /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa'ang med /
translated: does not endure permanently,

original: 'gro ba'ang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'ang med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: byis pa 'du shes sna tshogs can rnams ni gzugs kyang gzhan la /
translated: Childish beings, with their various perceptions, conceive of form as one thing

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzhan du yongs su rtog go /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzhan du yongs su rtog go /
translated: and the emptiness of inherent nature as another.

analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar du'ang gzhan la /
translated: Similarly, they conceive of consciousness as one thing🔽and the emptiness of inherent nature as another.

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzhan du yongs su rtog go /
translated: They imagine that emptiness of inherent nature is one thing, and that the perfection of wisdom is another.🔽In the same way, they imagine that the knowledge of all aspects is one thing, and that emptiness of inherent nature is another.

analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du'ang gzhan la /
translated: In the same way, they imagine that the knowledge of path aspects is one thing, and that emptiness of inherent nature is another.

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyang gzhan du yongs su rtog go / de @390b dag de ltar yongs su rtog par byed pas gzugs la mngon par zhen to //

analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mngon par zhen to; ;de dag gzugs la mngon par zhen cing /
translated: In the same way, they imagine that the knowledge of all aspects is one thing, and that emptiness of inherent nature is another.🔽In the same way, they imagine that the knowledge of path aspects is one thing, and that emptiness of inherent nature is another.🔽In the same way, they imagine that the knowledge of all aspects is one thing, and that emptiness of inherent nature is another.🔽In the same way, they imagine that the knowledge of path aspects is one thing, and that emptiness of inherent nature is another.🔽In the same way, they imagine that the knowledge of all aspects is one thing, and that emptiness of inherent nature is another.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mngon par zhen pas bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mngon par zhen pas bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa la spyod cing /
translated: In the same way, they imagine that the knowledge of path aspects is one thing, and that emptiness of inherent nature is another.🔽In the same way, they imagine that the knowledge of all aspects is one thing, and that emptiness of inherent nature is another.🔽In the same way, they imagine that the knowledge of path aspects is one thing, and that emptiness of inherent nature is another.

original: de la'ang mngon par zhen to //🔽mngon par zhen nas kyang yang gzugs skyed par byed cing /
analyzed: de la'ang mngon par zhen to //🔽mngon par zhen nas kyang yang gzugs skyed par byed cing /
translated: In the same way,

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa skyed par byed do /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa skyed par byed do /
translated: Likewise, it does not liberate from the production of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: de dag ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las yongs su mi 'grol /

translated: It does not liberate from birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and agitation.

original: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba'i 'khor lo las yongs su mi thar ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba'i 'khor lo las yongs su mi thar ro //
translated: It does not liberate from the wheel of the five forms of life.

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /🔽gzugs stong ngam /
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni / gzugs stong ngam /
translated: Therefore, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom🔽do not accept or hold the view that form is empty

original: 'on te mi stong zhes bya bar khas mi len cing nye bar mi len la /
analyzed: 'on te mi stong zhes bya bar khas mi len cing nye bar mi len la /
translated: or that it is not empty.

original: rnam par 'khrug par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: rnam par 'khrug par yang mi byed do //
translated: They do not get agitated.🔽Likewise, they do not accept or hold the view that feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong ngam /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong ngam /
translated: or that they are not empty.

original: 'on te mi stong zhes bya bar khas mi len cing nye bar mi len la /🔽rnam par 'khrug par yang mi @391a *//
analyzed: 'on te mi stong zhes bya bar khas mi len cing nye bar mi len la / rnam par 'khrug par yang mi @391a *//
translated: He does not assert, does not take up, and does not quarrel with the idea🔽that “form is empty” or “form is not empty.”

original: byed do // de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽byang chub kyi bar du stong ngam /
analyzed: byed do // de bzhin du sbyar te / byang chub kyi bar du stong ngam /
translated: In the same way, he does not assert, does not take up, and does not quarrel with the idea

original: 'on te mi stong zhes bya bar khas mi len cing nye bar mi len la /🔽rnam par 'khrug par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: 'on te mi stong zhes bya bar khas mi len cing nye bar mi len la / rnam par 'khrug par yang mi byed do //
translated: that “up to and including awakening is empty” or “up to and including awakening is not empty.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: stong pa nyid ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: Because emptiness

original: 'di ni gzugs so //🔽'di ni rnam par shes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs so // 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i bar ro //
translated: is not form,🔽and form is not other than emptiness.🔽Form is itself emptiness, and emptiness itself is form.

original: 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar yin no zhes gzugs rnam par 'khrug par yang mi byed do //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par 'khrug par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar yin no zhes gzugs rnam par 'khrug par yang mi byed do // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par 'khrug par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Emptiness is not other than form, and form is not other than emptiness.

original: rab 'byor / dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dper na /
translated: In the same way, he does not quarrel with the idea that “feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty” or “feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not empty.”

original: nam mkhas ni nam mkha' rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed de /
analyzed: nam mkhas ni nam mkha' rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed de /
translated: Subhūti, space does not quarrel with space.

original: nang gi nam mkha'i khams kyis kyang phyi rol gyi nam mkha'i khams rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed la /
analyzed: nang gi nam mkha'i khams kyis kyang phyi rol gyi nam mkha'i khams rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed la /
translated: The internal space element does not disturb the external space element.

original: phyi rol kyi nam mkha'i khams kyis kyang nang gi nam mkha'i khams rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do //
analyzed: phyi rol kyi nam mkha'i khams kyis kyang nang gi nam mkha'i khams rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do //
translated: The external space element does not disturb the internal space element.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du gzugs kyis kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du gzugs kyis kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed la /
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, form does not disturb emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid kyis kyang gzugs rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis kyang gzugs rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do //
translated: and emptiness does not disturb form.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar gyis kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar gyis kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed la /
translated: In the same way, consciousness does not disturb emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid kyis kyang rnam par shes pa rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis kyang rnam par shes pa rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do //
translated: and emptiness does not disturb consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽byang chub kyi bar gyis kyang stong pa nyid @391b rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te / byang chub kyi bar gyis kyang stong pa nyid @391b rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed la /
translated: In the same way, connect this with each, up to🔽awakening does not disturb emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid kyis kyang byang chub rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis kyang byang chub rnam par 'khrugs par mi byed do //
translated: and emptiness does not disturb awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar chos de dag la 'di ni stong ngo //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar chos de dag la 'di ni stong ngo //
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ni mi stong ngo snyam du rnam par rtog par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni mi stong ngo snyam du rnam par rtog par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those phenomena do not have the nature of being conceptualized as ‘this is empty’ or ‘this is not empty.’

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Ten Thousand Lines,

original: rang bzhin gyi le'u zhes bya ste sum cu pa'o ////
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi le'u zhes bya ste sum cu pa'o ////
translated: this is chapter thirty, “Nature.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Reverend Lord!

original: de ltar chos kyi mtshan nyid legs par rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa lags sam /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi mtshan nyid legs par rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa lags sam /
translated: Are bodhisattva great beings who have well understood the characteristics of phenomena irreversible?”

original: rab 'byor / yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, they are.”

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He then said, “Reverend Lord!

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam pa ni gang dag lags /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam pa ni gang dag lags /
translated: What are the aspects of irreversible bodhisattva great beings?

original: rtags ni gang dag lags /🔽mtshan ma ni gang dag lags /
analyzed: rtags ni gang dag lags /🔽mtshan ma ni gang dag lags /
translated: What are their signs?🔽What are their indications?”

original: bdag cag gis ji ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lags par 'tshal bar bgyi lags /
analyzed: bdag cag gis ji ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lags par 'tshal bar bgyi lags /
translated: How should we know a bodhisattva great being to be irreversible?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽rab 'byor / 'di la byis pa so so'i skye bo'i sa gang yin pa dang / nyan thos kyi sa gang yin pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa gang yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs @392a *//
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // rab 'byor / 'di la byis pa so so'i skye bo'i sa gang yin pa dang / nyan thos kyi sa gang yin pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa gang yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs @392a *//
translated: The Lord replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: pa'i sa gang yin pa'i sa bshad pa de dag thams cad ni chos kyi de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: pa'i sa gang yin pa'i sa bshad pa de dag thams cad ni chos kyi de bzhin nyid de /
translated: “Su­bhūti, the levels that have been explained, namely, the level of the śrāvakas, the level of the pratyekabuddhas, the level of the bodhisattvas, and the level of the tathāgatas, are all the suchness of phenomena.

original: 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med la /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med la /
translated: They are unchanging and non-conceptual.

original: gnyis su med de gnyis su dbyer med do //
analyzed: gnyis su med de gnyis su dbyer med do //
translated: They are non-dual and indivisible.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The suchness of those bodhisattva great beings

original: chos kyi de bzhin nyid de la 'jug par byed la /
analyzed: chos kyi de bzhin nyid de la 'jug par byed la /
translated: is the suchness of phenomena.

original: de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de /
translated: That suchness

original: chos kyi de bzhin nyid la mi rtog ste /
analyzed: chos kyi de bzhin nyid la mi rtog ste /
translated: is not conceptualized in the suchness of phenomena.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa kho na'i tshul gyis de bzhin nyid la 'jug go /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa kho na'i tshul gyis de bzhin nyid la 'jug go /
translated: One enters suchness by way of the sole method of nonconceptuality.

original: de zhugs nas kyang de'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de shes nas /
analyzed: de zhugs nas kyang de'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de shes nas /
translated: Having entered it, one knows that suchness of that.

original: de bor te 'di ni chos kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin no snyam du chos gang la'ang the tshom mi za zhing /
analyzed: de bor te 'di ni chos kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin no snyam du chos gang la'ang the tshom mi za zhing /
translated: One does not doubt any phenomenon, thinking, ‘This is not the suchness of phenomena.’

original: de bzhin nyid 'di ni gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid 'di ni gcig kho na ste /
translated: This suchness is one alone.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: chos thams cad kyi dbyings dang / chos skyon med pa nyid do snyam mo //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi dbyings dang / chos skyon med pa nyid do snyam mo //
translated: The realm of all phenomena and the faultlessness of phenomena.

original: de ni byung rgyal du smra ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni byung rgyal du smra ba ma yin te /
translated: One does not speak in a way that is not deliberate.

original: tshig don dang ldan pa kho nar smra'i /
analyzed: tshig don dang ldan pa kho nar smra'i /
translated: One speaks only in a way that is meaningful.

original: don dang mi ldan par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dang mi ldan par ni ma yin no //
translated: One does not speak in a way that is not meaningful.

original: gzhan gyis byas pa dang ma byas pa la mi blta zhing /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa dang ma byas pa la mi blta zhing /
translated: One does not look to others to see if they have done or not done something.

original: legs par gsungs pa tshol ba yin te /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa tshol ba yin te /
translated: One seeks what is well spoken.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir ldog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir ldog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, you should know that bodhisattva great beings who have those aspects, those attributes, and those signs are irreversible.🔽Subhūti then asked,

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan pa gang dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir @392b mi ldog par ston lags /
analyzed: rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan pa gang dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir @392b mi ldog par ston lags /
translated: by what aspects, what attributes, and what signs are bodhisattva great beings shown to be irreversible?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni rnam pa med pa /🔽rtags med pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni rnam pa med pa / rtags med pa /
translated: “Subhūti, all phenomena are without aspects,🔽without attributes,

original: mtshan ma med pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa yin no //
translated: and without signs.

original: gsol pa / gal te chos thams cad rnam pa ma mchis pa /🔽rtags ma mchis pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / gal te chos thams cad rnam pa ma mchis pa / rtags ma mchis pa /
translated: If all phenomena are without aspects,🔽without attributes,

original: mtshan ma ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: mtshan ma ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: and without signs,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gang dag las phyir ldog na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gang dag las phyir ldog na /
translated: from what phenomena do bodhisattva great beings turn away

original: phyir mi ldog par ston lags /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par ston lags /
translated: so that they are shown to be irreversible?”🔽The Lord said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs las phyir ldog pa yin zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs las phyir ldog pa yin zhing /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings turn away from form,

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa las phyir ldog pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa las phyir ldog pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: and similarly turn away from feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, at that time bodhisattva great beings are shown to be irreversible.

original: rab 'byor; gzhan yang gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po so so'i skye bo'i sa las phyir ldog pa dang / nyan thos kyi sa las phyir ldog pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las phyir ldog pa de'i tshe phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor; gzhan yang gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po so so'i skye bo'i sa las phyir ldog pa dang / nyan thos kyi sa las phyir ldog pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las phyir ldog pa de'i tshe phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings turn away from the level of ordinary persons, turn away from the śrāvaka level, and turn away from the pratyekabuddha level, at that time they are shown to be irreversible.”

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las phyir mi ldog pa dang / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar las phyir mi ldog pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las phyir mi ldog pa dang / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar las phyir mi ldog pa dang /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, when a bodhisattva great being does not turn back from the perfection of giving, and similarly does not turn back from the perfection of wisdom,

original: nang stong pa nyid las phyir mi ldog pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi ba @393a *//
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid las phyir mi ldog pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi ba @393a *//
translated: and does not turn back from inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: las phyir mi ldog pa dang / de bzhin du sbyar te sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar las phyir mi ldog pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: las phyir mi ldog pa dang / de bzhin du sbyar te sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar las phyir mi ldog pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: and similarly, connect this with each, up to does not turn back from the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, at that time the bodhisattva great being is shown to be irreversible.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dge sbyong dang bram ze 'di dag ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dge sbyong dang bram ze 'di dag ni /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being does not think, ‘These ascetics and brahmins

original: shes par bya ba shes shing mthong bar bya ba mthong ba'am /
analyzed: shes par bya ba shes shing mthong bar bya ba mthong ba'am /
translated: know what is to be known and see what is to be seen,

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba 'dogs par byed pa'o zhes 'di las phyi rol pa'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze dag gi ngor lta ba de ni gnas med de /🔽legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la the tshom skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba 'dogs par byed pa'o zhes 'di las phyi rol pa'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze dag gi ngor lta ba de ni gnas med de / legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la the tshom skyed par mi byed de /
translated: The right view is the basis for the designation of a true spiritual practitioner.🔽He does not generate doubt about the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin par gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin par gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: He does not hold morality and ritual as paramount.

original: lta ba ngan par mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: lta ba ngan par mi ltung ngo //
translated: He does not fall into bad views.

original: dge mtshan dang bkra shis la dag par mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: dge mtshan dang bkra shis la dag par mi 'dzin to //
translated: He does not hold as pure what is impure.

original: lha gzhan dag la phyag 'tshal bar mi byed cing /🔽me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / mar me dang / bdug pa dang / phye ma dang / gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dag de dag la sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: lha gzhan dag la phyag 'tshal bar mi byed cing / me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / mar me dang / bdug pa dang / phye ma dang / gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dag de dag la sbyin pa'am /
translated: He does not bow down to other deities.

original: bya bar mi sems pa ste /
analyzed: bya bar mi sems pa ste /
translated: He does not think about giving to them flowers, garlands, incense, ointments, lamps, incense for burning, powders, clothing, parasols, victory banners, or flags.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rigs dman pa dang rigs ngan du mi skye ste /🔽'di lta ste /🔽gdol pa'i rigs rnams sam /🔽g-yung @393b po'i rigs rnams sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rigs dman pa dang rigs ngan du mi skye ste / 'di lta ste / gdol pa'i rigs rnams sam / g-yung @393b po'i rigs rnams sam /
translated: Subhuti, a Bodhisattva-mahāsattva who has these attributes, indications, and signs will not be born into a low-caste family or a poor family.🔽He will not be born into a family of outcasts,🔽or into a family of bamboo workers,

original: smyig ma mkhan gyi rigs rnams sam /
analyzed: smyig ma mkhan gyi rigs rnams sam /
translated: or into a family of carriage makers,

original: de las gzhan pa'i rigs ngan rnams sam /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rigs ngan rnams sam /
translated: or into any other low-caste family,

original: mi khom pa brgyad bo dag gi bar rnams su mi skye /
analyzed: mi khom pa brgyad bo dag gi bar rnams su mi skye /
translated: or into any of the eight difficult situations.

original: bud med kyi dngos po yongs su mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: bud med kyi dngos po yongs su mi 'dzin te /
translated: He will not take on a female body.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: Subhuti, a Bodhisattva-mahāsattva who has these attributes, indications, and signs is revealed to be irreversible.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs nas gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs nas gnas te /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhuti, an irreversible Bodhisattva-mahāsattva who has taken up the ten wholesome courses of action will abide in them.

original: de bdag gis kyang srog gcod pa spangs shing /
analyzed: de bdag gis kyang srog gcod pa spangs shing /
translated: They themselves give up killing.

original: gzhan dag kyang srog gcod pa spong ba sgrub pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang srog gcod pa spong ba sgrub pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa yin /
translated: They encourage others to take up the practice of giving up killing.

original: srog gcod pa spong ba sgrub pa'i bsngags pa'ang brjod pa yin /
analyzed: srog gcod pa spong ba sgrub pa'i bsngags pa'ang brjod pa yin /
translated: They speak in praise of the practice of giving up killing.

original: gzhan gang dag srog gcod pa spangs pa de dag gis bsngags pa'ang brjod cing rjes su dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gang dag srog gcod pa spangs pa de dag gis bsngags pa'ang brjod cing rjes su dga' bar byed do //
translated: They speak in praise of others who have given up killing, welcoming it.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way,

original: bdag gis kyang log par lta ba'i bar du spangs shing /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang log par lta ba'i bar du spangs shing /
translated: they themselves give up … wrong views.

original: gzhan dag kyang log par lta ba spong ba sgrub pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang log par lta ba spong ba sgrub pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa yin /
translated: They encourage others to take up the practice of giving up wrong views.

original: log par lta ba spong ba bsgrub pa'i bsngags pa'ang brjod pa yin /
analyzed: log par lta ba spong ba bsgrub pa'i bsngags pa'ang brjod pa yin /
translated: They speak in praise of the practice of giving up wrong views.

original: gzhan gang dag log par lta ba spangs pa de dag gi bsngags pa'ang brjod cing rjes su dga' bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gang dag log par lta ba spangs pa de dag gi bsngags pa'ang brjod cing rjes su dga' bar byed pa yin te /
translated: They speak in praise of others who have given up wrong views, welcoming it.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi @394a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi @394a *//
translated: Subhuti : Endowed with which attributes, tokens and signs should a Bodhisattva be endowed who wants to fully know the supreme enlightenment?🔽The Lord: Endowed with the attributes, tokens and signs of a Streamwinner, etc. to : of a fully enlightened Buddha should a Bodhisattva be endowed who wants to fully know the supreme enlightenment.

original: ldog par ston to //
analyzed: ldog par ston to //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings endowed with those aspects, those attributes, and those signs are revealed to be irreversible.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rmi lam na'ang mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam kun tu mi spyod na sad pa na lta ci smos te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rmi lam na'ang mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam kun tu mi spyod na sad pa na lta ci smos te /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who are irreversible do not engage in the ten unwholesome actions even in dreams, let alone when awake.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings endowed with those aspects, those attributes, and those signs are revealed to be irreversible.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rtag tu sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rtag tu sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who are irreversible always abide in the perfection of generosity,

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rtag tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rtag tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, they always abide in the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: sbyin pa de'ang sems can thams cad kyi ched du sgom la /
analyzed: sbyin pa de'ang sems can thams cad kyi ched du sgom la /
translated: They cultivate generosity for the sake of all sentient beings,

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sgom te /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sgom te /
translated: and they cultivate it in a way that is free from apprehending anything.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang; mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang; mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings endowed with those aspects, those attributes, and those signs are shown to be irreversible.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos kyi rnam grangs kyi chos kyi sbyin pa sbyin pa na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos kyi rnam grangs kyi chos kyi sbyin pa sbyin pa na /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings give the gift of the Dharma, a gift of the Dharma that is a Dharma discourse,

original: 'di snyam du chos kyi sbyin pa 'dis sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig @394b snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: 'di snyam du chos kyi sbyin pa 'dis sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig @394b snyam du bsams nas /
translated: He thinks, ‘By this gift of Dharma may the wishes of all sentient beings be fulfilled.’

original: des chos kyi sbyin pa de sems can thams cad dang lhan cig thun mong du byas nas /
analyzed: des chos kyi sbyin pa de sems can thams cad dang lhan cig thun mong du byas nas /
translated: He makes that gift of Dharma common to all sentient beings,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed la; de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsngo bar byed de /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed la; de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsngo bar byed de /
translated: and dedicates it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and he does so without apprehending anything.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings endowed with those attributes, those tokens, and those signs are irreversible.”

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos zab mo rnams la som nyi dang / yid gnyis dang / the tshom med do /🔽gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos zab mo rnams la som nyi dang / yid gnyis dang / the tshom med do /🔽gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, irreversible bodhisattva great beings have no doubt, uncertainty, or skepticism about the profound dharmas.”🔽“Lord, how do bodhisattva great beings have no doubt, uncertainty, or skepticism about the profound dharmas?”

original: ci'i slad du phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos zab mo rnams la som nyi dang / yid gnyis dang / the tshom ma mchis pa lags /
analyzed: ci'i slad du phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos zab mo rnams la som nyi dang / yid gnyis dang / the tshom ma mchis pa lags /
translated: Why do irreversible bodhisattva great beings not have doubts, uncertainty, or skepticism about the profound dharmas?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,🔽“Su­bhūti, those irreversible bodhisattva great beings do not consider any dharma whatsoever that might cause them to have doubts, uncertainty, or skepticism.

original: rab 'byor / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des ni gang la de so ma nyi dang / yid gnyis dang; the tshom za bar 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des ni gang la de so ma nyi dang / yid gnyis dang; the tshom za bar 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: They do not consider,🔽form,

original: gzugs sam / tshor ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs sam / tshor ba'am /
translated: or feeling,

original: 'du shes sam /
analyzed: 'du shes sam /
translated: or perception,🔽or formative predispositions,

original: 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'am /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'am /
translated: or consciousness,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and in the same vein,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: they do not consider , up to and including unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems @395a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems @395a *//
translated: Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings who possess these attributes, indications, and signs are indeed irreversible.”

original: dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: a great being, is shown to be irreversible.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni lus kyi las 'jam pa dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni lus kyi las 'jam pa dang ldan pa yin /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, an irreversible bodhisattva great being has a gentle physical action,

original: ngag gi las 'jam pa dang / yid kyi las 'jam pa dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: ngag gi las 'jam pa dang / yid kyi las 'jam pa dang ldan pa yin /
translated: has a gentle verbal action, and has a gentle mental action.

original: sems can thams cad la'ang zhe 'gras pa'i sems med pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la'ang zhe 'gras pa'i sems med pa yin te /
translated: He has no angry thoughts toward any sentient being.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being who has those attributes, those tokens, and those signs is shown to be irreversible.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rtag tu byams pa'i lus kyi las dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rtag tu byams pa'i lus kyi las dang ldan pa yin /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, an irreversible bodhisattva great being is always endowed with a loving physical action,

original: de bzhin du byams pa'i ngag gi las dang / byams pa'i yid kyi las dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du byams pa'i ngag gi las dang / byams pa'i yid kyi las dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: and similarly, is endowed with a loving verbal action and a loving mental action.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva mahāsattvas endowed with those aspects, those marks, and that indication are revealed to be irreversible.

original: rab 'byor; gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sgrib pa lnga dang lhan cig mi gnas so //
analyzed: rab 'byor; gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sgrib pa lnga dang lhan cig mi gnas so //
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattvas do not dwell together with the five hindrances.🔽What are the five?

original: lnga po dag gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: lnga po dag gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom dang lhan cig mi gnas te /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom dang lhan cig mi gnas te /
translated: sensual desire, malice, lethargy and sleep, excitation and regret, and doubt.🔽Subhūti, bodhisattva mahāsattvas endowed with those aspects, those marks, and that indication are revealed to be irreversible.”

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan med @395b dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan med @395b dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattvas do not dwell together with the five obscurations.🔽What are the five?🔽They are🔽the obscuration of the afflictions, the obscuration of the actions, the obscuration of the results, the obscuration of the training, and the obscuration of the knowable.🔽Subhūti, irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattvas do not dwell together with those five obscurations.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la ni bag la nyal thams cad kyi thams cad du med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la ni bag la nyal thams cad kyi thams cad du med de /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being who is irreversible does not have any latent tendencies at all.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being who has those attributes, indications, and signs is revealed to be irreversible.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'gro'am ldog kyang rung /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'gro'am ldog kyang rung /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being who is irreversible, whether going or returning,

original: 'khrul pa'i sems kyis 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i sems kyis 'gro ba'am /
translated: does not go or return with a confused mind.

original: ldog par mi byed kyi; de 'gro'am ldog na'ang dran pha nye bar bzhag bzhin du 'gro'am /🔽ldog par byed de /
analyzed: ldog par mi byed kyi; de 'gro'am ldog na'ang dran pha nye bar bzhag bzhin du 'gro'am / ldog par byed de /
translated: Whether going or returning, he goes or returns with mindfulness present.

original: dran bzhin kho nar 'gro'am ldog par byed do //
analyzed: dran bzhin kho nar 'gro'am ldog par byed do //
translated: He goes or returns with mindfulness alone.

original: dran pa bzhin kho nar 'chag pa'am /
analyzed: dran pa bzhin kho nar 'chag pa'am /
translated: With mindfulness alone he walks,

original: 'greng ba'am / 'dug pa'am /
analyzed: 'greng ba'am / 'dug pa'am /
translated: stands, sits,

original: nyal bar byed do //
analyzed: nyal bar byed do //
translated: and lies down.

original: gya tshom du rkang pa sa la mi 'jog /
analyzed: gya tshom du rkang pa sa la mi 'jog /
translated: He does not put his foot on the ground thoughtlessly.

original: gya tshom du rkang pa sa la mi 'deg gi /
analyzed: gya tshom du rkang pa sa la mi 'deg gi /
translated: He does not put his foot down thoughtlessly,

original: dran bzhin kho nar rkang pa sa la 'jog cing dran bzhin kho nar rkang pas la 'deg la /
analyzed: dran bzhin kho nar rkang pa sa la 'jog cing dran bzhin kho nar rkang pas la 'deg la /
translated: but puts it down mindfully and lifts it up mindfully.

original: mthong bzhin du sa'i phyogs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: mthong bzhin du sa'i phyogs su 'gro ste /
translated: He goes about mindfully in the direction he is facing.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being endowed with those attributes, those tokens, and those signs should be known as a bodhisattva great being irreversible from awakening.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gos kyi spyod pa ni smad du med pa yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gos kyi spyod pa ni smad du med pa yin /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings’ conduct with regard to clothing is irreproachable.

original: rtag tu gtsang sbra can yin zhing dri @396a *//🔽nga ba med la /
analyzed: rtag tu gtsang sbra can yin zhing dri @396a *// nga ba med la /
translated: They are always clean and free of bad smells.

original: de nad nyung ba dang / rdul dang / dri ma dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: de nad nyung ba dang / rdul dang / dri ma dang bral ba yin te /
translated: They have few illnesses and are free of dust and dirt.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being endowed with those attributes, those tokens, and those signs should be known as a bodhisattva great being irreversible from awakening.”🔽“Furthermore, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being who has the perfection of wisdom should be known as irreversible from awakening.”

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i lus la ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i lus la ni /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, in the body of that irreversible Bodhisattva Mahāsattva,

original: mir gyur pa rnams kyi lus la srin bu'i rigs brgyad khri gang dag yod cing lus de nyid la za ba de dag med do //
analyzed: mir gyur pa rnams kyi lus la srin bu'i rigs brgyad khri gang dag yod cing lus de nyid la za ba de dag med do //
translated: the eighty-four thousand types of worms that exist in the bodies of human beings and consume that very body are absent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa dang 'jig rten thams cad las rab mchog tu gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa dang 'jig rten thams cad las rab mchog tu gyur pa yin te /
translated: Subhūti, those roots of goodness of that Bodhisattva are exalted above the entire world and become supreme in the entire world.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus la srin bu'i rigs de dag med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus la srin bu'i rigs de dag med do //
translated: Therefore, in the body of that Bodhisattva, those types of worms are absent.

original: rab 'byor / ji lta ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag shin tu rnam par 'phel ba de lta de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ches rgya cher lus dang / ngag dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji lta ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag shin tu rnam par 'phel ba de lta de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ches rgya cher lus dang / ngag dang /
translated: Subhuti : As the wholesome roots of the Bodhisattva, the great being, increase, so do his body, speech, and mind increase.🔽

original: yid yongs su dag pa yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: yid yongs su dag pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: “Subhūti, to the extent that the wholesome roots of those bodhisattva great beings increase, to that extent bodhisattva great beings take on a body, speech, and mind that are more and more pure.

original: grang ba dang / dro ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / nyi ma dang / rlung dang / sha sbrang gi reg pa dag bzod pa yin te /
analyzed: grang ba dang / dro ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / nyi ma dang / rlung dang / sha sbrang gi reg pa dag bzod pa yin te /
translated: They are patient with cold, heat, hunger, thirst, sun, wind, and the touch of flies and mosquitoes.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @396b chen po ni phyir mi ldog pa ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @396b chen po ni phyir mi ldog pa ston to //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who have those attributes, those tokens, and those signs should be known as irreversible.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i lus yongs su dag pa de gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i lus yongs su dag pa de gang lags /
translated: What is the bodhisattva great beings’ pure body?

original: ngag yongs su dag pa gang lags /
analyzed: ngag yongs su dag pa gang lags /
translated: What is the pure speech?

original: yid yongs su dag pa gang lags /
analyzed: yid yongs su dag pa gang lags /
translated: What is the pure mind?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
