translated: The Lord having been asked this, he said to the venerable Su­bhūti,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la ji lta ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag rnam par 'phel ba de lta de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus kyi mi drang ba dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la ji lta ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag rnam par 'phel ba de lta de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus kyi mi drang ba dang /
translated: “Su­bhūti, as the roots of virtue of those bodhisattva great beings increase in that way, by those roots of virtue the crookedness and deceit of the bodhisattva great beings’ bodies,

original: gya gyu dang / ngag gi mi drang ba dang / gya gyu dang / sems kyi mi drang ba dang / gya gyur rnams yongs su byang bar byed de /
analyzed: gya gyu dang / ngag gi mi drang ba dang / gya gyu dang / sems kyi mi drang ba dang / gya gyur rnams yongs su byang bar byed de /
translated: and the crookedness and deceit of their speech and minds are purified.”

original: de ji ltar lus kyis legs par spyad pa rnam pa gsum spyod pa dang / ngag gis legs par spyad pa rnam pa bzhi spyod pa dang / yid kyis legs par spyad pa rnam pa gsum spyod pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus yongs su dag pa dang /
analyzed: de ji ltar lus kyis legs par spyad pa rnam pa gsum spyod pa dang / ngag gis legs par spyad pa rnam pa bzhi spyod pa dang / yid kyis legs par spyad pa rnam pa gsum spyod pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus yongs su dag pa dang /
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purity of body,

original: ngag yongs su dag pa dang / yid yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: ngag yongs su dag pa dang / yid yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: purity of speech, and purity of mind.

original: de lus yongs su dag pa dang / ngag yongs su dag dang / yid yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa des nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las kyang 'da' bar @397a *//
analyzed: de lus yongs su dag pa dang / ngag yongs su dag dang / yid yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa des nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las kyang 'da' bar @397a *//
translated: Endowed with purity of body, purity of speech, and purity of mind, he transcends the stage of the śrāvaka and the stage of the pratyekabuddha,

original: byed cing / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la'ang 'jug la /
analyzed: byed cing / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la'ang 'jug la /
translated: and enters into the faultlessness of the bodhisattva.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du'ang mi byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du'ang mi byed do //
translated: But he does not actualize the very limit of reality.

original: rab 'byor / 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus yongs su dag pa dang / ngag yongs su dag pa dang / yid yongs su dag pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus yongs su dag pa dang / ngag yongs su dag pa dang / yid yongs su dag pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Subhūti, you should know that this is also the bodhisattva’s pure body, pure speech, and pure mind.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have those aspects, those signs, and that appearance are revealed to be irreversible.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la gdu ba ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la gdu ba ma yin /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattvas are not attached to gain, honor, and fame.

original: chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan la gdu ba ma yin /
analyzed: chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan la gdu ba ma yin /
translated: They are not attached to Dharma robes, alms-food, bedding, and seats.

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis po dag yang dag par blangs nas gnas te /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis po dag yang dag par blangs nas gnas te /
translated: They take up and maintain the twelve ascetic practices.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //🔽rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nam yang ser sna'i sems mi bskyed /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to // rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nam yang ser sna'i sems mi bskyed /
translated: Subhuti : With what aspects, tokens and signs is the irreversible Bodhisattva endowed?

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi sems dang / le lo'i sems dang / rnam par g-yengs pa'i sems dang / rmongs pa'i sems mi bskyed de /
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi sems dang / le lo'i sems dang / rnam par g-yengs pa'i sems dang / rmongs pa'i sems mi bskyed de /
translated: The Lord : The irreversible Bodhisattva does not produce a thought of avarice, nor a thought of immorality, nor a thought of malice, nor a thought of indolence, nor a thought of distraction, nor a thought of stupidity.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de @397b dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni blo brtan pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de @397b dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni blo brtan pa yin no //
translated: Subhuti : With what aspects, tokens and signs is the irreversible Bodhisattva endowed?

original: de ni gus par byas nas gzhan las chos nyan te /
analyzed: de ni gus par byas nas gzhan las chos nyan te /
translated: The Lord : The irreversible Bodhisattva listens to the Dharma with devotion,

original: gang ci nyan kyang rung /
analyzed: gang ci nyan kyang rung /
translated: whatever it may be.

original: de thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang sbyar bar byed do //
analyzed: de thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang sbyar bar byed do //
translated: He applies all of it to the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'jig rten pa'i las gang dag yin pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas 'bad pa med pa kho nar shes la de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang sbyar bar byed cing /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i las gang dag yin pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas 'bad pa med pa kho nar shes la de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang sbyar bar byed cing /
translated: and the mundane activities that they have to do, they know all of them through the perfection of wisdom without any effort, and they also apply them to the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang chos kyi dbyings dang mi 'byor ba'i chos de gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong gi /
analyzed: gang chos kyi dbyings dang mi 'byor ba'i chos de gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong gi /
translated: They do not see any dharma that is not included in the dharma-constituent,

original: de dag thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'byor bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'byor bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ste /
translated: but they see all of them as included in the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings endowed with those attributes, those tokens, and those signs are shown to be irreversible.

original: rab 'byor / gal te phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i mdun du bdud sdig can gyis sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad po dag mngon par sprul nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i mdun du bdud sdig can gyis sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad po dag mngon par sprul nas /
translated: “Subhūti, if Māra the wicked one conjures up eight great hells in front of that irreversible bodhisattva great being,

original: sems can dmyal ba re rer yang byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag mang po dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'bum phrag mang po zhig bstan te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba re rer yang byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag mang po dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'bum phrag mang po zhig bstan te /
translated: In each hell, many thousands of bodhisattvas and many hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas were revealed.

original: dmyal ba'i mes bsreg cing btso ba dang / bskol ba dang sdug bsngal mi bzad pa drag po rtsub pa'i tshor ba dag myong bar mngon du sprul te bstan @398a *//
analyzed: dmyal ba'i mes bsreg cing btso ba dang / bskol ba dang sdug bsngal mi bzad pa drag po rtsub pa'i tshor ba dag myong bar mngon du sprul te bstan @398a *//
translated: They manifested and revealed themselves being burned, boiled, and scorched by the hell fires, experiencing unbearable, intense, and violent feelings of suffering.

original: la / byang chub sems dpa' de la 'di skad ces byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: la / byang chub sems dpa' de la 'di skad ces byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di dag ni /
translated: And the bodhisattvas said to the bodhisattva, “These bodhisattva great beings

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par lung bstan pa sha stag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par lung bstan pa sha stag ste /
translated: have been prophesied by the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly awakened buddhas as irreversible from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: 'di dag sems can dmyal ba 'di dag tu skyes so //
analyzed: 'di dag sems can dmyal ba 'di dag tu skyes so //
translated: They have been born in these hells.

original: kye khyod kyang de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar las phyir mi ldog par lung bstan pa ni sems can dmyal bar 'gyur du zad na /
analyzed: kye khyod kyang de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar las phyir mi ldog par lung bstan pa ni sems can dmyal bar 'gyur du zad na /
translated: “Hey, you have been predicted by the Tathāgata to be irreversible from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, but you will become a hell being.

original: kye da dung yang khyod kyis byang chub kyi sems 'di thong zhig dang / de ltar na khyod sems can dmyal ba 'di dag nas thar par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: kye da dung yang khyod kyis byang chub kyi sems 'di thong zhig dang / de ltar na khyod sems can dmyal ba 'di dag nas thar par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Hey, if you give up this thought of awakening, then you will be freed from these hell realms.

original: phyis 'dir skye bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: phyis 'dir skye bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: You will not be born here again.

original: 'di nas shi 'phos nas kyang mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes zer yang /
analyzed: 'di nas shi 'phos nas kyang mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes zer yang /
translated: After you die, you will go to the higher realms.”

original: rab 'byor / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i sems gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba de ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i sems gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba de ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med do //
translated: Subhūti, it is impossible and there is no chance that the mind of that irreversible bodhisattva great being will change.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar las mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu ni mi sdug pa ma yin par des chos kyi mtshan nyid legs par rtogs pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ni chos kyi gter thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar las mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu ni mi sdug pa ma yin par des chos kyi mtshan nyid legs par rtogs pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ni chos kyi gter thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: and because those tathāgatas are treasuries of the Dharma, endowed with great compassion,

original: 'byung po thams cad la phan par bzhed pa yin @398b pas; rdzun gsung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung po thams cad la phan par bzhed pa yin @398b pas; rdzun gsung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and wish to benefit all beings, and do not speak falsely.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med de /
translated: Subhūti, it is impossible and there is no chance that

original: gang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can dmyal ba rnams sam /
analyzed: gang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can dmyal ba rnams sam /
translated: an irreversible bodhisattva great being will be born among the denizens of the hells,

original: dud 'gro rnams sam /
analyzed: dud 'gro rnams sam /
translated: or among animals,

original: yi dvags rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba de ni gnas med de /
analyzed: yi dvags rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba de ni gnas med de /
translated: or among the anguished spirits.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who have those aspects, those signs, and those indications are shown to be irreversible.”

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig can dge slong gi cha byad kyis 'ongs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig can dge slong gi cha byad kyis 'ongs te /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the evil Māra, having approached in the guise of a monk,

original: 'di skad du sngon khyod kyis 'di ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di skad du sngon khyod kyis 'di ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: says, ‘Previously, you heard that you should complete the perfection of generosity.

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: You should complete the perfection of wisdom, and so on.

original: 'di ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes thos pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni khyod kyis log par thos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes thos pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni khyod kyis log par thos pa yin gyi /
translated: You should fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening. All of that is what you heard incorrectly.

original: de thams cad slar  bshags par gyis shig /
analyzed: de thams cad slar  bshags par gyis shig /
translated: You should confess all of that.

original: khyod kyis 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi thugs dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: khyod kyis 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi thugs dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: You should confess and give up all the rejoicing in the wholesome roots of the past, future, and present Tathāgatas, Arhats, and Perfectly Awakened Ones, together with their śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, from the time they first gave rise to the mind of awakening,

original: dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i bar de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag yin pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la rjes su yi rang bar byas pa thams cad slar bshags @399a *//🔽par gyis shig /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i bar de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag yin pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la rjes su yi rang bar byas pa thams cad slar bshags @399a *// par gyis shig /
translated: up to the wholesome roots of the Dharma remaining.

original: slar thong zhig /
analyzed: slar thong zhig /
translated: You should confess and give up all that.

original: khyod dang de dag ni log pa'o //
analyzed: khyod dang de dag ni log pa'o //
translated: You and they are mistaken.

original: kye dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag slar 'chags shing gtong la /
analyzed: kye dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag slar 'chags shing gtong la /
translated: Oh, if you would confess and give up those wholesome roots,

original: kho bo'i tshig ltar byed na ni /
analyzed: kho bo'i tshig ltar byed na ni /
translated: and act in accordance with my words,

original: de ltar na khyod myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na khyod myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then you would quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: khyod kyis de skad thos pa gang yin pa ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin te; de snyan dngags su byas pa yin gyi /🔽kho bo khyod la ston pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag par na /
analyzed: khyod kyis de skad thos pa gang yin pa ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin te; de snyan dngags su byas pa yin gyi / kho bo khyod la ston pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag par na /
translated: What you have heard is not the word of the Buddha, but the composition of poets.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin no zhes zer la /🔽gal te byang chub sems dpa' de 'khrug cing nem nur byed la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin no zhes zer la / gal te byang chub sems dpa' de 'khrug cing nem nur byed la /
translated: The teaching that I give you is the true word of the Buddha.

original: the tshom za na byang chub sems dpa' de ni de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa ma yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: the tshom za na byang chub sems dpa' de ni de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa ma yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: If the bodhisattva is disturbed, uncertain, and doubtful, you should know that the Tathāgata has not predicted that bodhisattva’s unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: He is not established in the irreversible stage.

original: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la bdud sdig can gyis 'dun pa zlog pa na mi 'khrug cing nem nur mi byed la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la bdud sdig can gyis 'dun pa zlog pa na mi 'khrug cing nem nur mi byed la /
translated: Subhūti, if Māra the wicked one causes a bodhisattva great being’s motivation to turn back, and the bodhisattva is not disturbed, does not become uncertain,

original: the tshom mi za ste /
analyzed: the tshom mi za ste /
translated: and does not doubt it,

original: de'i tshig la yid ches par mi byed /
analyzed: de'i tshig la yid ches par mi byed /
translated: and does not believe his words,

original: gzhan la yid ches par mi byed /
analyzed: gzhan la yid ches par mi byed /
translated: and do not rely on others.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog na /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog na /
translated: If they do not rely on others in the perfection of giving, up to the perfection of wisdom, and likewise up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @399b de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @399b de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, you should know that those bodhisattva great beings will not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor / dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa ni chos rnams mngon sum du mthong ba'i phyir nam yang gzhan su la'ang yid ches par mi byed cing bdud sdig can gyis kyang mi 'phrogs pa yin na /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa ni chos rnams mngon sum du mthong ba'i phyir nam yang gzhan su la'ang yid ches par mi byed cing bdud sdig can gyis kyang mi 'phrogs pa yin na /
translated: an arhat with outflows ended, because of seeing dharmas with direct perception, never relies on others, and even Māra the wicked one cannot overpower him,

original: gzhan gyis lta ci smos /
analyzed: gzhan gyis lta ci smos /
translated: let alone anyone else.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang gzhan su la'ang yid ches par mi byed la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang gzhan su la'ang yid ches par mi byed la /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the irreversible bodhisattva great being does not trust anyone else.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / bdud sdig can gyis kyang mi brdzi zhing; bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / bdud sdig can gyis kyang mi brdzi zhing; bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa yin no //
translated: He is not overcome by any śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, or evil māras, and he does not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ni su la'ang yid ches par mi byed de /
analyzed: de ni su la'ang yid ches par mi byed de /
translated: He does not trust anyone else.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la'ang dad pas mi 'gro na; gzhan dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / spyod pa dang / kun tu rgyu rnams sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la'ang dad pas mi 'gro na; gzhan dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / spyod pa dang / kun tu rgyu rnams sam /
translated: If he does not go to the tathāgatas with faith, how could he trust other ascetics, brahmins, or wandering mendicants,

original: bdud sdig can la yid ches par ltag la byed de /
analyzed: bdud sdig can la yid ches par ltag la byed de /
translated: or the evil Māra?

original: de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: de ni gnas med do //
translated: That is impossible.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des ni gang la yid ches par bya ba'i gzugs kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des ni gang la yid ches par bya ba'i gzugs kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the bodhisattva great being does not see any form that he should trust,

original: de bzhin du gang la yid ches par bya ba'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang la yid ches par bya ba'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the suchness of feeling, the suchness of perception, the suchness of volitional factors, or the suchness of consciousness that can be trusted.

original: de bzhin du gang la yid ches par bya ba'i gzugs kyi @400a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du gang la yid ches par bya ba'i gzugs kyi @400a *//
translated: They do not see the suchness of the perfection of giving that can be trusted.🔽They do not see the suchness of the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom that can be trusted.🔽They do not see the suchness of the emptiness meditative stabilization that can be trusted.🔽They do not see the suchness of the signless meditative stabilization or the wishless meditative stabilization that can be trusted.

original: de bzhin nyid dang / tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid dang / 'du byed rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo /🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid dang / 'du byed rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They do not see the suchness of the applications of mindfulness that can be trusted.🔽They do not see the suchness of the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, or path that can be trusted.🔽They do not see the suchness of the ten powers that can be trusted.🔽They do not see the suchness of the four fearlessnesses, four detailed and thorough knowledges, or eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha that can be trusted.

original: gang la yid ches par bya ba'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang la yid ches par bya ba'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: They do not see the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects that can be trusted.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings endowed with those aspects, those attributes, and those signs are revealed to be irreversible.

original: rab 'byor; gzhan yang bdud sdig can dge slong gi cha byad du 'ongs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor; gzhan yang bdud sdig can dge slong gi cha byad du 'ongs te /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, Māra the wicked one, having come in the guise of a monk,

original: byang chub sems dpa' la 'di skad du 'di ni 'khor ba'i spyod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la 'di skad du 'di ni 'khor ba'i spyod pa yin gyi /
translated: says to the bodhisattva, ‘This is the conduct of cyclic existence.

original: 'di byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not the conduct of a bodhisattva.

original: kye khyod kyis 'di nyid du sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin par gyis shig ces zer zhing /
analyzed: kye khyod kyis 'di nyid du sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin par gyis shig ces zer zhing /
translated: Hey, you should put an end to suffering right here and now.’

original: de byang chub sems dpa' de la rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam ltar bcos pa ston la /
analyzed: de byang chub sems dpa' de la rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam ltar bcos pa ston la /
translated: He teaches the bodhisattva a counterfeit path to complete awakening.

original: lam ltar bcos pa de'ang 'khor ba'i spyod pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: lam ltar bcos pa de'ang 'khor ba'i spyod pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa ste /
translated: That counterfeit path is included in the worldly path of the conduct of cyclic existence.

original: yang na rus gong du 'du shes pa dang / rnam par sngos pa dang / rnam par rnags pa dang / rnam par bam pa dang / rnam par dmar ba dang / rnam par zos pa'i 'du shes sam /🔽yang na byams pa'am /
analyzed: yang na rus gong du 'du shes pa dang / rnam par sngos pa dang / rnam par rnags pa dang / rnam par bam pa dang / rnam par dmar ba dang / rnam par zos pa'i 'du shes sam / yang na byams pa'am /
translated: or the perception of a skeleton, or the perception of a livid body, or the perception of a festering body, or the perception of a body full of worms, or the perception of a body that has burst open, or the perception of a body that has been burned,🔽or else he teaches loving kindness,

original: yang na snying rje'am /
analyzed: yang na snying rje'am /
translated: or else compassion,

original: yang na dga' ba'am /
analyzed: yang na dga' ba'am /
translated: or else joy,

original: yang na btang snyoms sam /
analyzed: yang na btang snyoms sam /
translated: or else equanimity,

original: @400b yang na bsam gtan dang po'am /
analyzed: @400b yang na bsam gtan dang po'am /
translated: or else the first concentration,

original: yang na bsam gtan bzhi ba'i bar ram /
analyzed: yang na bsam gtan bzhi ba'i bar ram /
translated: or else up to the fourth concentration,

original: yang na gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ston par byed cing /
analyzed: yang na gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ston par byed cing /
translated: or else the four formless absorptions,

original: tshe dang ldan pa lam 'di dang nan tan 'dis ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur zhing /🔽dgra bcom pa'i bar ram /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa lam 'di dang nan tan 'dis ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur zhing / dgra bcom pa'i bar ram /
translated: and says, ‘Venerable, through this path and through this practice, you will attain the fruit of stream enterer,🔽up to you will attain the state of an arhat,

original: rang byang chub 'thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rang byang chub 'thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: or you will attain individual enlightenment.

original: kye khyod kyis 'di nyid du sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin par gyis shig /
analyzed: kye khyod kyis 'di nyid du sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin par gyis shig /
translated: Hey, you should reach the end of suffering right here.

original: phyis 'khor ba na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal de dag myong bar gyur ta re /
analyzed: phyis 'khor ba na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal de dag myong bar gyur ta re /
translated: Don’t experience the suffering of wandering in saṃsāra later on.’

original: yang na gal te khyod gzugs can gyi lus mi 'dod dam /
analyzed: yang na gal te khyod gzugs can gyi lus mi 'dod dam /
translated: Or, if you do not want a physical body,

original: yongs su mi gzung bar sems na /
analyzed: yongs su mi gzung bar sems na /
translated: if you do not want to grasp at it,

original: 'di nyid du skye mched rnams yongs su sbyongs shig /
analyzed: 'di nyid du skye mched rnams yongs su sbyongs shig /
translated: then right here you should purify the sense-spheres.

original: ces byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la de skad brjod kyang /
analyzed: ces byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la de skad brjod kyang /
translated: Even if they say this to the bodhisattva great being,

original: rab 'byor / gal te sems mi 'khrug cing mi g-yo la /🔽gong du'ang 'di snyam du bdag la lam ltar bcos pa gang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang mngon sum du byed par mi 'gyur zhing /🔽dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i bar du mngon sum du byed par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te sems mi 'khrug cing mi g-yo la / gong du'ang 'di snyam du bdag la lam ltar bcos pa gang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang mngon sum du byed par mi 'gyur zhing / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i bar du mngon sum du byed par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Subhūti, if his mind does not waver, does not shake,🔽and he thinks, “This monk who is teaching a counterfeit path to me is doing me a favor, because he is not making me realize even the result of stream enterer,🔽up to he is not making me realize even the result of a worthy one,

original: rang byang chub kyang mngon sum du byed par yang mi 'gyur ba'i lam ltar bcos pa ston pa'i dge slong 'di ni bdag la gces spras byed pa yin no snyam du sems so //
analyzed: rang byang chub kyang mngon sum du byed par yang mi 'gyur ba'i lam ltar bcos pa ston pa'i dge slong 'di ni bdag la gces spras byed pa yin no snyam du sems so //
translated: and he is not making me realize even the state of a pratyekabuddha.”

original: gong du'ang bdag la chags pa de ston pa'i dge slong 'di ni bdag la gces spras byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gong du'ang bdag la chags pa de ston pa'i dge slong 'di ni bdag la gces spras byed pa yin te /
translated: Also, previously, when attached to self, this monk teacher was dear to me.

original: chags pa'i gnas de shes nas /
analyzed: chags pa'i gnas de shes nas /
translated: Knowing that place of attachment,

original: theg pa gsum po kun la @401a *//
analyzed: theg pa gsum po kun la @401a *//
translated: I will train in all three vehicles.

original: bslab par bya'o snyam nas dga' ba skye'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya'o snyam nas dga' ba skye'o //
translated: Thinking this, I will be joyful.

original: bdud sdig can gyis de dga' bar rig nas de la 'di skad ces /
analyzed: bdud sdig can gyis de dga' bar rig nas de la 'di skad ces /
translated: When the evil Mara knows that I am joyful, he will say to me,

original: kye rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: kye rigs kyi bu /
translated: 'Oh son of a good family!

original: khyod byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag la /
analyzed: khyod byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag la /
translated: You have served the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Fully Enlightened Ones, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,

original: na bza' dang / zhal zas dang / gzims cha dang / gdan dang / snyun gyi gsos sman dang / yo byad rnams kyis bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed po de dag gi drung du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su bsgom zhing /🔽de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'ang yongs su bsgoms la /
analyzed: na bza' dang / zhal zas dang / gzims cha dang / gdan dang / snyun gyi gsos sman dang / yo byad rnams kyis bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed po de dag gi drung du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su bsgom zhing / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'ang yongs su bsgoms la /
translated: and they served them with robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, remedies for exhaustion, and provisions.🔽They cultivated the perfection of generosity in the presence of those tathāgatas, those arhats, those perfectly awakened ones, and similarly they cultivated the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed po de dag la bkur sti byas te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed po de dag la bkur sti byas te /
translated: They served those tathāgatas, those arhats, those perfectly awakened ones, and they made offerings to them.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'di nyid kyi ched du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'di nyid kyi ched du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: For the sake of just this unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of giving, and similarly practice the perfection of morality,

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag @401b pa rnams dang /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag @401b pa rnams dang /
translated: the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom, and similarly the applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang /
translated: the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the aspects of awakening, the noble eightfold path, and the three gateways to liberation,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and similarly …

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la spyod pas ji ltar rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam la gnas par bgyi zhes yongs su zhus shing dris pa rnams lta bar 'dod dam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la spyod pas ji ltar rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam la gnas par bgyi zhes yongs su zhus shing dris pa rnams lta bar 'dod dam /
translated: Do you want to see the questions they asked and the inquiries they made, up to and including the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis gang bshad pa la de kho na bzhin du gnas te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis gang bshad pa la de kho na bzhin du gnas te /
translated: They remained just as those lord buddhas had explained it.

original: de kho na bzhin du spyad /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du spyad /
translated: They practiced just as it had been explained.🔽They engaged in yoga just as it had been explained.

original: de kho na bzhin du rnal 'byor du byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas te /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du rnal 'byor du byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas te /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings did not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ltar gdams pa dang / de ltar rjes su bstan pa dang / de ltar slob pa rnams kyis kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid da dung ma thob na /
analyzed: de ltar gdams pa dang / de ltar rjes su bstan pa dang / de ltar slob pa rnams kyis kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid da dung ma thob na /
translated: Those who were instructed like that, taught like that, and trained like that have not yet attained the knowledge of all aspects.

original: khyod lta zhig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'tshang rgya bar lta ga la 'gyur zhes de skad brjod na'ang /
analyzed: khyod lta zhig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'tshang rgya bar lta ga la 'gyur zhes de skad brjod na'ang /
translated: How could you possibly attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?’

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems gzhan du mi 'gyur zhing yid dngang bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems gzhan du mi 'gyur zhing yid dngang bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: “If the mind of a bodhisattva great being does not change and is not frightened,

original: gong du'ang chags pa gang gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang 'thob par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gong du'ang chags pa gang gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang 'thob par mi 'gyur /
translated: and if he thinks, ‘The attachment that would prevent me from attaining the result of stream enterer

original: rang byang chub kyi bar du'ang 'thob par mi 'gyur ba'i chags pa @402a *//
analyzed: rang byang chub kyi bar du'ang 'thob par mi 'gyur ba'i chags pa @402a *//
translated: and the attachment that would prevent me from attaining up to the state of a pratyekabuddha

original: bdag la ston pa'i dge slong 'di ni bdag la gces spras byed pa yin no snyam nas dga' ba skye'o //
analyzed: bdag la ston pa'i dge slong 'di ni bdag la gces spras byed pa yin no snyam nas dga' ba skye'o //
translated: is being shown to me by this monk who is looking after me,’ he will be pleased.

original: de nas bdud sdig can gyis byang chub sems dpa' de'i sems zhum pa med pa nyid du shes nas /
analyzed: de nas bdud sdig can gyis byang chub sems dpa' de'i sems zhum pa med pa nyid du shes nas /
translated: “Then the evil Māra, knowing that the bodhisattva’s mind is not downcast,

original: skad cig de nyid la phyogs de nyid du dge slong rab tu mang po dag cig mngon par sprul nas /
analyzed: skad cig de nyid la phyogs de nyid du dge slong rab tu mang po dag cig mngon par sprul nas /
translated: instantly conjures up many monks right there and says to the bodhisattva,

original: dge slong 'di dag ni dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa nyon mongs pa med pa sha stag ste /
analyzed: dge slong 'di dag ni dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa nyon mongs pa med pa sha stag ste /
translated: “These monks are arhats whose defilements have ceased, who are without afflictions,

original: gang dag sngon bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa las de dag nyan thos nyid du gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: gang dag sngon bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa las de dag nyan thos nyid du gnas par gyur to //
translated: but they have remained as śrāvakas, having previously set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: de bas na khyod lta zhig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar lta ga la 'gyur zhes bstan kyang /
analyzed: de bas na khyod lta zhig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar lta ga la 'gyur zhes bstan kyang /
translated: “How could you become fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'di snyam du kye ma 'di ni bdud sdig can lam ltar bcos pa ston pa dang / sprul pa yin no snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'di snyam du kye ma 'di ni bdud sdig can lam ltar bcos pa ston pa dang / sprul pa yin no snyam du sems te /
translated: If a bodhisattva great being thinks, “Oh no, this is the evil Māra teaching a counterfeit path and an emanation,”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog cing nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog cing nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: they will not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and they will not fall to the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level.”

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ngo snyam ste; gong gi'ang de 'di snyam du gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ngo snyam ste; gong gi'ang de 'di snyam du gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la spyod pa dang /
translated: The first bodhisattva thinks, ‘It is not possible, it cannot happen, that a bodhisattva great being who practices the perfection of giving, who practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: @402b dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la spyod pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur ba de ni gnas med la go skabs ma yin te /
analyzed: @402b dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la spyod pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur ba de ni gnas med la go skabs ma yin te /
translated: who practices the applications of mindfulness, up to who practices the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and who fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening will not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ni gnas med do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de ni gnas med do snyam du sems na /
translated: That is not possible.’

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings endowed with those attributes, those tokens, and those signs are shown to be irreversible.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, irreversible bodhisattva great beings think like this:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang la la zhig de bzhin gshegs pas ji skad gsungs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag dang ma bral zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang la la zhig de bzhin gshegs pas ji skad gsungs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag dang ma bral zhing /
translated: ‘Those bodhisattva great beings who are not separated from the six perfections as they are taught by the Tathāgata🔽and who cause beings to take up the six perfections

original: sems can rnams kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par byed /🔽'jog par byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par byed / 'jog par byed /
translated: and establish them in them

original: 'god par byed cing /
analyzed: 'god par byed cing /
translated: and cause them to enter into them

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems dang ldan pa ni phyir mi ldog pa yin par ston to snyam mo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems dang ldan pa ni phyir mi ldog pa yin par ston to snyam mo //
translated: and who have a thought endowed with the knowledge of all aspects are shown to be irreversible.’

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva irreversible from the Great Vehicle thinks this:

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig bdud kyi las rnams rig cing rtogs pa de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /🔽bdud kyi las de dag @403a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig bdud kyi las rnams rig cing rtogs pa de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te / bdud kyi las de dag @403a *//
translated: ‘The bodhisattva who knows and realizes the works of Māra will not regress from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are the works of Māra?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: yul lnga po dag la lhag par chags shing smon la /
analyzed: yul lnga po dag la lhag par chags shing smon la /
translated: attachment to and aspiration for the five sense objects;

original: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la mngon par mi brtson pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la mngon par mi brtson pa ste /
translated: and not striving for the perfections.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / rtags de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog pa yin par ston to snyam mo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / rtags de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog pa yin par ston to snyam mo //
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva endowed with those attributes, those tokens, and those signs should be known as irreversible from awakening.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Reverend Lord!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar na gang las phyir mi ldog ces bgyi ba'i grangs su mchi lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar na gang las phyir mi ldog ces bgyi ba'i grangs su mchi lags /
translated: How is it that bodhisattva great beings are counted as irreversible?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs kyi 'du shes las phyir log na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs kyi 'du shes las phyir log na /
translated: “Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings turn back from the perception of form,

original: phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
translated: they are counted as irreversible.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes las phyir ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes las phyir ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
translated: Similarly, when bodhisattva great beings turn back from the perception of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, they are counted as irreversible.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Similarly, connect this with each, up to🔽when bodhisattva great beings turn back from the perception of the knowledge of all aspects, they are counted as irreversible.”

original: skye mched kyi 'du shes dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi 'du shes dang / lta ba'i rnam pa drug cu rtsa gnyis kyi 'du shes dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'du shes dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu @403b phyin pa'i bar gyi 'du shes dang /
analyzed: skye mched kyi 'du shes dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi 'du shes dang / lta ba'i rnam pa drug cu rtsa gnyis kyi 'du shes dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'du shes dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu @403b phyin pa'i bar gyi 'du shes dang /
translated: the notion of the sense sources, the notion of desire, anger, and ignorance, the notion of the sixty-two views, the notion of the perfection of generosity, up to the notion of the perfection of wisdom,

original: nang stong pa nyid kyi 'du shes dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'du shes dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i 'du shes dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyi 'du shes dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'du shes dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i 'du shes dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: the notion of inner emptiness, up to the notion of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, the notion of the applications of mindfulness, and in the same vein,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi 'du shes dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'du shes dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'du shes las phyir ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi 'du shes dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'du shes dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'du shes las phyir ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings who turn back from the notion of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, up to the notion of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, the notion of the śrāvaka level, the pratyekabuddha level, up to the knowledge of all aspects are counted as irreversible.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Why is that?”

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs te /🔽de chos phra rab tsam yang mi dmigs la mi dmigs pas chos gang yang mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs te / de chos phra rab tsam yang mi dmigs la mi dmigs pas chos gang yang mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: “Subhūti, it is because those irreversible bodhisattva great beings have entered into the secure state of a bodhisattva in all dharmas that are empty of their own marks.🔽They do not apprehend even the smallest thing, and because they do not apprehend anything they do not create any dharma.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed pas chos gang yang mi skyed do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed pas chos gang yang mi skyed do //
translated: Because they do not create anything they do not produce any dharma.

original: de'i phyir mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, it is taught that the bodhisattva great being who has attained forbearance for the nonproduction of dharmas is irreversible.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig can byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gan du 'ongs nas mos pa zlog cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang bdud sdig can byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gan du 'ongs nas mos pa zlog cing /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, Māra the wicked one, having approached a bodhisattva great being, turns him away from aspiration,

original: 'di skad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'di ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: 'di skad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'di ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: saying, ‘This knowledge of all aspects is like space, the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'o //
translated: empty of its own mark.

original: @404a *// chos 'di dag kyang nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: @404a *// chos 'di dag kyang nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: These dharmas are like space, the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'o //
translated: empty of their own mark.

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la ni gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / gang gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / gang du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i chos de gang yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la ni gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / gang gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / gang du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i chos de gang yang mi dmigs te /
translated: In phenomena that are similar to space, that have the non-entityness of being without an intrinsic nature, and that are empty of their own characteristics, there is nothing that is a phenomenon that is observed as something that fully awakens, something that fully awakens to something, or something that fully awakens somewhere.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pas /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pas /
translated: All these phenomena are similar to space, have the non-entityness of being without an intrinsic nature, and are empty of their own characteristics.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: it is said, ‘I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: khyod nyon mongs shing don med par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: khyod nyon mongs shing don med par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: This is a disturbance for you and will be meaningless.

original: de skad bstan pa 'di ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: de skad bstan pa 'di ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: This teaching is the work of Māra.”

original: 'di ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not the teaching of the Perfectly Awakened One.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family,

original: yid la byed pa de dag thong zhig /
analyzed: yid la byed pa de dag thong zhig /
translated: give up those attentions!

original: khyod la yun ring por gnod pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / log par ltung bar gyur te re zhes zer na /
analyzed: khyod la yun ring por gnod pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / log par ltung bar gyur te re zhes zer na /
translated: For a long time they will be harmful to you, will bring you suffering, and will bring you down.

original: de la rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis tshig de dag thos nas 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: de la rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis tshig de dag thos nas 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: When those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family hear those words, they should investigate them in this way:

original: gang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang 'bral bar byed pa 'di dag ni bdud kyi las te /
analyzed: gang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang 'bral bar byed pa 'di dag ni bdud kyi las te /
translated: ‘These are the works of Māra that separate me from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni @404b nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni @404b nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: In this way, all phenomena are like space and have the nature of being insubstantial.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong mod kyi /🔽de dag sems can rnams kyis ma shes ma mthong zhing /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong mod kyi / de dag sems can rnams kyis ma shes ma mthong zhing /
translated: They are empty of their own marks.

original: khong du ma chud kyi /
analyzed: khong du ma chud kyi /
translated: But sentient beings do not know them, do not see them, and do not understand them.

original: de'i phyir bdag gis nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gis nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Therefore, I will don the armor that is like space and has the nature of being insubstantial.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i go cha bgos la rnams  thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par byas te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i go cha bgos la rnams  thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par byas te /
translated: I will don the armor that is empty of its own characteristics and will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: sems can rnams la nges par 'byung ba'i chos bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la nges par 'byung ba'i chos bstan par bya'o //
translated: I will teach the Dharma of definitive release to sentient beings.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyi mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyi mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish them in the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and arhatship.

original: rang byang chub la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: rang byang chub la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish them in individual enlightenment.🔽I will establish them in unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.’

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dgod par bya'o snyam du bsams shing; de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dgod par bya'o snyam du bsams shing; de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: “Great bodhisattva beings should think in this way, and from the time when they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment,

original: chos de dag thos nas sems brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: chos de dag thos nas sems brtan par bya'o //
translated: when they hear those teachings, they should stabilize their minds.

original: sems mi g-yo bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems mi g-yo bar bya'o //
translated: the mind should be unmoved;

original: sems mi 'phrogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sems mi 'phrogs par bya'o //
translated: the mind should be unattached.

original: de sems brtan pa dang / sems mi g-yo ba dang / sems mi 'phrogs pa de dag dang ldan pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la spyod na byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro ////
analyzed: de sems brtan pa dang / sems mi g-yo ba dang / sems mi 'phrogs pa de dag dang ldan pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la spyod na byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro ////
translated: Endowed with a firm mind, an unmoved mind, and an unattached mind, he practices the six perfections and enters into the secure stage of a bodhisattva.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa /
translated: Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines

original: bam po sum cu gnyis pa /🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das @405a *//
analyzed: bam po sum cu gnyis pa / de nas bcom ldan 'das @405a *//
translated: Thirty-Second Chapter

original: la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /🔽phyir ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la phyir mi ldog pa zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das / phyir ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la phyir mi ldog pa zhes bgyi'am /
translated: “Venerable Blessed One,🔽should a bodhisattva great being who turns back be called ‘non-returning,’

original: 'on te phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni phyir ldog pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: 'on te phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni phyir ldog pa zhes bgyi /
translated: or should a bodhisattva who does not turn back be called ‘turning back’?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor / phyir ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / phyir ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “Su­bhūti, a bodhisattva who turns back is called irreversible.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phyir ldog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phyir ldog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: A bodhisattva who does not turn back is called one who turns back.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: ” Su­bhūti then made the following request:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Reverend Lord!

original: ji ltar na phyir ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phyir mi ldog pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar na phyir ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phyir mi ldog pa zhes bgyi /
translated: How is it that a bodhisattva who turns back is called irreversible?

original: ji ltar na phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phyir ldog pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar na phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phyir ldog pa zhes bgyi /
translated: How is it that a bodhisattva who does not turn back is called one who turns back?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One replied:

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: “Su­bhūti, a bodhisattva great being who turns back from the level of the śrāvakas

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las log pa de ni /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las log pa de ni /
translated: and the level of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: rab 'byor / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin te /
translated: Su­bhūti, is an irreversible bodhisattva.

original: phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: they are called irreversible.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: Subhūti, those bodhisattva great beings who do not turn back from the śrāvaka level

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las mi ldog pa de ni /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las mi ldog pa de ni /
translated: or the pratyekabuddha level

original: rab 'byor / phyir ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / phyir ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yin te /
translated: are, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who turn back,

original: @405b phyir ldog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @405b phyir ldog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and they are called those who turn back.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / rtags de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / rtags de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya ste /
translated: Subhūti, you should know that bodhisattva great beings endowed with those attributes, those tokens, and those signs are irreversible.

original: rnam pa de dag dang / rtags de dag dang / mchan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bdud sdig can gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las bzlog par mi nus so //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag dang / rtags de dag dang / mchan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bdud sdig can gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las bzlog par mi nus so //
translated: Māra the wicked one cannot turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening those bodhisattva great beings endowed with those attributes, those tokens, and those signs.”🔽“Lord, how should a bodhisattva great being train in the perfection of wisdom?”

original: rab 'byor / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dod na bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: rab 'byor / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dod na bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: Subhūti, if he wishes, a bodhisattva great being who is irreversible enters into the first concentration.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: Similarly, he enters into the second, third, and fourth concentrations.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way,

original: 'dod na 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar dag la snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: 'dod na 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar dag la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: if he wishes, he enters into the meditative absorption of the cessation of discriminations and feelings.

original: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: Similarly, he enters into the four applications of mindfulness.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag la snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dag la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: In the same way, he enters into the noble eightfold path.

original: de bzhin stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: de bzhin stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: Similarly, he enters into emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga mngon par sgrub bo //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga mngon par sgrub bo //
translated: He accomplishes the five superknowledges.

original: de 'dod na bsam gtan bzhi po dag la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: de 'dod na bsam gtan bzhi po dag la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: If he wishes, he enters into the four concentrations.

original: bsam gtan de dag gi dbang gis kyang mi skye'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan de dag gi dbang gis kyang mi skye'o //
translated: But he is not reborn by the power of those concentrations.

original: de bzhin du tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms @406a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms @406a *//
translated: Likewise, it is the four immeasurables and the formless🔽absorptions.

original: par 'jug pa bzhi la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: par 'jug pa bzhi la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: Similarly, they enter the four immeasurables and the four formless absorptions,

original: de dag gi dbang gis kyang mi skye'o //
analyzed: de dag gi dbang gis kyang mi skye'o //
translated: but they are not reborn by the power of those absorptions.

original: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag pa spong ba bzhi dang; rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa sgom ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag pa spong ba bzhi dang; rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa sgom ste /
translated: Similarly, they cultivate the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path,

original: nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yang mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yang mi ltung ngo //
translated: but they do not fall into the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level.

original: de bzhin du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: Similarly, they enter the meditative absorption in the cessation of discriminations and feelings,

original: 'gog pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du'ang mi byed cing /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du'ang mi byed cing /
translated: but they do not actualize the result of cessation.

original: yongs su mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: yongs su mi 'dzin to //
translated: They do not grasp it.

original: de 'dod na lus gang 'dod pa'i lus de dag yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: de 'dod na lus gang 'dod pa'i lus de dag yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: If they wish, they take on any kind of body they like.

original: lus yongs su bzung ba des sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: lus yongs su bzung ba des sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: He benefits sentient beings with that body.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva endowed with those attributes, those tokens, and those signs should be known as a bodhisattva who is irreversible from awakening.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gzugs lhur len pa ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gzugs lhur len pa ma yin /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, an irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattva does not take delight in form,

original: mtshan ma lhur len pa ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan ma lhur len pa ma yin /
translated: does not take delight in signs,

original: g-yog 'khor lhur len pa ma yin /
analyzed: g-yog 'khor lhur len pa ma yin /
translated: does not take delight in a retinue,

original: sbyin pa lhur len pa ma yin /
analyzed: sbyin pa lhur len pa ma yin /
translated: does not take delight in generosity,

original: tshul khrims lhur len pa ma yin /🔽bzod pa lhur len pa ma yin /
analyzed: tshul khrims lhur len pa ma yin / bzod pa lhur len pa ma yin /
translated: does not take delight in moral discipline,🔽does not take delight in patience,

original: brtson 'grus lhur len pa ma yin /
analyzed: brtson 'grus lhur len pa ma yin /
translated: does not take delight in perseverance,

original: bsam gtan lhur len pa ma yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan lhur len pa ma yin /
translated: does not take delight in concentration,

original: shes @406b rab lhur len pa ma yin /
analyzed: shes @406b rab lhur len pa ma yin /
translated: does not take delight in wisdom,

original: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa lhur len pa ma yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa lhur len pa ma yin /
translated: does not take delight in the concentrations, immeasurables, and formless absorptions,

original: mngon par shes pa lhur len pa ma yin /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lhur len pa ma yin /
translated: and does not take delight in the superknowledges.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa lhur len pa ma yin /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa lhur len pa ma yin /
translated: They do not strive for the four applications of mindfulness,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar lhur len pa ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar lhur len pa ma yin /
translated: and in the same vein,🔽they do not strive for , up to and including the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba lhur len pa ma yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba lhur len pa ma yin /
translated: They do not strive to refine the buddhafields,

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba lhur len pa ma yin /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba lhur len pa ma yin /
translated: they do not strive to bring sentient beings to full maturity,

original: sangs rgyas la blta ba lhur len pa ma yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la blta ba lhur len pa ma yin /
translated: they do not strive to behold the buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba lhur len pa ma yin no //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba lhur len pa ma yin no // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: and they do not strive to plant wholesome seeds.
