original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong zhing nam mkha' dang mtshungs par yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing gang zhig lhur len pa bskyed pa dang / gang du bskyed pa de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong zhing nam mkha' dang mtshungs par yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing gang zhig lhur len pa bskyed pa dang / gang du bskyed pa de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you ask why, Su­bhūti, it is because those great bodhisattva beings perceive all things as being empty of their own defining characteristics, and as being like space, and they do not perceive that which would generate striving, or that in which it would be generated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong zhing /
translated: Subhūti, it is because that bodhisattva great being has seen all phenomena as empty of their own marks,

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and as being the same as space.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa de dang ldan pas spyod lam bzhis 'gro'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa de dang ldan pas spyod lam bzhis 'gro'am /
translated: “Subhūti, that bodhisattva great being, with that attention on the knowledge of all aspects, whether going by the four modes of deportment,

original: ldog gam / 'greng ngam /🔽'dug gam / nyal @407a *//
analyzed: ldog gam / 'greng ngam / 'dug gam / nyal @407a *//
translated: or turning back, or standing,🔽or sitting,

original: yang rung ste /
analyzed: yang rung ste /
translated: or lying down,

original: zhi bzhin du 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal bar byed de /
analyzed: zhi bzhin du 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal bar byed de /
translated: goes, comes, stands, sits, and lies down peacefully.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings with those aspects, those signs, and those indications are shown to be irreversible.”

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gal te khyim na gnas na'ang thabs la mkhas pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gal te khyim na gnas na'ang thabs la mkhas pas /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva who is irreversible were to live in a household, he would, through skillful means,

original: sems can rnams kyi don du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar bzung nas sems can rnams la sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar bzung nas sems can rnams la sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
translated: take up the five sense objects for the sake of sentient beings and give gifts to sentient beings.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽zas 'dod pa rnams la ni zas /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / zas 'dod pa rnams la ni zas /
translated: Namely,🔽he would give food to those who desire food,

original: skom 'dod pa rnams la ni skom sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: skom 'dod pa rnams la ni skom sbyin par byed do //
translated: and drink to those who desire drink,

original: mi'i yo byad gang yang rung ba dag gi bar du sbyin par byed do //🔽de bdag kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /🔽gzhan yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug la /
analyzed: mi'i yo byad gang yang rung ba dag gi bar du sbyin par byed do // de bdag kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing / gzhan yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug la /
translated: up to giving any human necessities that are desired.🔽He himself would practice the perfection of generosity,🔽and he would also encourage others to take up the perfection of generosity,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsngags pa'ang brjod cing rjes su dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsngags pa'ang brjod cing rjes su dga' bar byed do //
translated: and he would speak in praise of the perfection of generosity and rejoice in it.

original: de ltar gong ma bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gong ma bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de khyim na gnas na rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs kyis dzambu'i gling yongs su bkang ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de khyim na gnas na rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs kyis dzambu'i gling yongs su bkang ste /
translated: “Subhūti, if that irreversible bodhisattva great being is living in a house, he fills the world with various jewels conjured up by the power of his supernormal knowledge,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
translated: and gives them as gifts to the lord buddhas.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way, up to

original: @407b rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs dag gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bar du yongs su bkang ste /
analyzed: @407b rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs dag gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bar du yongs su bkang ste /
translated: he fills the world with various jewels conjured up by the power of his supernormal knowledge, and gives them as gifts to the lord buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sbyin pa sbyin par byed kyang 'dod pa dag la yongs su mi spyod cing rtag tu tshangs par spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sbyin pa sbyin par byed kyang 'dod pa dag la yongs su mi spyod cing rtag tu tshangs par spyod pa yin te /
translated: He does not enjoy desires, but always practices celibacy.

original: mi gtsang ba dang / dri nga ba med do //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba dang / dri nga ba med do //
translated: it is not impure, and it does not have a bad smell.

original: de nam yang su la'ang pha rol la brnyas pa dang; khyad du gsod pa gang dag gis pha rol mi dga' bar 'gyur ba'i pha rol la brnyas pa dang / khyad du gsod pa mi byed de /🔽rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par bstan to //
analyzed: de nam yang su la'ang pha rol la brnyas pa dang; khyad du gsod pa gang dag gis pha rol mi dga' bar 'gyur ba'i pha rol la brnyas pa dang / khyad du gsod pa mi byed de / rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par bstan to //
translated: He never treats anyone with contempt or disdain, and he never does anything that would displease others.🔽Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings endowed with those attributes, those tokens, and those signs should be known as irreversible.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni ring po mi thogs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro snyam nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni ring po mi thogs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro snyam nas /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who have the following qualities should be known as irreversible.

original: bsrung ba dang yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir gnod sbyin lag na rdo rje rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa'i phyi bzhin 'brang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsrung ba dang yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir gnod sbyin lag na rdo rje rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa'i phyi bzhin 'brang bar 'gyur te /
translated: For the sake of protection and complete guarding, the yakṣa Vajrapāṇi will always and constantly follow the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is irreversible.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de'i phyi bzhin 'brang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de'i phyi bzhin 'brang ba bzhin no //
translated: He will follow him just as he follows the unsurpassed, genuinely perfect buddhas.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein, as before,

original: rdo rje'i rigs lnga brgya'i bar du'ang bsrung ba dang yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par phyi bzhin du 'brang ste /🔽de la mi rnams @408a *//
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs lnga brgya'i bar du'ang bsrung ba dang yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par phyi bzhin du 'brang ste / de la mi rnams @408a *//
translated: up to and including the five hundred vajra families, he will always and constantly follow him for the sake of protection and complete guarding.

original: sam mi ma yin pa rnams kyis nam yang gnod par byed mi nus te /
analyzed: sam mi ma yin pa rnams kyis nam yang gnod par byed mi nus te /
translated: No human or non-human being will ever be able to harm him.

original: de la 'jig rten na lha'am /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten na lha'am /
translated: No one in the world, whether a god,

original: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
analyzed: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
translated: a demon, or Brahmā,

original: sus kyang nam yang chos dang mthun par thub pa med do //
analyzed: sus kyang nam yang chos dang mthun par thub pa med do //
translated: will ever be able to defeat him in accordance with the Dharma.”

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du byang chub yid la byed pa las de'i sems rnam par g-yeng bar mi 'gyur ro; ;nam yang de dbang po ma tshang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du byang chub yid la byed pa las de'i sems rnam par g-yeng bar mi 'gyur ro; ;nam yang de dbang po ma tshang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: They will not be distracted from the attention on awakening until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening. They will never have incomplete faculties,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely

original: mig gi dbang po dang / lus kyi dbang po'i bar du ma tshang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po dang / lus kyi dbang po'i bar du ma tshang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the eye faculty, up to the body faculty.

original: nam du'ang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang po lnga dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam du'ang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang po lnga dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will never be without the five supramundane faculties.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: the faith faculty, the perseverance faculty, the mindfulness faculty, the concentration faculty, and the wisdom faculty.

original: de ni skyes bu dam pa yin no //🔽gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de ni skyes bu dam pa yin no // gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: They are holy beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar na skyes bu dam pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar na skyes bu dam pa lags /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Lord, how are bodhisattva great beings holy beings?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi sems rnam par rtog pa lnga dang / sgrib pa lnga po dag gis nam yang rdzogs pa'i byang chub las rnam par g-yeng bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi sems rnam par rtog pa lnga dang / sgrib pa lnga po dag gis nam yang rdzogs pa'i byang chub las rnam par g-yeng bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva whose mind is never distracted from complete enlightenment by the five conceptual thoughts and the five obscurations,

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skyes bu dam pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skyes bu dam pa yin te /
translated: Subhūti, such a bodhisattva mahāsattva is a holy being.

original: rab 'byor / rnam @408b pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam @408b pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva endowed with those aspects, those signs, and those marks is revealed to be irreversible.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu byang chub kyi sems de dang ldan pa ni bud med rnams 'gug par byed pa'i gsang sngags dang / sman dang / sbyar sman dang / gzhan la 'khu ba'i rang bzhin gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi sbyor zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu byang chub kyi sems de dang ldan pa ni bud med rnams 'gug par byed pa'i gsang sngags dang / sman dang / sbyar sman dang / gzhan la 'khu ba'i rang bzhin gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi sbyor zhing /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, the irreversible bodhisattva great being, always endowed with that thought of awakening, does not engage in any of those spells, medicines, and compounded medicines that attract women, or in any of those things that are by nature harmful to others.

original: srog gi phyir yang bud med 'gug pa'i thabs gang yang rung ba sbyor bar mi byed de /
analyzed: srog gi phyir yang bud med 'gug pa'i thabs gang yang rung ba sbyor bar mi byed de /
translated: Even for the sake of his life, he does not engage in any of the methods for attracting women.

original: skyes pa'am / bud med dam /
analyzed: skyes pa'am / bud med dam /
translated: He does not attract men or women,

original: khye'u'am / bu mo dag la bu phor 'gyur ro zhe'am /
analyzed: khye'u'am / bu mo dag la bu phor 'gyur ro zhe'am /
translated: boys or girls, by saying, ‘You will have a son,’

original: bu mor 'gyur ro zhe'am /
analyzed: bu mor 'gyur ro zhe'am /
translated: ‘You will have a daughter,’

original: rigs 'phan par 'gyur ro zhe'am /
analyzed: rigs 'phan par 'gyur ro zhe'am /
translated: ‘Your family will prosper,’

original: tshe ring bar 'gyur ro zhe'am /
analyzed: tshe ring bar 'gyur ro zhe'am /
translated: ‘You will have a long life,’

original: tshe thung bar 'gyur ro zhes cho 'phrul dag gis 'gug par mi byed cing su la'ang phung bar mi byed do //
analyzed: tshe thung bar 'gyur ro zhes cho 'phrul dag gis 'gug par mi byed cing su la'ang phung bar mi byed do //
translated: or ‘You will have a short life.’ He does not perform miracles to attract anyone, nor does he bring ruin to anyone.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la sems can gyi mtshan ma'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la sems can gyi mtshan ma'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na /
translated: Su­bhūti, it is because great bodhisattva beings do not consider even the attributes of sentient beings in phenomena that are empty of intrinsic defining characteristics.

original: log par 'tsho ba'i mtshan ma lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: log par 'tsho ba'i mtshan ma lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: How then could they consider the attributes of wrong livelihood?

original: sdig pa'i las rnams byed par 'gyur ba de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: sdig pa'i las rnams byed par 'gyur ba de ni gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible for them to engage in evil actions.

original: des na de'i 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa yin te /🔽rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems @409a *//
analyzed: des na de'i 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa yin te / rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems @409a *//
translated: Therefore, their livelihood is pure.

original: dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings who possess these attributes, indications, and signs are said to be irreversible.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan na phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yin par ston pa'i rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag bstan gyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan na phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yin par ston pa'i rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag bstan gyi /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, I will teach the aspects, signs, and marks that indicate that a bodhisattva great being is irreversible.

original: de dag legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zungs shig dang bshad do //
analyzed: de dag legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zungs shig dang bshad do //
translated: Listen carefully and pay attention, and I will explain them.”

original: btsun pa de ltar 'tshal lo zhes tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar mnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: btsun pa de ltar 'tshal lo zhes tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar mnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: “Very well, Lord,” the venerable Subhūti replied, and he listened as the Lord had instructed.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa ni /
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing this deep perfection of wisdom

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yid la byed pa dag dang ma bral bas phung po'i sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yid la byed pa dag dang ma bral bas phung po'i sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas /
translated: are not occupied with the application of the aggregates, because they are not separated from the mental activity of complete awakening.

original: khams dang skye mched kyi sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: khams dang skye mched kyi sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: They do not dwell in the application of the elements and sense fields.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des phung po dang khams dang skye mched stong pa nyid du legs par bsgoms pa yin zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des phung po dang khams dang skye mched stong pa nyid du legs par bsgoms pa yin zhing /
translated: Subhūti, it is because those bodhisattva great beings have well cultivated the emptiness of the aggregates, elements, and sense fields,

original: legs par yid la byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par yid la byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and have well taken it to mind.

original: de rgyal po'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: de rgyal po'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: They do not dwell in the application of the talk of kings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar de ni stong pa nyid la legs par gnas pas chos gang la'ang ngan pa'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar de ni stong pa nyid la legs par gnas pas chos gang la'ang ngan pa'am /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because, in that way, they abide in emptiness, and do not see any dharma that is inferior or

original: mchog tu gyur pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i @409b phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu gyur pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i @409b phyir ro //
translated: superior.
